I tried both the Munchkin and Safety 1st car window shades, and the suction cups either gave way when my daughter tugged them (causing the shade to fall off entirely), or she ripped the material around the bottom suction cup completely off and bent the wire towards her face (which scared me half to death!). So I began searching for alternatives to the conventional 3-suction-cup car window shades.  First, I tried the Britax 2 Pack EZ-Cling Sun Shades, Black, but the edges of the shade began to peel away from the car window in the scorching L.A. summer temperatures, and my daughter pulled it the rest of the way off.  I didn't want to try the dark-tinted window film because unless you're a professional window tint installer (which I'm not) you inevitably end up with unsightly "bubbles" between the film and the window glass, and on top of that, the film often makes it hard to roll the windows up or down.Desperate to find a workable window shade to protect my toddler from the strong L.A. sun, I did the broadest search I could think of on Amazon, and luckily, I found the Brica Smart Shade.  (I ended up buying it from a local brick-and-mortar retailer).  Because this window shade rolls up rather than down, there's no suction-cup within my little-one's reach, and the shade's roller is housed in a hard plastic casing that also makes it (toddler) tamper-proof.  That plastic casing has 2 tabs that snap securely between the window glass and the door (interior), keeping the base of the shade flush against the car door/window sill.  Then you pull up on an extremely thin but sturdy metal (not plastic) clip to unroll/extend the shade and then slip the clip over the top of the window glass.  Unlike the plastic window clips that come with most of the 3-suction-cup window shades, the metal clip on the Brica Smart Shade has such a low profile that the window rolls up easily and closes completely with the clip on.  I never roll the rear windows of my SUV down more than a couple of inches, so I can't speak to how easy it is to roll the window completely down with the Smart Shade on, but it was easy for me to crack open the car window.  And I like that the Smart Shade gives me the option to roll the shade down when I'm driving the car at night, without having to remove the shade entirely (which is a real inconvenience with the cling-type shades).The only reason I deducted a star from my rating of the Smart Shade is that it did have a bit of a "plasticky" smell when I first unpacked it from the box and unrolled the shade.  The product packaging doesn't say what material the shade is made of, but based on the smell, I think it contains some level of PVC.  PVC typically contains some pretty suspect chemicals, including phthalates, so we try to avoid exposing our little-one to it as much as possible.  But since the vast majority of the car shades sold at retail contain PVC, I'd rather risk a bit of PVC exposure over sun exposure -- and possible skin cancer -- any day.  (Plus, my car itself contains quite a bit of PVC/vinyl, so you pick your battles!).  I put the Smart Shade out on my patio to off-gas in the sun for several hours, which reduced the smell to tolerable levels.Other than the chemical smell, this product has performed as expected, and was exactly the toddler-proof car sun-protection solution I was looking for.Grade: B+

I purchased this Boppy Shopping Cart Cover to replace a lost Floppy Seat Ez Carry Shopping Cart and High Chair Cover, Blue ABC. I didn't want to spend another forty-something dollars to get another Floppy Cover, so I opted for the Boppy brand, which was substantially cheaper.  Unfortunately, this turned out to be another case of "you get what you pay for."  The back side of this shopping cart cover is made of a smooth, nylon rip-stop fabric that's extremely slippery; plus, there's no snug-fitting elastic or fabric ties to secure the cover to the shopping cart.  As a result, it's extremely easy for my 2 year-old to pull the cover off the shopping cart handle and sides, exposing the germy surfaces I don't want her to touch.  The only thing attaching the cover to the shopping cart seat is the child safety belt, but that only takes care of 1 of the 4 sides of the cover.  The other 3 sides of the cover easily slide off the shopping cart seat on their own, or with the "help" of the curious hands of a toddler/preschooler.  Since the purpose of a shopping cart cover is to serve as a barrier between your child and the dirty surfaces of a shopping cart seat, this product is virtually useless.  I'm going to return this Boppy cart cover and pony up the extra $$ for another Floppy cover.Grade: D-

A well-intentioned friend bought these Dappi waterproof pants for me when I mentioned that we were about to embark on potty training my 2 year-old.  I was immediately suspicious when I opened the gift wrapping and saw that these were "vinyl" pants, and when I cracked open the packaging, the strong chemical smell confirmed my suspicions.  These pants are made of PVC (aka, vinyl), which usually contains harmful phthalates and sometimes even lead!  (Google "toxic PVC" and you'll find a bunch of information on the toxicity of PVC/vinyl, especially for young children).  Needless to say, there's no way these vinyl pants are ever getting anywhere near my toddler's body.  (They went straight into the trash).  If you're looking for waterproof diaper-covers or potty training pants, Dappi makes some in waterproof (non-toxic) nylon.  Dappi Waterproof 100% Nylon Diaper Pants, 2 Pack, White, Large  I haven't yet tried the nylon pants myself so I can't attest to how waterproof they are, but anything is better than icky vinyl, in my book.Grade: D-

I have very kinky-curly "4c" hair, which I normally wear wash-and-go style.  I bought this Queen Helene curl reactivating spray at my local health food store because I needed a product to moisturize my 2nd day curls, and the product description said it was free of alcohol and harsh chemicals so it seemed like a good bet. I used this product twice, and both times, I was extremely unhappy with it.  It completely dried out my hair and made it "crispy" to the touch and very frizzy.  Plus, despite the fact that the product claims to be "natural," it had an unpleasant chemical smell that hung around for hours after I initially sprayed it on. The smell irritated me so much that I ended up washing my hair at night just before bed, which I normally don't do because I don't like going to sleep with wet hair. But that's how much the scent of this product bothered me.Needless to say, this product quickly ended up in my trash can. I've used and liked other Queen Helene products on my own hair and my 2 year-old daughter's hair, but I'm definitely not a fan of this curl reactivator.Grade: D

I bought this Munchkin Folding Step Stool for my 2 year-old to use in our small kitchen, so she could "help" mommy and daddy with small tasks like washing dishes, rolling cookie dough, etc.  Because our kitchen is short on space, I was really attracted to the folding feature of this stool, since I thought it could be folded flat and stowed out-of-the-way between uses.  Though this stool is no doubt sturdy and skid-proof, it is, unfortunately, also extremely difficult to close.  Folding this step stool is a two-person job (at least in our household!), because it requires 4 hands: 2 to hold the 2 spring-loaded buttons that trigger the folding mechanism, and 2 to fold in the sides of the stool.  And even then, it makes a disturbing, grinding noise.  Finally, perhaps we have exceptionally high kitchen counters, but this step-stool was too short to enable my 35-inch tall daughter to reach the counter.  When she's on this step-stool, the edge of the kitchen counter touches her nose, so she isn't high enough to perform any tasks on the counter or to have a proper view of what's going on there.If you don't need to fold your step stool often or at all, then this Munchkin step stool is a good bet.  But look elsewhere if (like me), the folding feature is important to you.  There has to be a better way to make a step stool that's difficult for toddlers to open/close, without also stumping adults!  Until Munchkin discovers it, I'll have to pass on this step stool.Grade: C-

After striking out with the pediped Grip Nikki Sandal (Toddler), I decided to give these Pediped Flex Vivian sandals a try since my 2 year-old still needed a pair of sandals for the summer, and we like the brand in general.  Unlike the size 7 Nikki sandals, which were too long and ill-fitting, these Vivian size 7 sandals fit my little girl right out of the box.  In less than 10 seconds, she was off and running, with none of the tripping/falling that we'd experienced with the other sandals.  The Vivians are super-cute and go well with a variety of outfits.  The three crystals are securely sewed into the front center strap of each sandal, so I'm not concerned that my toddler could pull them out.  And each crystal has a silver glitter border, which gives the sandals a nice, extra dash of pizzazz.  Perfect for dressing up or dressing down.  Plus, like all Pediped shoes, these Vivian sandals are accepted by the American Podiatric Medical Association, so I know they're good for my daughter's foot development.Grade: A

I purchased this LeapFrog Touch Magic Discovery Town for my daughter's second birthday.  She's always trying to get her hands on Mommy's iPad, so I thought she'd like the touchscreen aspect of this toy.  However, she grew bored with it after about 5 minutes. Not that I could blame her.  There's really not that much to this toy, especially given what it costs.  If you tap a few areas on either of the 2 pages, the toy's computer-voice tells you what you're touching, and then plays the sound it makes.  (There's also an option to play a very limited selection of music).  That's about it.  What's more, this toy also frustrated my daughter because the touchscreen function isn't very sensitive.  In fact, it took me a few tries at pressing pretty hard to get some of the touchscreen items to respond!  Plus, there were many other pictures on the screen that my toddler kept wanting to press in order to hear the voice/sounds, and she was very disappointed when she would press a picture and nothing happened.  And, as you might imagine, it was impossible to explain to a 2 year-old why she would get the voice/sounds when she pressed one picture, but nothing when she pressed another picture.  Since toys are supposed to be fun and not annoying, this one is being returned.Grade: C
Easy to install and add a grab for getting into a lifted Jeep. They also offer a grab for stability in the cabin when climbing over rocks.

Don't know that I really NEEDED these for my Rubicon, but the old non-adjustable bolts were rusted. These were easy to install. I had an alignment done after building the Jeep, but don't know if they used these in that process or not.
Bought to use with a new LED light in my home office. Works great and is consistent with the other switches in the house.
Solid and well built product. I expect this to last for many years.

Well built and good looking product. I just used my old door as a template for cutting the hole in the new door, but, I didn't notice the front part of this pull is not as high as the sides, so there was a gap. The old pull was the same size all around. I used calked to fill, but make sure you note the difference. Admittedly, had I read the instructions, I'm sure I would have cut a correct hole.

Bought these for the wife to use while stretching the lace shawls she knits. She uses pins to hold the shawls and loves using this product. After removing the pins, there's no visible damage to the mats.

Replaced  four 100w incandescent bulbs in my security lights and I'm very pleased. The output of these lights is more focused and greater than my old bulbs, while saving on energy usage. Highly recommended.
Used this to convert significant surface rust on the used Jeep I bought. It's pretty amazing what it does. I completely sprayed the frame and axles and now they look almost new. Well worth the cost.

The small footprint of this CB made it possible for me to install it in the center console of my '03 Rubicon. It has great range compared to my last CB. I have it hooked up to a 3 foot Firestick and have no problems. I have an external speaker that I'm going to mount and hook up as it's sometimes hard to hear the unit inside the console.
Awesome product. Used with a pressure washer and soap cannon, it leaves the vehicles clean and shiny. There's a very noticeable difference between this and the local car wash.

My Ryobi 3100 PSI pressure washer has an onboard soap tank that's supposed to self activate when the multi-function spray head is set to one of the 2 soap settings. But, I tried 3 different soaps and never got a single hint of suds. I purchased this soap cannon hoping it would fit and work. The Ryobi has a quick disconnect for the 1/4 inch adapter that comes with the cannon, so install was easy. I tried it yesterday and was blown away by the amount of suds that covered the cars. I initially had it on the maximum soap setting and got a very thick layer of suds that completely coated every inch of what ever I pointed at. I adjusted the soap level to minimum and still got great coverage. I used Chemical Guys Max Suds II and got excellent cleaning and shine results. After sudsing the cars, I popped the cannon off the wand and replaced the stock Ryobi multi-function head, then powered the suds away. I'd highly recommend this product for anyone who has a pressure washer.
Perfect fit for the Wrangler. I expect it to last a very long time.
Works well and makes airing down much easier. There are more expensive Staun models out there, but they don't work any better.

Looks great and is well built. The bull bar has holes drilled on the underside right above where it meets the bumper. I wish there were also holes under the fog light mounting plates so I could run the wires for the lights inside. Other than that, the winch mounted easily and the bumper bolted right on to the Jeep.
Second Jeep I've installed this on because it works great and is durable. My lift kit came with new track bar and drop bracket. Not wanting the bracket, I ordered this instead.

Great product for the shower. When I designed our new shower, I didn't want to include a fixed bench because of the space it would take up. This little corner bench works great and looks great as well. The adjustable feet makes it super easy to level in on the sloped floor of the shower.

This hangs in our new frameless glass enclosed shower. We use it to wipe the glass after each shower before getting out and it helps to keep the glass clear and reduces the number of times we have to clean the glass. All fixtures are oil rubbed bronze, so this color works great.
Great product with super power. I used it to break MANY rusty bolts loose on my Jeep Wrangler during a complete upgrade. There is no way I could have done it without this tool.

It's surprising how much power this little unit puts out. I bought it for my wife after we were in an accident caused by a drunk driver and were injured. Regular use helps her with muscle and nerve pain, but she has to be careful not to turn it up too high.

This unit replaced an older wifi HP model that had never really worked via wifi. It was easy to set up and, so far has worked well. There have been a couple of times where I had to pull the power to reset before it would print over wifi. I'm glad the ink cartridges are relatively affordable as they run out VERY fast.
The wife wanted this for Valentines and loves everything about it.
The raised bottom design of this pan makes it easy to get cakes off of it. It also has not leaked after several uses. It's a much needed upgrade to my old springform pans.
The design and function of this spatula is perfect. It's quickly become one of my favorite cooking utensils.

I saw spaetzle being made on a cooking show and immediately ordered this to make it myself. This product is heavy duty, easy to use, is no problem to clean up and looks like it will last a long time. It does not come with a recipe for the dough, but a quick internet search brings up limitless options. I highly recommend this.
This works as it's described and does help improve visibility on small patterns when knitting. However, it's pretty short. I'd like to see a longer one.

I bought this to cover the window of my Xterra. Size was a consideration and this one was large enough for the job. Unfortunately, I didn't have need of it until after the 30 day limit for return set by Amazon. After it's first use, I went to remove the elastic strap around the mirror, at which point it separated from the screen. This rendered the screen useless. This is obviously a defective product. I don't know if this is the case with all of them, but cannot recommend this screen. I gave 2 stars instead of 1 because it did keep snow and ice off the window.My order was fulfilled by Amazon, but sold by Tool Deals. I just contacted the seller and their initial response is less than satisfactory. I'll update when I get a final outcome.UPDATETool Deals stood behind their product and provided a refund through Amazon. Very pleased with them.

I originally ordered a Lithonia Lighting FMDCGL 16 20840 BZ M4 17-Inch 4000K LED Cut Glass Flush Mount with Patterned Acrylic Diffuser, Bronze. UPS showed it delivered, but it never actually arrived at my house. I reported this to Amazon and true to their INCREDIBLE customer service model, a replacement order was placed within 5 minutes of sending my email. When the replacement arrived, the box was labelled correctly, but the light inside was this Lithonia FMSATL 16 20840 in a brushed nickel finish. Not wanting to prolong this mistake, I installed the light. It looks much better than the one I ordered even though it's the wrong color. The light output is VERY bright at full setting. I had also purchased a dimmer with my original order and keep it at about 60% unless doing work. I may repaint it in the bronze finish, but overall am very happy with the light.
These are good cases and are well made. They fit great and feel good in the hand. I didn't give 5 stars because the material seems to catch a lot of particles and needs cleaning often.

I have an older pair of DMX shoes, but needed a darker color for work. These were hard to find and sold out in most places. I'm glad I was able to locate them here. I spend 12 hrs a day on my feet and don't have the pains I had with other shoes while ending the day with more energy. I hope Reebok continues the line.
Necessary cable if you want to program your radios. I had to find an old computer with the proper port for the cable and the software is so 1980s, but that's all on Motorola.

Nice product, but my only complaint would be that everything is a little small. My cat is a 6 month old kitten, and he barely fits in the little house, and hes already too big for the hammock.The Cat Tree has lots of nice scratching posts, and lots of places for kitty to sit. I was hoping the tree would keep him from climbing on other furniture, but its become his launching pad to other furniture.The Cat Tree is covered in a very soft fake fur, or sisal rope for scratching, and has quite a large foot print. The tree is a little wobbly no matter how much you tighten the components, but it would really take some doing to topple it over.The worst part of this Cat Tree is the directions; they are horrible. Some reviewers have stated not to start from the top, as stated in the directions, but to start from the bottom; that would be a mistake. If you start from the bottom and work up, you will not be able to secure the top shelf to the unit. You must start from the top and work down. Believe me, I tried to assemble the tree as recommended by some of the reviewers, and ended up having to take it apart and start over.This is a nice tree if you have the space, and the cat loves it, so I would definitely recommend it.

I am completely disappointed with this software. I cannot get either of these programs to work. I am using a very up to date computer' with an i5 processor' and they still will not work.I installed both Photoshop Elements, which I always use and love, and Premiere Elements. After installing both programs I tried to open them. You immediately get a "Sign in Required" screen, but there is no where to sign in. The screen tries for minutes to connect to the internet, but always fails. I have turned off my firewall, and antivirus software, but I still receive and error message asking me to connect to the internet, which I am already connected to. I spent an hour Googling possible solutions, and have been to the Adobe site and tried their solutions. The programs still will not work.I signed in to the Adobe site thinking it might read the sign it, but it still wants me to connect to the internet and sign in.  I am ready to uninstall the software. Very disappointed

So far so good. I have a love hate relationship with shredders. I love them, and use one all the time, but they always get dull, or burn out. This is a powerful shredder that is amazingly quite.The shredder comes with a good size basket so you don't need to empty it every few minutes. I love the handle on top, it make moving the shredder a breeze, because it does have a little weight to it.The top securely locks to the basket, so no chance of mishaps.This shredder works great, and appears to be built of sturdy stuff. I would definitely recommend you give this shredder tr, if you are in the marker for one.

The Whim Bar Mops are a  thinner than I'd expected for a bar towel; you can see through them. They are absorbent, but can't imagine getting too much wear out of them. I think the towels are definitely over priced for the quality of the product. I'd head to the Dollar store, and get 12 towels for half the price. The quality might even be higher.

I use a humidifier every winter to fight off the dryness in the house, but I have always wanted a Vicks Vaporub model. I grew up using Vicks rub and inhalers for colds, flu, bronchitis, and every other winter malady, and I still do. When this Vicks Sweetdreams Cool Mist Humidifier arrived I couldn't wait to slide in the vapopads, and crank it up. Ahhhhh...sweet relief for my nose.The Vicks Sweetdreams Cool Mist Humidifier is about the same size as a standard humidifier, but has the added benefit of being able to use Vicks Vapopads for added relief.The humidifier has an easy to fill opening on the bottom, and an adjustable mist dial. This model does not have a filter, so cleaning once a week will be necessary.The night light feature is cute, but not necessary in my household.This model appears to be built well, has easy operation, and cleaning, and is very quite to run. I would definitely recommend.

Another beautiful watch by Invicta. This a large face watch, but it is very feminine looking on your wrist. As with all Invicta watches, it is very well made, and very substantial. The watch is quite heavy, and not really made for a small or petite wrist. The wrist bands always run large, and must have links removed.The Invicta Women's 21408 Wildflower Analog Display is a two tone, rose gold and silver watch, with quartz accents. The watch does have a date display, but without the magnification window, you can't read it without your glasses on.This is a lovely watch for work or casual wear.

I was pleasantly surprised at how nice this pan is. The pan is very solid, heats evenly, and cooks great. I had a very expensive version of this pan that bowed in the middle, but this pan appears to be of a much better quality. I am very happy with the pan and use it all the time.

The Amped Wireless TITAN-EX, High Power AC1900 Wi-Fi Range Extender is an easy to install, and a simple solution for extending your Wi-Fi coverage in your home or office. The range extender is great for all those weak coverage, or dead zones around the house.Installation of the TITAN-EX High Power AC1900 Wi-Fi Range Extender is simple using their Signal Strength LED indicator light.  The device lets you know when its placed in the best location, for best coverage, and performance. Now my Wi-Fi coverage is as strong in my basement, as it is in my office. My coverage also now extends to my back yard. The Wi-Fi extender comes with dual band coverage, so you can connect your devices on both the 2.4 GHz and the 5 GHz bands.This is a great gadget, and really a necessity if you want flawless coverage throughout your home. This Amped Wireless TITAN-EX, High Power AC1900 Wi-Fi Range Extender is not a plug into the wall style extender, and you will need a flat surface to put the device on. The TITAN does not have a small footprint, so hiding it is a little difficult.The device has four high gain, dual band antennas screwed into the back of the device, and does resemble a router. It comes equipped with a 1 GHz dual-core processor, 14 high-powered amplifiers, 4 high-gain antennas, and 5 gigabit Ethernet ports to plug in your TV or game console or other devices. This is a great solution for homes with multiple users accessing the Internet at the same time.The device works great, the speed is excellent and set up could not be easier. I would highly recommend this device.

I have used this product for about three years and I think it is terrific. I have color treated hair and this product has really kept my hair in great shape. As you get older your hair get dryer, add color every month, and you can end up with straw, but not with this Keratindose. This product leave your hair feeling soft and silky every time you wash it. Be careful not to over apply in one application, because it will make your hair greasy if you use too much. If you have dry brittle hair, that is prone to split ends, this is the best product ever.

The Black & Decker D3040 Allure Digital Iron is a nice iron, but not a great iron. Some reviewers thought the iron was light weight, but I think it is very heavy for the size of the sole plate. The iron has a small foot print.The water tank is a dark color, which make it very hard to check the water level. The iron does produce a good volume of steam which I like, but it also spits, which I don't like.Don't get too excited about the digital component, the iron uses a light to select the temperature setting; no big whoop.I do like the rotating cord, which helps keep your cord out of the way.The iron heats evenly, and works very well. Not the best iron I've ever used, but certainly not the worst.If you like a substantial iron with some weight to it, and you don't mind a little spit, this could be the iron for you.
My cat loves NUTRO cat food which makes him very happy. Unfortunately, the price of NUTRO food does not make me happy.

I love Invicta watches. I have had an Invicta watch for a few years now, and it is the best watch I have ever owned. Invicta makes a quality product, which you can see and feel, as soon as you pick up the watch.There are no cheap watch bands, or clasps on these watches, and the weight and feel of the watch is wonderful. The only problem I have with this watch, is that it is VERY masculine looking on your wrist. It is a beautiful watch, but it looks like you are wearing a man's watch, which is not really my style.I do like the larger faced sports watches, because they are much easier to read, but the combination of size, and styling on this watch makes it look like a mans watch.One reviewer stated her Invicta Women's 21494 Wildflower Analog watch had luminous hands, but my watch did not come with this feature.If you want a top quality watch, buy and Invicta, but if you're looking for a watch that appears a little more feminine, you might want to choose another style.

Wow! This is an incredible piece of electronics, with outstanding sound, but not for the faint of heart. This Yamaha YSP-1600 MusicCast Sound Bar can do so many things I haven't had a chance to try them all.  This sound bar allows you to stream music from free and subscription-based services like Pandora, Rhapsody, and Spotify Connect. Using the free MusicCast app, you can control playback from your Android or iOS smart device.  I am using this sound bar for my flat screen TV, and let me say again the sound is amazing. The MusicCast sound bar operates on your wireless system and will support 10 zones. It's AMAZING! The only con I see is the price, $499.95. Ouch! That is a real commitment price. For anyone in the market for a Multi-room, digital audio system with outstanding sound, this Yamaha YSP-1600 MusicCast Sound Bar won't disappoint.
This mat does not work well at all. I have had these foam mats before, but because the holes are spaced differently, this mat slides all over the tub with you on it; very scary.
This Proctor Silex chopper is the perfect food processor for small jobs. I have had 2 or 3 different brands of these food choppers that did not chop well , but this one works very well.

This Black & Decker 16" corded chainsaw is the perfect tool for use around the yard. My guess is it would struggle to cut through anything big that came down in the yard, but it certainly works great for all the smaller cleanup. The CS1216 only weighs 10 pounds, which makes it a chainsaw you can actually handle without being a professional.The chainsaw does arrive needing to be assembled, but it is a no tool assembly, that went together with no problems, in very little time. I like that the CS1216 has a clear view oil monitor; no more running dry, or stopping to check the oil level.The most important thing to me, is that the chainsaw cuts very well, very smooth, without a lot of kickback, which makes it easy to control. I would definitely recommend this chainsaw for small to medium cleanup around the yard.

I have mature skin, in my 50's, and found that the #10 translucent powder made the lines, and wrinkles on my face appear more prominent. Highlighting my lines and wrinkles was not the look I was going for. I also have very fair skin, and most of the powder shades were a little too dark for me. I loved the #20 blush, and #30 bronzer. I would definitely purchase the blush, and bronzer again.
My cat LOVES Nutro food. I received a trial case a few months back, and now he won't eat anything but this food. I'm thrilled the cat like the food, but I do think it is very overpriced
Thank goodness NBC bought the rights to The Bourbon Kings. Let's hope that means she won't write another book in the series. Very disappointing.
This is a great long handled, adjustable scoop, but it doesn't let you dig down to the bottom of the litter box. It sure does save your back.

These are great pet dishes, and this is the perfect size for the cat. The dish is stainless steel, and a breeze to wash. It has a non skid rubber strip on the bottom to keep it from sliding around. I bought two dishes, and would definitely buy more.

This is a fully adjustable, plastic covered cable speed rope. The rope works great, but it came with a wave in it from being shipped rolled up. I have it hanging straight to try and take the wave out. My only con, would be that the handles are too small. The handles work fine, but I think if they were a bit larger, they would be easier to hold on to. For the price of this Amazon Basic speed rope, this is a great deal, and a good quality product.

I love how thin, and light weight this scale is. I am not a fan of the faux marble, I think it's ugly.The most important features of a scale, are that the scale is accurate, consistent, and easy to read and this scale is all of the above. The scale does not work well on any type of carpet, but on a stable floor it is great. I would definitely purchase another Taylor scale, but not this pattern.

I usually stay away from facial masks, because I have very sensitive skin, and they always irritate it. After reading the reviews I decided to give this product a try, and I was very pleased. I followed the directions and only left the product on for two minutes. My skin felt refreshed, tighter, and had a healthy glow. The product is a little pricey, but I would purchase it again.

Love this product! AHAVA Dead Sea Mud Intensive Foot Cream really does work miracles. After 2 applications I can see a remarkable difference in my feet. My cracked heels are looking, and feeling much better. I do use Baby Foot products twice a year for intensive care, but I have been looking for a good product to use for upkeep. This looks like the product I've been looking for.

Very nice hand cream. The cream is thick and soothing, and leaves your skin feeling very soft. I do think the cream is a little greasy, and leaves a light residue, but the product works well. I am only giving it 4 stars because I do not care for the scent.

When I gave the first treat to my cat, he spit it out, looked at it, and then me and I thought that was it for the After staring at it for a few more seconds, he tried it again slowly, and has decided he can't live without them. Beg, cry, pace and repeat. They are cat approved.
This is a good quality product at a reasonable price. I have used vitamin D3 for some time, and the brand I have been using is comparable in price and quality.

The top does not stay open like in the photo, and is always collapsed. I've tried everything to keep the top up so the cat will use it, but it scares him when the top falls down on him. The product is very small.
Very nice peach color. The polish is thin, but coats evenly. Two coats cover very well and last a good 7 days.

From "Russia Without Love," is Stephen Templins newest addition in his Special Operations Group Thriller series.The story follows heroes Chris, Hannah, and Sonny, on the trail of a kidnapped Chief of Staff's son-in-law. The book is a fast paced, nail-biting addition to the military fiction genre, which you cannot put down.As with all Templin's thrillers, the stakes are high, the road is full of misdirection, and the action is always high octane, and authentic.Stephen Templin is a solid writer, who writes sharp, believable dialogue, and intriguing stories. He paints his scenes with words, to bring foreign locals, and the action to life on the page.From "Russia Without Love," should definitely be on the TOP of your to-be-read pile.

This is one of the most difficult reviews I've had to write. I am so torn about whether I really like this laptop, or not. I've been using this Toshiba Satellite C55-C5241 for two weeks. Performance wise, I have had very few issues with it. When I first started using the laptop, it would freeze up, and I would have to reboot. Fortunately, that issue appears  to have corrected itself, and is now operating perfectly.The laptop is speedy, but as you would expect for the money, it is a basic model. My real complaints are with the keyboard, and housing. I've never had a laptop that came in a plastic housing; it's like playing with a Fisher Price toy. The keyboard is very soft, and the track pad is challenging. It's really hard to believe that this laptop will last for any length of time. But to be fair, considering the price point on this laptop, it has a lot going for it, and I have not seen anything that can equal it. So if your interested in a good, low cost, workhorse, this computer might fit the bill.

This is a nice medium weight cargo short, with a comfort elastic waist. The are very well made, but are a little roomy through the seat and legs. They washed and dried very well, with minimal shrinkage. No need to iron them if removed from the dryer immediately.

This is a nice medium weight cargo pant. I thought they were well made, with all the seams straight and secure. They pant washed very well with out an excessive amount of shrinking.  If you remove them from the dryer immediately, they do not need to be ironed.
This is the only toy that will occupy my cat for hours. Well worth the price.
This is a great litter box. The high sides prevent litter from being kicked over the sides or any peeing over the side. I like it so much I ordered a second one. Very reasonably priced.

This is my first time using dry shampoo, and I was very pleasantly surprised. Not only did it refresh my hair, but it gave it great body, and fullness. The shampoo left my hair smelling fresh, and looking great. I would purchase it again.

A nice lotion with a light smell. Leaves your skin feeling smooth and soft, without a greasy feeling. Blends well under makeup. I have only used this product for a short time, but it does appear to plump fine lines, but I have not noticed any improvement with my dark spots. Reasonably priced, nice lotion with SPF 20. I would recommend this product.

A very nice basic Dell logo 15 inch neoprene sleeve. The sleeve is nice looking, and very well made. The sleeve is made for minimal protection to carry your laptop. It might prevent scratches while to tote your laptop, but it will not prevent damage from a drop or a hard bump..
This is an excellent cat scratching post. I was surprised at how heavy, and well made it is The cats can go at this post without any worry of wobbling, or tipping over. Very good choice for your cat.

This is not a bag I would usually choose, but I think I am sold. This is a great multi-purpose bag. The bag is strong, so nothing pokes out the sides, and the cinch ties are fairly sturdy. These bags are great for trash, but are terrific for storage. I love that the bags are clear, and you can actually find what you've stored.  I will definitely buy these bags again.
The product was received with out all its parts, making it impossible to assemble the product for use.

I thought this product was a very nice deep conditioning product for my dry, and course hair. I liked the scent, although it is a little strong. I would vary the amount of product you use by the length of your hair. I have shoulder length hair, so I did not require the full amount. Recommending these products is always tricky, because everyone's hair is different. For me this is a nice product that produced a nice result; soft, silky hair.

Remington D8700 TStudio PROtect Dryer is an Ionic ceramic conditioning dryer. The dryer comes with a replaceable conditioning ring, which I have never seen before. I have been a fan of Ionic dryers for some time, and the Remington D8700 is a very good choice. This is an 1875 watt dryer, so drying time is much quicker, which will help decrease hair damage. The dryer has 3 heat and 2 speed settings, and a cool shot button.  Most good hair dryers come standard with these features. The dryer also comes with a variety of tools, such as a diffuser, concentrator, and a micro conditioning hair brush.My hair dried very fast for a humid day, and my hair had a nice shine when I finished. The dryer isn't overly heavy, but I like my dryers a little lighter, and smaller. I gave the dryer 4 stars because I think the dryer is a little too big, and difficult to handle. The dryer certainly works very well. So if you don't mind a big dryer, I would definitely recommend this Remington D8700.

These pot holders are okay for the stove, but not for the oven. The potholders are a light to medium weight, and don't provide enough protection when taking pans out of a hot oven. They are fine for removing pots from the stove.

Very nice moisturizer with a light scent. I love the spray nozzle on this product; what a great idea. It's so nice not to have to fool around with a cap and the spray goes just where you want it to. I never have much faith in these moisturizers, because they usually just mask the dryness. This spray really left my skin feeling silky smooth and soft, and it absorbs into your skin immediately, so no greasy left over feeling. Nice product, I would purchase it again.

I feel foolish saying I love these lights, but I LOVE these lights. I purchased two for my back yard and now I want about six more. These lights produce a lot of light for their size. The sensors work great, and pick up anything passing by immediately. They certainly were easy to install; just stick them on, and add a screw for extra support if needed. If you have some crazy spot that needs light and don't have electrical running through that area, these are the way to go. Now, if they only last through a New England winter, I will be over the moon.

The Remington AC2015C TStudio Silk AC Professional Hair Dryer is a standard full size hair dryer. It has two setting and three speeds, and a great cool shot that really works. I tend to go through hair dryers very quickly, so I am always hesitant to try a new brand. If I find a hair dryer that works well and lasts, I usually stick with it.I have a Babyliss Pro hair dryer right now that I just love, but this Remington might just take its place. The Remington is a lightweight, easy to use and handle dryer, which dried my hair much faster in humid weather. I was really impressed.The only con I have for this dryer is that the cord needs to be longer, so I would give it 4  stars. This Remington is a great choice if you are looking for a new dryer.

A very nice Dove body wash with a citrus floral scent. The consistency of the wash is a little thin, but it had great lather and left my skin feeling very soft. I have sensitive skin, and I did not have any reaction to the wash. Even though the wash left my skin soft, it did not help with any dry skin. Very nice wash if you like scent.

I bought these to put in a pair of strappy sandals so my toes did not pinch and they work GREAT! I wasn't aware they made such small pads and these will work in any shoe that has a spot that pinches or rubs. The pads are not bulky so they don't take up much room. Your shoes will still fit properly. These are my new favorite shoe fix.
Just the right weight and they work well.

I had only recently downsized the size of my phone case because I just couldn't stand the bulk anymore. It seemed to defeat the purpose of a slim phone to add a monster case to it. This case not only adds to the bulk of the phone, but to the weight. Because of the battery charger, which is a really nice feature, it almost doubles the weight of the phone, and adds an additional 2 inches in length. The case certainly has some very nice features. I love the blue color of the case, and it is very well made. The camera shutter is a nice feature if youre afraid someone will hack into your phone. The buttons all work very well and loosen up with use. The Vysk EP1 Privacy Charging Case is a very functional and quality made case. If youre looking for added protection from your phone case this would be a good choice.

Very nice electric razor. I was going to keep it for my legs, but Dad said no way, and stole the razor for himself. It's very light weight, but well made and rugged. The razor is very easy and quick to charge, and dad loves the fact that the charge remaining is displayed on the front of the razor. Dad has a very course beard, so he usually has to saw away at it, but this handles his beard very well. The razor comes with a nice trimmer on the side, a small travel bag, a dual head cleaning brush, and a blade guard. Dad gives it two thumbs up, or 4 stars; he's not really thrilled with the charging stand, because it's not very stable, but other than that it a winner.

This table cloth was much nicer quality than I expected. Although I don't really like polyester, this is a very nice table cloth. It is a very pleasant blue color, and it ironed up like a dream. This is a quality product with straight stitching and no hanging threads.
Not all tub stoppers are a like. Another great OXO product!

I bought the Japanese version because the American version was sold out. Since I have used the product before, I was not worried about not being able to read the directions. If you have never used Baby Foot, you should buy the American version so you can read the directions. I didn't think the Japanese version had the nice fragrance of the American version. I puchased the large size, which was a mistake, because they were much too big for a ladies size 9. For best results, soak your feet in warm water and dry them off, before you begin the treatment. If you continue to soak your feet every night you will get better results.

I love this product, and I use it every year. The city snow plow really makes a mess of the edge of my front lawn. I've tried putting up flags and reflectors, but the plow still manages to hit the lawn. Every spring I  buy a bag of Scotts Lawn Repair Mix and get to work. It is really very easy to use, even for us amatuers. I rake up the dead grass, rough up the soil, spread the Lawn Repair Mix, and water faithfully. Once the grass take hold I usually add some additional grass seed and lawn fertilizer, to make sure it take root.  Simple.

This cover is terrific! This is a much higher quality product than you will ever find at any of the big box stores. I love the handles because the cover is very heavy and would be hard to handle without them. The wind straps were a great addition so your not chasing this thing across the yard in a wind storm. I know one customer said the cover wasn't waterproof but I haven't had an issue with that. I would highly recommend this cover.

I have never used a cleansing oil on my face, and the word "oil" and my face, just don't seem like a good match. Well was I surprised! Yes, it is like applying baby oil to your face, but once you lather it up and wash it off your skin feels amazing. This cleansing oil leave your face hydrated and looking fantastic. Even though I have mature skin, my face will break out if I use certain products. I thought for sure I'd have a breakout because my skin is so sensitive, but it never happened. No matter what L'Occitane product I have used on my face, I have never broken out and that is amazing. If my skin looks and feels so good after only a few applications, I can't wait to see what everyday use will produce.

This stuff is crazy. I do wish I had read some of the reviewers helpful hints before using this product; I think I would have had a better result. I had an okay result, so I am going to use the product again. I think the key to a great result is soaking your feet through the whole process. When I received my box of Baby Foot, it was very cold from being on the delivery truck. I should have waited for the product to warm to room temperature. This time around, I am also going to soak my feet in warm water before putting on the booties. It took about four days before my feet started to peel, and it was over in a week. Your feet look great and are very soft. I would definitely recommend this product if you're okay with all the peeling.

Back in the day, Oregon Trail was one of the best games around. But thanks to a lack of updates and no technical support, this program will not run on the vast majority of computers (even in legacy or compatibility modes). Sad but true. If you have an old 486 running Windows 95, you can probably play Oregon Trail. Otherwise, wagons ho to elsewhere for you.

I remember a long time ago, when I was asked to provide my Social Security number on a company's form. I asked why they wanted my SSN, and I was met with a suspicious look that said "He's up to something!" followed by a lame explanation of why they wanted it and what they would do with it. Sadly, it took the investigation into the logistics behind the 9/11 attacks to bring to the forefront issues like identity theft, promiscuous use of identification such as the SSN, and other matters related to privacy. But even now inquiring why your SSN is being requested can put you in the category of "trouble-makers."Today, awareness of one's privacy (or lack thereof) is more important than ever. To many people, it seems like an unreachable goal, or something that is too hard to achieve and so not worth bothering with. This book breaks it down into digestible pieces that will help you bolster your privacy no matter what level of technical knowledge you already possess. Rob Robideau provides guidance for the novice and the expert alike. In an age when many people are cranking out horrible snake oil meant to cash in on the privacy craze without really helping anyone, Robideau writes clearly and concisely, bringing his advice to life with real-world examples of the issues at hand, how to implement solutions for them, and how doing so will benefit you. He is someone who obviously cares about the right to privacy and enjoys sharing his experiences and knowledge.The amount of data being harvested every day about you, your habits, your activities is stunning. Robideau's book will help you understand how it's being done and how to put a stop to it. I urge you to buy this and then follow its advice.

Unintimidated? Scott Walker has some nerve to write a book with that title. Walker is one of the most cowardly politicians I've ever seen. He has surrounded himself with yes men who pat him on the back and encourage his delusional thinking. Reading this book is like a trip to some sort of alternate universe where up is down. He (or whoever ghost-wrote this book) cites many facts and statistics, but if you look closely you can see that they are strung together after the fact to support his already-reached premise. Another item to note is Walker's reliance throughout on the pronoun "we" when talking about victories and accomplishments. This mysterious (or perhaps royal) "we" further diminishes his credibility. Walker's belief that state-level politics are some sort of bellwether is preposterous, and his over-reliance on straw men (e.g. unions) gets quite tedious after awhile. It's typically shameless of Walker to have something like this published under his name. If you're looking for something that simply re-affirms your point of view, this book is for you. Otherwise, try a different book.

These are decent potholders. They did shrink a little bit when I washed them but not significantly. I have used them on dishes fresh out of the oven and they provide adequate heat protection along with a good grip. Reasonably happy with them, especially at the price I paid.

On this 50th anniversary of the assassination of John Kennedy, it's a shame to read such a surprisingly sloppy book as this one. The author is deservedly known for some rather good books about Abraham Lincoln, but this one seems like it didn't go through the normal editing and fact-checking process. Passages are repeated, the chronology jumps all over and does not flow in anything approaching a linear manner, and some very basic facts (such as who painted the Sistine Chapel) are incorrect. I can't tell whether the author rushed to get this to print in time for the 50th anniversary, or if he is just being sloppy. At a few points an over-use of pronouns makes it difficult to even track who Swanson is writing about. I'm really surprised by the quality of this book.

This is a really good compilation of Eric Clapton's most famous tracks. The sound quality is adequate while not outstanding - these are not remasters if you're curious about that. I would have included a few other tracks - notably Let It Rain. But it's a pretty decent set of EC's work. Good for the price, and a good introduction to his work if you need that or want to introduce someone else to some of his masterpieces.

The is one of the best live Jimi Hendrix releases yet. The sound quality is outstanding, particularly for a recording from 45 years ago (hard to believe it's been that long). The mastering is gorgeous. And the performance itself is stunning. The band is tight, with Mitch and Noel grooving along with Jimi's one-of-a-kind guitar playing. Not a bad track on the disc. It's hard to pick the "best tracks" from a disc this good. I guess I would say that "Fire" and "Hey Joe" are stand-outs, but the other tracks are amazing as well. A sonic boom from 1968. Enjoy!

I had a feeling that I would find these beans sub-par, and I was right. One clue to a bean's quality is whether or not they rely on a gimmicky name. Beans like this put a lot of effort into their "catchy" name and too little effort into roasting quality beans. Another clue is the age of the beans when received - and these beans were months old. Also be aware that the beans are very oily and not appropriate for use in a super-automatic espresso machine. They will gum up the grinder with their oiliness. Finally, I found the taste pretty poor, with a very disappointing crema.

This is the latest in a long line of terrible programs bearing the McAfee name. This program will not protect your computer very effectively at all. It doesn't do what it claims to. The program's virus, malware, and rootkit detection rates are poor. The only thing this program really does effectively is to eat up lots of your computer's resources, dragging your system performance down. Avoid.

I knew Mike Tyson has had a rough life, but this book is...grueling. I had not idea just how gritty his life has been,. But I also found the book well worth reading. Just as he did in the ring, Iron Mike pulls no punches in documenting his life - the rough upbringing that led to a life of petty crime, the father figure he never had found in Cus D'Amato, the terrible manipulations of Don King, and most of all the inner demons that Tyson tried (and often failed) to exorcise time after time. Tyson seems to have matured quite a bit as of this writing, which is great to witness, and his words actually carry a very authentic wisdom. The writing is compelling - I read this in just two sessions. It's not for everybody, some people probably won't like it (or won't be able to stomach it), but this book is exactly as advertised: Undisputed Truth.

I got these for my wife, who has a hard time finding jeans that she likes and that fit "right." These jeans are high quality, and most importantly she finds them comfortable to wear and flattering to her figure. They're holding up very well after several washings, both in terms of the strength of the fabric and its color. She says the cut is "just right", which has been her major frustration with most other brands of jeans. We'll be sticking with Levi's for her jeans from now on.

This classic comedy is even better in this much-needed high definition upgrade. Bill Murray, Ted Knight, and Rodney Dangerfield are at the peak of their comedic brilliance in this ensemble tale of a golf resort, a gopher, and...do I really need to recap the plot for you? If you haven't seen Caddyshack before, see it now. And if you have seen it in one of its standard definition or (shock) a pan and scan video release, you need to see this HD version to fully experience the laughter. Even Chevy Chase, who I don't normally care for, is funny in Caddyshack. The quality of this version is significantly better (don't expect Criterion Collection quality, but it's quite good). The colors are better, and the full picture can be seen throughout. And Carl Spackler's bungalow has never looked better. In the immortal words of Jean Paul Sartre, 'Au revoir, gopher'.

I compared the results of these tests to the results of a strip test, and these are (not surprisingly) much more accurate than the paper strip test results. You do need to read and follow the instructions, but if you're serious about knowing the condition of your aquarium water, this kit is an essential component in your tookit.

The BeanSafe is perfect for storing coffee beans. It's simple and yet does the job of keeping air out of the beans. Just flip the four latches up to open it, pour your beans in, and secure the four latches. Other products like this have valves that require replacement after awhile, but not the BeanSafe. On opening it, the wonderful smell of coffee beans comes wafting out. I also like that the product is made of food grade BPA free polypropylene.

First made available overseas in 1964 as a tribute to our fallen President, it is very nice to see this released domestically on DVD. From inauguration to burial, this film covers JFK's presidency with remarkably high-quality (and often color) footage. His speeches still have an intensely haunting quality to them, nearly fifty years after his death. and the phases of Kennedy's New Frontier are presented more or less sequentially. This was produced not long after Kennedy's assassination, so a certain amount of lionizing is natural. However, the film on balance does a very nice job of capturing JFK's time in office - a time when America's hopes seemed so achievable. Gregory Peck does an excellent job of narrating, and the soundtrack is beautiful. If you are looking for a great primer on the administration of JFK, this is an excellent candidate for the job.

Last week it was time to change the batteries in our smoke alarms and carbon monoxide detectors. Ordering these from Amazon was quite a bit cheaper than buying them in the store. The package I received were all manufactured just a few months ago, so no expiration worries here. Remember to change the batteries in your smoke alarms and carbon monoxide detectors twice a year (spring forward and fall back). It's a cheap investment in protecting your home and your family.

We are both cat lovers and are always reading and then talking about Cat Fancy during trips to the ver, so this subscription seemed like the perfect idea. And indeed it is. We learn new things about our feline friends, their health, their habits, and so much more from every issue. It's the perfect magazine for a cat lover.

As a software developer, I have access to a number of different models of Android phones. I tested this app on as many of them as I could, and it doesn't work reliably on any of them. Take a look in the Google Play Store for an application named FoxFi. FoxFi is a much better alternative that works on many devices and, when it doesn't work, tells you gracefully why not.

Having had a long-time interest in conspiracies, I wanted to like this book. But it is, as others have pointed out, basically the content from his TV show recycled in book form. Also, I have a very difficult time with any book that includes the DaVinci Code as a conspiracy. It undermines the presenter's credibility quite a bit to include that one when there are plenty of other, more plausible conspiracies to write about. But I suppose the name "DaVinci Code" helps sell books.The removable facsimile documents are pretty gimicky and, again, are just another thing recycled from his TV show. You could purchase this, but you could also just watch "Decoded" for free and get the same thing,

This app is so sloppy. Just look at the second bullet point of the features listed here on Amazon:"Sync From your desktop Chrome browser"That's what it currently lists in the features of FireFox Sync. That is a sloppy copy and paste mistake (I wouldn't be surprised if the developer changes it after this review is published, but right now that's what it says for the FIREFOX version). And that level of inattention to detail is evident in the app itself. Don't spend your money on this sloppy piece of code.

This edition starts off with a foreword acknowledging criticism of the previous year's edition. That is a very welcome change from the past attitudes of dismissive denials that anything was wrong. And the collection offers a fairly good choice of some of the year's best science fiction and fantasy. To be honest, I prefer the sci-fi to the fantasy, and that is another nice thing about this book - you can pick and choose what you wish to read. There's nothing in here that is particularly ground-breaking, which I believe is actually a general reflection on the state of the sci-fi world last year.

I purchased this as a gift, and the recipient loves it. It is a beautiful Thomas Kinkade collectible. The music plays perfectly, and the overall size of the collectible is quite nice. I would describe the snowglobe portion as a mini-snowglobe, but as positioned on top of the train car the entire piece is a delightful size (about the size of a normal snowglobe in total). The train car has a latch on the backside to which other pieces can be attached. An absolutely delightful Christmas-time gift.

I don't understand why this app is even allowed here. Do NOT pay for this app - it is not the actual SnapChat app but is an imposter using the name. Go to the Play Store and get the real SnapChat app if that's what you're looking for. Developers of apps like this one are terrible. Please heed this warning (and all the others).

This is a diamond of a book. And saying that it will change your life is no bit of hyperbole. Chris Hadfield is positively inspired - and inspirational - as he weaves together his life story and the lessons we can learn from his adventures. Hadfield tells his life story not in the traditional, chronological manner but rather by pulling together relevant experiences and thoughts from throughout points in his life to paint a "big picture" in every chapter. In doing so, his book is incredibly effective as a motivational guide for life and how to better live it. His opening line: "The windows of a spaceship casually frame miracles." gives you a sense of what the book holds and that it is, indeed, something very special.This book, however, is not merely a glossy, feel-good piece of fluff. Hadfield directly addresses life's dark sides too - the chapter on the power of negative thinking is one of the most insightful examinations of the topic I have ever read, while other passages about the space shuttle tragedy and the preparation of "death plans" that every astronaut makes prior to going into space are among those that show Hadfield is the real deal when it comes to a thorough examination of life. His voice has a certain authenticity, making you feel as though he is sitting in the chair next to you, reviewing in full detail the experiences he has had - the positive, the negative, and even the mundane - and weaving a portrait for you of your spot in the cosmos.I read this in one sitting, over the course of several hours, interrupted by only my frequent pauses from reading to write notes and questions for review later. Because, in the end, Hadfield never tells us how to live or what we should change. His voice shares his stories, turning them into the bigger pictures, and then it gently prompts us to reflect and ask ourselves questions we have never thought to ask ourselves before. One of the best books I have ever read.

This was a birthday gift for my wife who is a huge Pittsburgh Penguins fan. Shortly after she began reading this book, she started sharing some of the anecdotes with me. After an hour immersed in the book, she marked her spot and offered to let me read it. What a great book! Ever wonder why they are called the Penguins? The humorous explanation is given here. The day that Mario Lemieux brought the team out of bankruptcy is recounted, as well as the day he announced he was returning as a player ("This changes everything" being the general sentiment after the announcement). Coach Herb Brooks taking on a Colorado television commentator for a verbal cheap shot on one of his players, the (at the time) third longest game in league history and, just a few years later, another marathon overtime game...these stories and so many others are told in this lively book. Highly recommended for Penguins fans or, for that matter, fans of the game.

These earrings are very cute! My significant other loves skunks, and skunk-related gifts are pretty hard to find. She loved these - they are very well-made and the skunks are a bit larger than I expected. Not gaudy/huge though, just a nice size to where they don't stand out too much but are subtly noticeable. She absolutely loves them! Great gift.

Dropbox brings the "ease" of sharing your files in the cloud to Android. But with that ease comes some very significant privacy concerns. Dropbox is a frequent target of malware authors and, due to some of their own lapses in best practices with regard to security and privacy, the group behind Dropbox has at time left themselves (and your data) open to snooping. If you must use a cloud-based file sharing platform, I would recommend a more secure one such as box.com or, at the least, turn on two-factor authentication in Dropbox (it's just one extra step to make your login more secure). Encrypting your files before uploading them to the cloud is also recommended. A tool like CryptSync makes this pretty painless.

About 20 minutes into White House Down, I found myself silently praying for our DVD player to explode into flames ala one of the many "wow look at that thing that got blowed up real good!" scenes in this movie. An off-duty Capitol policeman and a President who can fight, shoot, and kill like a trained Navy SEAL team up to save the country from terrorists. The "plot" is a convoluted mess that barely makes sense. The "movie" takes itself oh so seriously it is almost laughable...almost. And the "acting" - where to start? I didn't expect much from Channing Tatum, so I wasn't disappointed on that front. But both Maggie Gyllenhaal and Jamie Foxx are very disappointing. Do yourself a favor and just take a 131 minute nap instead of sitting through this tripe.

The Metasploit framework is a very powerful set of tools in the right hands. This second edition of the Penetration Testing Cookbook is a timely update to Abhinav Singh's first edition. From configuring your environment whether in Windows, Linux (Ubuntu specifically), BackTrack, or a virtual machine, Singh goes on to expand beyond the basic usage of the Metasploit framework and explores additional tools for port scanning, exploiting browser and/or OS vulnerabilities, and SQL injection. Singh also explores wireless and voice over IP pen testing and social engineering. The wireless and VoIP chapters were pretty interesting, but I found the chapter on social engineering a bit weak and would recommend a book dedicated to that topic in order to really learn more about it. But the core material in this book - using the Metasploit framework to pen test via a number of different attack vectors - is satisfactory. Not ground-breaking, and you may want to start with a more introductory book (or one that is not in the cookbook format) on the Metasploit framework before diving into this cookbook, but if you prefer to jump in and get your hands dirty right away, this is the book for you.This is a good if less than fresh resource...if you are the type of person who benefits from the cookbook format. While not everyone falls into this category at first, a well-written (and well-reviewed) cookbook such as this one may very well convert you to a fan of the format.

Here's a couple of hints about this application: the developer's name appears as "Independent Money Makerz". Hmmm, I wonder what their goal is. And that "z" at the end of their name - very hip. Now have a look at their other apps. All of them are rip-offs using a copyrighted name (AMC, Syfy, Lifetime, et cetera). Don't fall for this supposed Lumosity app, it has nothing to do with the real Lumosity program. This is a junk app by a junk developer. As a software professional, I hate seeing groups like this profit from confusion.

The developer of this app has put in so many ads I'm shocked the non-advertising portion of the program works. While this app might sound like a tempting option for accessing your Google Docs, there is a far better solution: one that is free and not riddled with so many ads. It's the official Google Drive app for Android which is published by Google. If you really want to access and edit your Google dosc, do yourself a favor: skip this app and get the Google Drive app. You will be both more happy and more productive.

I admit it: I got it wrong in my opinion of Charles Krauthammer. I thought he was just an unoriginal talking head mimicking the latest right-wing rhetoric. After reading this compilation of some three decades of his writing, I see that Krauthammer is a thoughtful intellectual. I may at times disagree with his perspective, but I can absolutely see now how gets to said perspective. The highly personal introduction is fascinating and sets the table for the writings that follow. His sense of humor and his sense of humanity come through in many passages. At times I actually laughed out loud at his writings; at other times I was enthralled by his ability to "paint with words" (most noticeably his column of September 12, 2001). Krauthammer is generally not divisive in his politics and, in fact, has evolved some of his beliefs over time as any reasonable person often does. He also has a real knack for taking difficult and at times abstract concepts and boiling them down to a comprehensible essence. Approach this book with an open mind, you just might find yourself enjoying it.

I really enjoyed this book's activity-based approach to learning. Having read other books in the Head Start series, I was (as usual) impressed with the level of interactivity that the authors' writing style engendered. I've been programming for about 15 years and have read a number of books on programming in that time, and this is one of the most engaging. Very well-paced, and the games programming actually provides an easy entry point into programming non-game Windows apps. In other words, the skills and syntax you learn by creating fun games is portable to other programs you want to create on your own.The book itself is indeed Windows 8 specific. However, the authors have created a PDF of 165 pages that Windows 7 users can download and learn from. The book pretty clearly delineates at which points the reader should flip to the PDF. You don't really end up flipping between the two all that much, and by using this book, the Windows 7 user has a useful book for now and for future upgrades to Win 8. I think that's a great value add.Finally, Head First C# Third Edition is refreshingly free of typographical errors, which (sadly) is quite rare among programming books these days. Kudos to the proofreaders for that.

Violent Python is an outstanding book. It is not an introduction to Python, but there are plenty of online resources for learning the basics of Python. This book takes you into places where penetration and vulnerability testing are the norm and thinking creatively (very creatively) is of the utmost importance. You can get up and running in Python fairly easily, and then kick-start your Python adventures with the recipes in this book. The code samples are quite useful, and I especially like the author's approach to each chapter: each one starts off with a story that helps you think of a challenge and how you might approach it. I wish more programming books took this approach as it really helped motivate me to think creatively about each mission.Violent Python will teach you how to perform testing of web sites for security holes and potential vulnerabilities. In this day and age of every company (and governmental agencies for that matter) having a web site but so few of them properly securing their site - and their customers' data - these are valuable skills to possess.There are, sadly, some typographical errors in the book for which I am deducting one star. This seems to be a trend in technical books, and it is a trend I greatly dislike. That aside, Violent Python is well worth your time and money.

As many others have mentioned, these replacement heads can be rather difficult to find. In my case, the only local retailer where I found them was charging nearly twice the price of Amazon. I'm used to the brick-and-mortar stores being somewhat more expensive, but not by that large a margin. If you have a Spinbrush Pro Sonic (a toothbrush I highly, recommend by the way) these are the replacement heads for you. I like that you can tell when it's time to replace the head (they call it "Color-Wear"). The health of my gums and the thoroughness of the plaque removal with this head was even noticed by my dentist last week.

I don't use Facebook very much, so I can only say that from what I've seen, Seesmic for Android does a pretty good job with Facebook. Of course, the official Facebook Android app is so atrocious that a flaming sack of dog feces is preferable. As far as the Twitter functionality of Seesmic, I can definitively say it's great. I've tried a number of different Twitter clients for my Android phone and tablet, and Seesmic was the one I kept coming back to. The timeline is smooth and simple to navigate, managing direct messages and @ mentions is quite convenient, and searching across Twitter is dead simple. It's been over a year now since the folks behind HootSuite acquired Seesmic, but the Seesmic app has (so far) not been effected by that. If you're looking for the solution for using Twitter on your Android device, Seesmic is it.

As a Catholic, during the 1980's and 1990's, I always enjoyed hearing some of my fellow Catholics decry Pope John Paul II as being too liberal or making too many changes, while some others decried him as too conservative or too slow to make changes. Such was the nature of John Paul II; as complex as he was intellectual, Wiegel's biography paints a fascinating picture of a man who cannot be easily defined. "Witness to Hope" is an intimate portrait, thanks in no small part to the author's access to the pontiff's correspondence with world leaders including Reagan and Gorbachev, and the Pope's active support of this book being written. The book's length is befitting for a Pope who reigned for over 26 years, and it gives a thorough history of Karol Wojyta the man, the priest, the politician, and of course the pontiff. The young Wojyta's experiences in Nazi-occupied Poland are moving, and a pattern later emerges of Wojyta being exceptionally prone to his holy calling: the youngest bishop in Poland becomes an exceptionally young cardinal. That cardinal goes on to become the first non-Italian pope in over four hundred years.John Paul's role in national and world politics was often, at the time, behind the scenes. Wiegel's accounts demonstrate the significant role John Paul played in the collapse of Communism in Poland and, later, across much of Eastern Europe. Ronald Reagan is often credited with being the primary mover behind the seismic changes that occurred, but "Witness to Hope" shows the power of the Pope's work to bring down what he saw as a socially unjust system was at least as large (if not larger) a factor. His pastoral trips took John Paul to over one hundred countries, during which he set a number of "firsts" (first Papal trips to the UK, Ireland, Mexico, and Haiti, to name a few). Wiegel's biography gives an insider's view of these trips and the diplomacy conducted during them.And setting aside the secular world, we learn of the movements and counter-movements within the Church and John Paul's stewardship of it. As I said at the outset, the complexity and highly-intellectual nature of John Paul's theology does not lend itself to "liberal" or "conservative" labels. John Paul held his theology independent of such labels and knee-jerk reactions in either direction. In an age of soundbites and simplified, black and white with no shades of grey rhetoric, John Paul rose above the chatter. Over the years, John Paul issued apologies to almost every group that had suffered at the hands of the Church. We are reminded that during his pontificate, relations with other denominations were improved, and the relationship between Catholicism and Judaism improved dramatically. Throughout the Papal portion of "Witness to Hope", we see John Paul slowly reforming the Church. The immediacy of Luther is not there, but the cumulative effect is nearly as dramatic.While I was already aware of John Paul's prison visit to Mehmet Ali Agca, the man who attempted to assassinate John Paul in 1981, reading this version of it was even more moving. I almost felt like I was there as John Paul spoke with Agca (though not even Wiegel is privy to what Agca whispered to the Pope).This book seeks to be the definitive biography of John Paul II. It comes very close. Wiegel shows a bias as an American that other authors do not. It is subtle and only displayed a few times, but it slightly downgrades the authoritative nature of the book. Not to such a degree as to reduce this from a five-star rating, just one blemish on an otherwise compelling book. As we approach the canonisation of John Paul next April, I would encourage anyone seeking to really learn (or learn more) about this complex, amazing man to read "Witness to Hope".

Pink Floyd were the soundtrack to my adolescence. I first purchased The Wall on glorious vinyl. Naturally I got the CD when it first came out, and now this amazing box set. As one of the most demanding bands around in terms of sound quality and presentation values, I always respected Pink Floyd (and in particular Roger Waters) for producing consistently high-quality releases. So here we have the Immersion box set of The Wall. Before getting to the discs themselves, I have to note that the packaging is, as always with Floyd, magnificent. Wall-themed items include a scarf, marbles, and coasters, along with a replica concert ticket and backstage pass. An over-sized booklet of drafts of album art as well as photos from the concerts really round out the experience.Onto the music...the show must go on! After getting this box set, I listened to the original album's remaster from "...we came in?" to "Isn't this where..." The remastered version of the original album is tremendous. David Gilmour's guitar tracks are noticeably improved; in fact, hearing the opening riff of "In the Flesh" is stunningly fresh. On "The Thin Ice", Nick Mason's drums are much clearer. On other tracks, Roger Waters' thumping bass is solidly enhanced from earlier releases. The vocals of both Waters and Gilmour are crystal clear; Gilmour's soothing singing at the start of "The Thin Ice" and Waters' mournful tone during "Vera Lynn" are absolutely crisp. And on it goes, providing the same seamless story in a new and improved acoustic package.The demo discs are a treasure trove. On first listen or to the casual observer, the demo tracks might seem short and incoherent. But taken as a whole, they provide amazing insight into how the individual band members experimented with different tones and sounds to create such a seamless piece as The Wall. Gilmour experiments quite a bit over the course of the demos, and Waters plays around with the lyrics to get it "just right." I found it quite interesting and enjoyable to hear the songs evolve from demos to rough mixes to the final album versions. Listening to the demos straight through and then listening to the remastered album from start to finish is as the title states and immersion.The live album "Is There Anybody Out There" was previously released, but is still a welcome part of the Immersion set. The documentary "Behind The Wall" is an interesting watch, giving a much better sense of the extensive work that went on behind the production of The Wall concerts in 1980 and 1981. It's also interesting to compare the travails of those shows to Waters' production of The Wall live in the last couple years. Building the wall in 1980/81 was a tedious and at times dangerous endeavor for the roadies. How far the technology has come. I also enjoyed the footage of the original live opening where other people made to look (somewhat) like the members of Pink Floyd took the stage.
