Update:I've been using this P12 every night, inside and out, to do spot checks, and this is now my favorite and Brightest, compact flashlight, and it seams to run forever with my Orbtronic 18650 batteries. (The Orbtronic 3600mAh 18650 Protected batteries can only be bought on the Orbtronic web site)I've really begun to LOVE this P12, it's amazing!Review below.This new 2015 version P12 is a Great little compact flashlight!!!I'm comparing it to the other compact flashlights I own, which are all very close in brightness, size and cost.I own the P16 (Love this light!), the SRT 6, and the SRT 7, also some others, but they're lower lumen output flashlights.When considering the size, especially for your EDC light, this is the best, being slightly lighter in weight, and no flared out reflector assembly, it's 1 inch in diameter, all the length of the flashlight. The total, overall length is 5.5 inches long, which is about 9/16ths shorter than the P16 and the SRT 6 & 7. So for your front or rear Jean pocket, this flashlight will be a very good fit.Brightness wise, this is a very bright little flashlight. It's hot spot is equal in size, to the hot spot of the P16 and the SRT 6 & 7, but to your eye, you can see that it's a little brighter/more white.All 4 are very bright for such compact flashlights, but this new P12 being smaller, makes it that much more impressive. Also, in comparing all 4, I can't tell any difference in the surrounding fill light, either in size, or brightness. All 4 are very good! But again, the brightest hot spot goes to the P12. (by a small margin).Feature wise, this P12 is identical to the P16, with the tail cap push button switch being the On/Off and momentary on switch, and the separate forward button controlling the mode (low/med-low/med-high/high), and when held in for over 1 second, it goes into Strobe mode first, then hold in for over another second, and it goes into it's S.O.S. mode, hold in for over another second, and it goes into it's Beacon mode. It also has built in memory, so what you shut it off in, it will start up in, the next time you turn on the flashlight. I really like flashlights with these features, and NiteCore seams to know this!Power wise, it's identical to the P16 the SRT 6, and the SRT 7, all can use a single 18650 li-ion battery, or 2 CR123a batteries, which I consider to be a big advantage for any flashlight. The P12 also has identical runtimes, as the other 3, all of which are very respectable! My choice is a Orbtronic 3600mAh Protected 18650.Build quality wise, there are no surprises, it's a very solidly built flashlight, made to IPX-8 standards, and 1.5 meter impact resistant. High quality seals, and high quality switches. Simply built to last!The biggest difference between all 4 flashlights are the candlepower, and there throwing distance.The P12 comes in dead last in both of these areas.The highest CD and throwing distance goes to the SRT7, then the P16, then the P12. Sorry, I didn't check the SRT 6. Now this is just my opinion, but as a EDC flashlight, throwing distance isn't a big factor, at least not for me. Still all are very respectable.As a EDC, which I think this flashlight is best suited for, it has excellent specs, and is a great performer.This is the perfect compact flashlight for doing those routine spot checks.I do highly recommend the P12 if your considering it!

I gotta say first, I really wasn't expecting much for the cost of this flashlight, as similar ones 2000 lumens and greater cost in the $200>$250 range. So for $93 bucks, it's really not bad.This flashlight says it's a Sky Ray King, and I'm not really sure if it is or not, since I've read that they are copied a lot.Regarding the 8400 lumens....I don't think so!I own many high end flashlights, from Fenix, Olight, and NiteCore, and using them as a measuring stick, I'd say this puts out between 2000 lumens and 2500 lumens. Seriously, no where near 8000 lumens, not even close.I don't see how 4-18650 batteries could power 8400 lumens for any length of time?This is a very bright flashlight, and the hot spot is huge, much larger than any other flashlight I own. So I'm sure it's not much of a thrower, but as a flood, it really hits the mark. The fill light is about normal (not any brighter than my TM11 puts out), but I did expect a brighter fill light (because of 7 U2 LED's, and it's claim of 8400 lumens). It looks like most of the light is focused into the huge hot spot. So for me that works out good, because I do prefer a flood over a tightly focused thrower.It emits a pure white light, with no tints at all, I'd take a guess at about 5000k to 6000k (light temp).My biggest concern is it's quality of build, and overall longevity.The switch feels quite cheep, but it works without any problems (for now).The switch also operates in the simplest way, with No memory. It cycles through High/Low/Off, and if held in for about 3 seconds, it goes into strobe mode. The Strobe is very slow, not very disorienting at all. Another push of the switch, brings it back to the High setting.This is a very light weight flashlight. It's Very similar in size, to the build of a NiteCore TM11, but it's much lighter than the TM11. I can't find any runtime info on this flashlight, so I'll try to keep track and update this review with that info. It does come with it's own UltraFire batteries, they say they are 4000mAh batteries, but as far as I know, the largest capacity 18650 is 3600mAh. I'm using my 3600mAh Orbtronic Protected batteries, since I don't trust UltraFire batteries. (they may be fine, but I'm not using them). It also comes with a Smart charger for charging 2-18650's at a time. It's a Chinese made wall charger, and about the cheapest one I've ever seen, so that went straight into the trash. I'll use my Soshine charger. I'm not basing my rating on the batteries, or the charger, I only wanted the flashlight to check out the 8400 lumens...so one star comes off for over stating the lumen rating.Overall, considering only the flashlight, and if this flashlight lasts, I think this is a 4 star item. I do think it may be a bit overpriced, just due to it's build quality, and cheep switch, this flashlight could have been made much better if they just used a quality switch. I would have gladly paid more if it came with a high quality switch that incorporated memory, and more levels of brightness!At this point, I'm not going to recommend it to anyone, unless you have the money to spare, and really want it. I'll wait a few months before I can recommend this light.I say this because I am concerned with how long it will remain functional.In the coming months, I'll be using this flashlight a lot, and after that I'll update my recommendation.Hopefully I won't have to change anything, except the recommendation.If or when something fails with this flashlight, I will update this review accordingly.

I love this charger as a safety net, for when on the road for extended periods of time. It's Very easy to use, and can charge virtually anything that uses a micro USB charging port. Plus a HUGE storage capacity, for multiple charges, before needing to recharge the device.It really holds a full charge well, and for a long time.I had it charged up, and in my glove box for well over 2 months (in cold weather), then used it for the first time, and it still had a full charge (showing 4 lit LED's), and then fully charged my Moto G from 15% to 100% and was still showing 4 lit LED's.At the time I needed to use it, I was in a bind, and no where near any power outlet, plus it being winter time, I didn't want to use my cars battery, and it's cold out (Very Cold! I'm tired with winter). But this device is just an excellent item to have, (it's an Emergency Saver!).I bought one for my sister because she's traveling in India, and was warned about there unstable power infrastructure, so she can use this to charge her phone 3 or 4 times, without needing to worry about power spikes. She was told (by many), that when charging, there phone, or laptop had fried, due to a power spike.I not only love having it and using it, but just the piece of mind, knowing it's there is Great!Highly recommended!

I've bought multiple pairs of the 912 socket, LED replacement light, and these were the brightest LED's out of 4 different pairs I tried. Just beautifully, pure white, and extremely bright. When they say "Super Bright", they mean it! So far I've used 2 different JDM ASTAR LED's as replacement lights on my 2002 Ford Windstar, these and the "Extremely Bright 5730", for my socket 168 lights, and both look and feel very well made, and also look to be brighter that there competitors.Over the past few months I've been in the process of replacing all of my Ford Windstar Mini Van's incandescent light bulbs (both interior and exterior), with LED lights.I started with the front end, both headlights, and driving lights/fog lights.I tried 2 other different brands besides JDM ASTAR, and 2 different makes of JDM ASTAR made LED's. This "Super Bright AX-2835 Chipset" was the brightest by far, and used for my driving lighs/fog lights, they worked perfectly for this application.These LED's provide a pure white light, with no tint of blue, or purple, or yellow, or any other color. They really enhanced the look of the LED Headlights I installed, and look excellent on there own!They fit the existing socket perfectly, and work perfectly, and as you can tell by my review, I do LOVE these lights, both the look, and the function! Very easy to install.I do highly recommend these lights to all who need this type socket, you'll be very pleased!!! Just great, high quality LED's, that really light UP!

I love these replacement LED lights!There very bright, and perfect for where I needed them.These go at the top of each side door, as an entrance light.They're more than twice as bright as my old incandescent bulbs were, and whats really nice is they use a fraction of the power. Being as bright as they are, the second row, or back seats are really "fully" lit up, and easy to see anything and everything, plus they're above eye height, so they don't blind you when your getting in.These are your standard "fuse type" light, and they are directional.The extra wide board allows for more LED's on one board for a much brighter light.Again, this is perfect for any kind of dome or roof mounted lighting.The fuse type are very easy to take out and replace.I'm in the process of replacing all of the lighting in my Mini Van to LED's.These 1.72 inch long fuse type lights, seam to be a pretty standard light socket (42mm to 44mm), in length. I've seen there incandescent counterparts in many other vehicles, and found them in 3 different places in my Van.Being LED lights, they'll have a much longer life, and they'll draw much less current, so the pull on my alternator is reduced a lot. Hopefully that will translate into longer life for my alternator.So now I've gotten all of the interior lights changes to LED's.I did the Headlights and running lights last month, and just yesterday got the License Plate lights changed over as well. I just have the turn signal, brake and backup lights to change next.

The black lacquer is really what makes this display look nice with my Katana Swords!I originally rated this stand at 4 stars, but due to it's low cost, you really can't ask for more, so I raised my rating to 5 stars. It really is a fair price for what you get.My CAS Hanwei Katana's are not collectors items, but still nice in my opinion, so this stand was really all I wanted, or needed.It comes in a small box, with protection, and packed well.It only took a few minutes to assemble, with 1 screw and 1 wooden guide pin, for each side.Once assembled, I found it very sturdy, plenty strong for 2 Katana's.It also comes with a pre-installed closed loop hook, on each side, to make it easy for wall hanging, brass colored.When fully assembled, the display/stand, is over 12 inches wide, which is plenty wide to support your Katana. It's total height is approximately 10.5 inches tall, and the depth is 3.5 inches deep.The contoured sword supports have a red velvet pad that simply sticks to the wood, for the protection of your Katana.The display stands on its own just as well, to place anywhere you'd like. Its a simple display, and is made with the least amount of effort, but still, nicely done.I do recommend this display/sword stand.It's simple and still looks nice.

This is a GREAT bag, at least for my use.It is a simple "Duffel Bag", it's about an average size, probably the smallest you'd want to consider buying, but also it's made to last. It's material is thick, ripstop Nylon, made with very high quality. It uses oversized Zippers, which are very easy to use, (zip & unzip).The bag does fit a lot.I use it to store and transport my DeWalt 20 volt MAX cordless tools.What I have inside is a 300ft/pd Impact driver, a Saw-Zall/Reciprocating Saw, a Skill Saw, a Jig Saw, a Hammer Drill, and a 4.5 inch Grinder/Cut-Off Tool.I also have plenty of room for 1 extra 6-1/2 Skill Saw blade, a small case of Jig Saw blades, a set of 10 Saw-Zall blades, and 5 different wheels, for my Grinder/Cut-Off tool.It works great for me having everything in one place.You can also imagine all of that stuff weighs a good amount, and thats not a problem for this Duffel Bag, due to it's strength, toughness, and overall quality.This is one great little duffel bag, and I love it.I highly recommend this duffel bag, if you need top quality, and about the toughest you can find!

Wow, this is an extremely nice set of metric wrenches!!!I'm REALLY impressed with these, and love working with em!I've already been using the SAE sister set of these wrenches and they've really impressed me, both with there quality and there toughness.This set is the same, very tough, and very high quality made wrenches, professional quality!All are ratcheting box ends (reversible with a push of a button), and instead of the cheaper point style box end, these are the spline box end, which grabs the flat side of the nut or bolt, so no problems with a nut or bolt thats previously been rounded by someone else, if it still has the flat surface intact, these will work great for you!The finish is beautiful, with a mirror polish shine, also they're strong as a mule, as I've already put my SAE set through some tough tests, and they all passed with zero problems at all.All of the interior gears and teeth are hardened steel, and all are 90 tooth geared, so you need only a little room to make progress, and I really enjoy the length of these, that allows me to use plenty of force with those rusted or stubborn nuts that don't want to come off. They do with these wrenches!The 90 tooth gearing also makes for very smooth ratcheting, these are just a pleasure to use, I love working with them.I think anybody who has an appreciation of fine tools, would love both this set and the SAE set of double box end, spline drive ratcheting (and reversible) wrenches.This is a really good price for a professional set like this, and I very highly recommend these to all who need them!

This bag works perfectly as a secondary medical storage bag.Or a Emergency essentials bag for your vehicle.I use it as a Secondary medic storage bag, and my main medic bag is the Kemp Large Professional Trauma Bag. All of my main medical gear is in the Kemp bag, and I use the Arsenal Responder for bandage, wraps, tape, and other essential, that are able to take a hit. The main reason is because this bag has very little protection padding, so keeping anything thats possibly breakable in it, is taking a chance of loosing it.But as a storage bag for unbreakable supplies, this bag is wonderful, and you can fit a LOT of supplies in it. It's very roomy, and really well made.It's a center opening bag, and the 2 strap handles tie together with a sewn on Velcro strap, which makes it easy to handle, and carry.Inside the bag, on both side, there are pockets for smaller storage, aside from the interior center open storage.The bag is made of heavy nylon and the sewing is done very well, this is a high quality medic bag, it just lacks some good padding. But for mu purposes, it works beautifully!It also uses an oversized zipper, and it works very smoothly, and easily secures the contents of the bag.I Highly recommend this bag, if what I described is what your looking for.

These are great tips!I really like the Hybrid fiber mesh tip, because they slide across your tablet or smart phone screen much easier than the standard rubber tip.They also last much longer than the standard rubber tips, about 4 times as long.Plus these tips are smaller than the typical stylus tip, so it makes it easier to use when typing on a smaller smart phone.These tips just screw onto your Bargains Depot Stylus, I bought the 2 pack. There very easy to replace, and the stylus works wonderfully!These tips & stylus just work really well, very sensitive.I'm real happy with these Hybrid tips, and the Bargains Depot Stylus.I highly recommend these to all who need them!

These are very nice and light weight valve stem sleeves.There good quality sleeves, I couldn't find anything cheap or defective on them.So you have a reference, these measure 1 inch total, from base to top.Don't worry about your tires becoming out of balance with the addition of these, because these sleeves are light enough that they won't affect the balance of your tires at all.They fit my valve stems perfectly, and a added benefit I noticed, is they help keep the valve stem straight up, when your taking air pressure measurements. They fit down flush with the bottom flare of the valve stem, and cover all of the stem except the top threads, for your caps.These along with some nice, all metal, valve stem caps: EDELSIGN - HEXAGON Tire Rim Valve Stem Caps, really make for a nice and clean look.I really like them, and they would dress up any tire and rim set.They made mine look much nicer, without being to flashy.Just what I wanted.

Easy to store and easy to carry in your backpack, or Bob!They'll keep you alive!Really an excellent price for so much.I've begun to start eating these in place of regular meals as they are 2 years away from there experation date, though I think they'd last an additional 2 years or so.In a while I'll begin to buy all new stock, and repack for another 5 years.I currently have a 2 years supply for 2 people, so it will take me a while to go through my supplies.In my opinion, these are an excellent source of emergency food suppliesThe size of these are a real advantage to anyone who is forced to carry these on there back.They're light weight, and you can pack 2 weeks worth in a 3 day back pack.They are packaged very well with a very heavy duty outer layer of thick foil wrap, and vacuum packed, for shelf life. They taste pretty good for emergency food, and are Not sodium heavy, so they don't cause a tremendous thirst.I'll be stocking up with more of these soon.Very highly recommended!!!Great emergency food source!!!

This stuff works really well, I was amazed!I used it on a 14 year old engine thats never been cleaned before.I wanted to get it clean since I'm going to be doing all of the maintenance work on it now.I will say I needed to give it 2 treatments, between spraying it off, but it got my engine looking close to brand new.My hand got a little tired having to keep using the spray pump, but for the cost of this stuff, it was Soooo worth it!The nozzle will adjust to 2 different spray patterns, a stream, or a mist like spray.It didn't stain my driveway, like other products have, namely Gunk.Don't get me wrong...Gunk does work well to, but it does stain my driveway.This comes from a well established company Name Brand, "Permatex"For the cost, and considering how well this works, after using it, I came in and ordered another 6 pack of this De-Greaser! The value is crazy good, and this stuff works extremely good on dirty engines!Plus it's bio-degradable, and non toxic....totally green!No aggravating, noxious vapor left to inhale.I really like this stuff & will continue to use it.I Very Highly Recommend this product to Everyone!!!

This is a beautiful set of ratcheting box end wrenches! (Spline Drive)They work & feel very smooth with small step ratcheting, so even in tight areas, you can still get good turns. There internal gears use 90 teeth, so smooth and tight ratcheting!All parts, (internally as well), are all hardened steel, so you do need to keep up with proper lubrication.This is a complete set from 5/16" to 3/4", and all sizes in between.The quality and build of these are top notch!Much more than I ever expected, so I'm really happy I took the chance and tried these.I just love the ease of use that they provide. They make jobs quicker and easier.Each wrench is reversible as well.Applying torque is no problem for these wrenches.Each wrench is much longer than I expected, even the smallest size 5/16th's - 3/8th's, is 12 inches long.The longest wrench (11/16" x 3/4"), measures in at about 14 inches long, so each wrench has great reach and leverage.I've been using these for about 3 months now, and used each size. I've had Zero problems, and have been really impressed with there performance.These are spline drive box ends, so they really grab the fastener well, with no problems if your dealing with partially rounded bolts or nuts. I've also applied plenty of torque, in most cases, more than needed, but I did so mainly to see if these wrenches could take it, without any skipping, or breaking of the ratcheting teeth.Not a single failure!This set comes with a limited lifetime warranty, good throughout the U.S.A.So after using these for a good 3 months, and to a point abusing them, they've performed great.The ratcheting is very smooth, there reach is great, all are spline drive box ends, just a superior set of wrenches.I now plan on getting there Metric set of 5 wrenches. Just great quality.You could store both sets in a good canvas wrench roll up like this one: Arsenal 5782 Canvas Wrench Roll-Up, I have 2 already and plan on getting 2 more, these are great wrench roll ups, very tough!I very highly recommend these to everyone!!!

I immediately put this charger to use, and it really impressed me!Well built, with quality parts.I've had no problems with this charger at all. In fact I'm really happy with it, all of it's features, and it's build quality! I'm also really impressed with the chargers outer shell/body. It's very well made, not like some of there older styles that used thin sheet metal, that would flex, and bend. This charger has a very tough shell (inclosure)!I have had problems with past purchases of Schumacher products.So I was worried about getting this charger, but this charger works perfectly for me.In the last 2 months I've use most every feature it has, and they all work really well.The transformer inside sounds like a good one, very quiet and smooth sounding.When in 100 amp jump assist mode, it doesn't sound like it's struggling, like some others I've had (other Schumacher chargers, older models).It charges really well, it can charge fast or slow, and I really like the floating feature (self adjusting). It automatically monitors the level of charge that your battery's in, and will lower the charging rate when within 80% to 90% of full charge.It also will show your your batteries charge capacity, in a percentage form.So when in charging mode, and it says your battery is fully charged, you can switch to the percentage readout, and that will tell you how much more your battery can actually take.This is very helpful because automatic battery chargers never fully charge a battery, they will charge to within about 85% of the batteries full capacity, then stop charging.With the percentage readout, and with the charger set to trickle, or slow charge, I can fully charge my battery, to it's true full capacity!My favorite feature on this charger is it's slow, and variable charge rate. This is what I use in the winter, because sometimes I don't even start my 2002 Ford Windstar for 3 or 4 days, and in very cold weather this can spell trouble, so I hook it up and run the charger in 2>6amp slow charge, and set the readout to percentage. When the battery reaches a 100% charge, the charger automatically switches into maintenance mode, to keep your battery topped off.I've used this charger this way about half a dozen times now, and my battery couldn't be happier!Me as well.I do understand others that have had problems with Schumacher products, and not wanting to go through another return, or be let down by the purchase they just made.I can tell you that this is actually one of the best battery chargers I've had.Great battery charger, at a great price.This one is packed with many features.Works with both 6 volt, and 12 volt batteries, plus a engine start mode (but only 100 amps)I do highly recommend this battery charger.

Very nice set for a no name brand!High quality, with a wide range of sizes (1/4" to 7/8"), just well made wrenches at a great price!This is a full and complete set of Offset double Box End wrenches.The quality is very good, as I've been punishing them for 3 months now, with no signs of weakening, or bending.They all fit there corresponding fastener very well, zero slippage, nice tight fit for plenty of torque.They're not polished, about equal to your standard Craftsman set.Plenty strong for any task where you'd need to use a offset wrench.I've used mine in situations where I didn't need one, but used it anyways, to test the amount of force I could apply, without damaging anything, and they performed excellently, no failures, no bends or breakage.These are great for the budget minded buyer, and are made with quality to be able to use every day, to there full potential. I needed a new set, because over the years, I've lost, left, or misplaced some of mine, and I wasn't ready to spend 10 times the cost for a polished set of SnapOn, or SK's. If I had the extra cash, those would be my first choice! But all in all, these are just fine, and work very well.Update:I was going to buy the sister set to this SAE set, until I found these: 6mm - 22mm 8 Piece High Quality Metric Offset Box Wrench Set with Heavy Duty Pouch, these are a TOP Quality set of Professional grade offset wrenches, and well worth the low cost of $49.99 + $4.99 shipping, these are an excellent buy!!! They come with a very nice wrench roll up to. There quality really is excellent!I bought this wrench roll up to store them in, and they fit really well, Arsenal 5782 Canvas Wrench Roll-Up, it's a high quality wrench roll up, made with thick canvas. I've bought 2 of these so far, and need 2 more. I'll be buying the same brand again, these are very tough roll ups, and should last a very long time.I'm very happy with these, and I think you would be as well.For the cost, it was a easy decision for me!I'd buy them again, if needed.Highly recommended!!!

This is a great set of High Quality offset box end wrenches!(Professional Quality)Everything is exactly as shown in pictures.This set spans from 6mm to 22mm, but it does miss the 21mm size.The largest size wrench is a 20mm/22mm, so I picked up a 21mm offset separately.They are professional quality, and fully polished.These are the best set of offset box end wrenches I've seen for this price!Well worth the cost for the quality you get!I was a little worried about what I was getting, until I had them in my hands.I really was amazed at what I got for the price I payed.I'd do it again in a heartbeat.These really are a very nice set of offset wrenches, and I love em!The wrench roll up that comes with it is also made very well, and very tough, all heavy duty (rip stop) nylon.It's a easy way to store and transport your set of wrenches.A Very nice bonus!I'd highly recommend these to anyone who's looking for a nice set of metric, offset wrenches!

Quick update:After a day or so of use, it's began to get spotty when it makes contact with my phone, notes are sketchy, typing is becoming a real pain in the A##, I've now gone back to my passive stylus, which is performing better that this one.This review is for the 2nd Gen E1I bought this one because it uses AAA batteries (one), and they're easy to find, and I didn't want to have to look for AAAA batteries.This stylus is performing excellent, and it works great on my Moto G 2nd Gen.It takes very little pressure for my phone to register a touch from this stylus.The weight of this stylus is very nice, about equal to that of a nice pen.The size is the same, equal to that of a nice pen, and feels very comfortable in your hand.The build quality of this stylus is very high, it feels solid, nothing loose or rattling in it.The On/Off switch is easy to activate.In short, I really like everything about this stylus.One thing would have made it nicer, and thats if it came with a cap.For the price, I doubt you'll find anything better.If anything fails on it, I'll update this review & rating.Right now I highly recommend this stylus!

This is the exact same light thats featured  here & offered by Amazon: Drive Medical Light, I know because I bought BOTH at the same time. Trying to find the best light for my Mothers walker, both are very disappointing (not bright at all), but at least the Drive Medical Light only costs $9.23, with free shipping, and offered by Amazon.For a cheep little attachable light, it's not a bad deal for only $9.23, but for $27.45, this company (Just Home Medical), is taking you to the cleaners!!!I'm writing this review because I hate it when companies take advantage of buying customers.It's a very dim, and cheaply made light to start with. Both are about as bright as a 5 watt night light. Both are built and made exactly the sameMy 86 year old Mother who frequently gets up in the middle of the night, needs a descent light for her walker.The dark can be dangerous for her, so I was hoping to find a good quality, and a bright enough light, that I could attach to her walker. I have it done now, but not with this light.I actually got what I needed buy looking for Bike headlights. I found a good light, and a clamping device that attaches directly to the tubing of the walker, thats adjustable, both vertically and horizontally. The flashlight just snaps in place. It works excellently.This is what I purchased for my Moms walker: Refun(TM) LED Zoomable Bike Head Light, and she loves it.In my opinion, both this light and the Drive Medical light fall short in quality, and brightness.But at least the identical light from Drive Medical, doesn't try to over charge you.$27.45 (this one) v.s. $9.23 (Drive Medical Light)When I first saw this light, in person, in my hands, my heart just hit the floor, knowing I was just ripped off, and already have an identical light, and the only difference is some ink spelling out a name, and a basic overall color.Please don't spend the $27.45 they are asking for this light, if you really want to try this light, buy it for 10 bucks from Drive Medical. It even came packaged in the exact same cardboard and clear plastic covering, these are identical in every way, except for the price.

Really nice fitting underwear, very comfortable, and holds it's size & elasticity after washings.I've mostly worn BVD's and loved em, but they are very hard to find now, if at all?So after a while I tried Jockey underwear, and have not liked them from the start.There waist bands would actually wrinkle, and stay that way, which made wearing them very uncomfortable.Plus there material was very thin, and they did not give me good wear life.I first just bought 1 pack of these to try, and fell in love with them right away.There make, and design reminded me of my old BVD's.These Dockers use very good quality cotton material, and thick material as well.These feel great against your skin! Very soft.They have great quality waist bands, that keep there flat shape, and they retain there elasticity in both, there waist band, and leg openings. I really love the high quality of Dockers underwear.They have the traditional fly, instead of some of the other name brands that use under and over flaps, which I hate. I like the traditional fly much better! I don't see why any other manufacturer would even try using a different design?The Bottom Line...is these are very high quality, 100% Cotton, Very well made, and $15.00 for 4 pair is a great deal. I'm very happy with them and am sure others would be to.Update 5-23-15After multiple washings, these have stayed true to size, and have become even more comfortable.I did find some new BVD's and bought a 3 pack (more expensive), in comparing them with these Dockers, they fall FAR short, in every way! Comfort, material thickness, sewing quality, elastic bands...all areas in the BVD's were very disappointing. The Dockers are a very high quality product, and will stay with these in the future. These Dockers Briefs are great!!!Very Highly recommended!!!

These are my best cold weather boot socks!!!These are really well made socks, and should last a very long time.I consider these an investment, as they will be around for many years.Carhartt makes these extremely high quality, and out of all of Carhartt's socks, these contain the highest percentage of wool, so yes, they are very warm, and also very thick, very durable, just real tough socks!Perfect sizing, and very comfortable as well!I wear a size 13 EE Shoe/Boot, so I bought the XL size, and they are the perfect fit.I've been wearing Carhartt apparel for many years, and have never been disappointed.These socks are another product from Carhartt, that doesn't disappoint!I bought 6 pair of these, and 6 pair of "Carhartt's Steel Toe Arctic Wool Boot Socks", so no pairs wear out prematurely.Very thick, Very warm, made to last, and made in the U.S.I highly recommend these socks!!!

I've been wanting & searching for a sound bar, for my 42" Plasma Panasonic Viera HDTV for a while now, but there are so many, and all of them have some great reviews, and all have some really bad reviews. With all the different reviews it's very hard to know which ones to believe.Just the other day I was at a friends house, and he had a Sony 40" sound bar, with a sub, and I was super impressed with the sound quality, and how rich it sounded, so right then I knew I wanted a Sony Sound Bar (2.1).I know this model "HTCT260H" is an older model, but it has everything I wanted and needed.I can tell you....WOW this thing sounds great, it's really hard to believe the quality of the sound that comes out of this sound bar & sub, plus the wireless sub is a really nice touch, much cleaner looking!It was incredibly easy to sink up my Android smart phone, Motorola Moto G (2nd generation), with the sound bar, and the music sounded excellent, not Home Theater quality, but close! I have a SanDisk 32Gb SDHC in my Moto G, and at least 6Gbs of music on it, all in WAV Lossless format, and I could easily control the play, pause, select, and volume, with my phone, all round the room, so in my case the blue tooth connection was very strong and stable.It looks very sharp in front of my plasma, and I couldn't be happier with how big and rich the sound is.No buyers remorse at all.I'm 100% happy with my purchase, and the sound is just amazing!

These Carhartt socks are some of the best I've ever had!I've always been impressed with Carhartt, & these socks do Not disappoint.Every Carhartt product, from work jackets, to cold weather winter jackets, Overalls, gloves....Always top quality, and always tough and durable!These are really nice & comfortable high calf boot socks. these are my second favorites, my #1 favorites are Carhartt's Artic Wool Heavy Boot Socks.These are very thick and durable, there make/manufacturing is top of the line. Very high quality socks. They fit me perfectly, I wear a 13 EE and there XL size fits me great.They're very warm, with approx. 85% wool, so you can count on these on any cold day, as long as you have "Good Boots" to go with em!These are really well made socks, and should last a very long time.I've trusted Carhartt Jackets, Overalls, Boots, and socks for many years now.Not once have they let me down.They've always been the best quality, with very long wear life, just plain tough.I bought 6 pair of these, and 6 pair of "Carhartt's Artic Wool Heavy Boot Socks"(the Artic Wool Heavy Boot Socks are my favorites), so I won't wear out, any one pair sooner than expected.Very high quality socks,Highly recommended!!!

Very well made, high quality, and extremely comfortable work out pants!!!They hang very nicely from your waist, and look sharp as well.These pants are made really well, the sewing is excellent.They are light weight, but the material feels very durable.They're made with 100% cotton, and I had a hard time finding that, these were the only ones I could find that were made totally from cotton.The waist band is also top quality, it a nice wide waist band at 3 inches wide, so it really helps in keeping these up where they belong! The 3 inch waist band holds very snug, without being, or feeling to tight.They hang well on you, and they look good to.They are a light weight work out pant, very cool to wear.The material is thin, but high quality, and should last you a good long time.They're plenty roomy, almost baggy, but not quite. I bought a baggy pair from Golds gym, and these are not as baggy as those, but still extremely comfortable.These are definitely an inside, or Spring and Summer pant. Cool and Comfortable!I highly recommend these workout pants!!!

This skill saw is a great addition to DeWalts 20V Max line of tools.My first reaction after using this skill saw for a while, was just WOW, this thing is Amazing!!!The motor they use is smooth as silk, and powerful.I was hoping to wait till DeWalt incorporated there brushless motor into this skill saw.But I needed it, so I bought it. Man am I happy I did, I really LOVE this skill saw!This is a superb saw!It has all of the features and power of a Top Quality corded skill saw, and it's light weight, with the 4Ah & 5Ah batteries, it does the work of a heavy duty skill saw.I've been in construction since 1980, and have used most all light and heavy duty power tools. This Skill Saw ranks among the best I've used, in cordless saws.Just remember your blade choice is the most important factor in how effective this saw will perform. Please see my blade recommendation below.Others have commented on it's longevity with there batteries (1.5Ah & 2Ah batteries), regarding they drain fast. The smaller DeWalt batteries are going to drain faster. This skill saw is powerful, and puts a heavy load on the batteries. With this saw, you need the High Capacity 4Ah & 5Ah batteries (model 204 & 205). This saw will work with any and all of DeWalts 20V Max batteries, but the lower capacity batteries aren't recommended.I only use DeWalts 4.0Ah and 5.0Ah batteries, and with those, I can use this skill saw all day long, with 1 battery lasting most of the day, and usually all of the day.Features:-This skill saw has a blade break, which is a very nice feature in any skill saw. As soon as you release the trigger, the break engages, and stops the blade from spinning within seconds.-This skill saw also directs the cut material away from the user, and away from your line of sight.-This skill saw has the ability to cut from a directly perpendicular (90 degrees), and also can cut up to a 50 degree angle.-This is a nice light weight skill saw, and that greatly cuts the fatigue you would feel from using a traditional skill saw, all day long.-This skill saw allows for a direct line of sight to the blade and working surface. This is much like the design of a worm drive saw (a Roofers Saw), the design of most all other skill saws have the motor and the blade on opposite sides, so the skill saw operator would need to look over the top of the saw, to see his work surface. This is Not the case with this DeWalt Skill Saw!-The front and the main handle has a rubber over mold, and this gives the operator a great and comfortable grip on the skill saw. This makes it safer, and easier to control.Blade choice is important!-This skill saw uses a standard 5/8ths inch arbor, which gives the owner a wide selection of blade choices.There is a LOT of new blades out today that use think kerf cuts. This means the width of the cut is very thin, usually about 1/16th of an inch thick. Just know that these are basically cheap, and throw away blades.You also need to know, the thinner the tooth, the faster it will dull.-Please see Blade recommendation below-This blade here: Vermont American 6-1/2-Inch 40T Smooth Cut Carbide Teeth Circular Saw Blade, is one of the best blades you can buy for this saw. It's an extremely high quality blade, and the same blades that I use professionally, every day. It can be resharpened many times before needing replacement. It's very sharp, and uses very high quality carbide teeth.I Very Highly recommend this saw blade!To end, this DeWalt skill saw is a Professional Quality skill saw, and will last you for many many years.Everything about this skill saw is very high quality, and built very well.Very Highly Recommended!!!

I'm really impressed with this cordless jigsaw!!!I've been doing construction work (of various types), for over 30 years.This DeWalt cordless jigsaw is absolutely amazing, in both quality and durability.With a 4 or 5 Ah battery, it's very strong and powerful.The motor in it, sounds just as smooth as the best corded jigsaws.This is a compact jigsaw, and I'm really at a loss of words about how nice this saw is.The build of this jigsaw is "Professional" quality.It's extremely easy to use, and changing the blade is done completely without any tools, just very convenient!This saw is very tough, and should last most anyone, many years of use.Even on a daily basis.With some of the larger capacity DeWalt batteries, this jigsaw will run for a very very long time.The rubber over-molded handle makes for a excellent non-slip grip.The adjustable base comes with a removable plastic guard...very handy!This jigsaw has most every option as the best corded jigsaws, it even has a blow tube to clear the surface, to follow a line easily without any material buildup.Everything about this jigsaw is professional quality, and I'm really overly impressed.I really wasn't expecting such a nice and powerful saw, but thats what I got, and I'm really happy with it! Absolutely no buyers remorse.I've been using power tools all my life, and this jigsaw ranks up among the best I've used.Just please note, this is the jigsaw only, no batteries, charger, or case comes with it.For this tool, I'd highly recommend the 4Ah or the 5Ah DeWalt batteries.Very Highly recommended!!!

Another excellent flashlight from NiteCore!Very powerful & packed with features.Comparing to the TM11 & the TM15, this one is even shorter.It's 4 & 15/16th's inch long, with a diameter of 2 inches (2 inches from end to end, there is no flare out for the reflector housing). Very compact!It's run with 4x 18650 li-ion (Protected) batteries.I use Orbtronic 3600mAh Protected cells.This flashlight emits a pure white light, with no blueish or yellowish tints to the light.The "Turbo" setting is simply another click on the selector button, you don't need to hold down any button or switch for Turbo mode.When in Turbo, it's extremely bright! I own many high powered flashlights, and this one is now the brightest of them all. Even brighter than my TK75. The throw isn't the best (still not bad) because it's more of a flood light. It does have a good size and very defined hot spot, with excellent peripheral spill light.It's peripheral spill light is really pretty amazing!It has 5 levels of brightness, and 3 hidden modes.All 5 levels of brightness can be controlled by the side button (Even the Turbo Mode), so all though they advertize that you need to simultaneously push the side button and the back power button to access the Turbo Mode, "You Don't"!All levels are all controlled by the side switch/button.The brightness levels are: Very low, Low, Medium, High, Turbo.When you hold in the side button for 3 seconds, it first switches to Strobe Mode.Hold for 3 more seconds to enter SOS mode.Hold for 3 more seconds for Beacon mode.One click to exit the hidden modes.The runtimes are ANSI FL1 standards, as follows:3 lumens-433hrs/160 lumens-25hrs/480 lumens-9hrs/1500 lumens-3hrs,15min/3800 lumens-45min.All runtime tests were run using 4, 2600mAh Protected Li-ion batteries.Which is why I use Orbtronic 3600mAh Protected batteries...Longer runtimes!The rear tail button/switch is the On/Off control, and is also used for momentary on.I really like the rear button, due to this flashlights short profile.The rear button On/Off/Momentary On switch also has a built in memory circuit.So what ever mode, or level of brightness, you turn it off in, is what it will start up in, when you hit the On/Off button.This is another very well built/crafted flashlight from NiteCore.It's built to be extremely rugged. It's IPX-8 waterproof, and 1.5M impact resistant.It's easy to use one handed, not to heavy at all.This is an excellent addition to the "Tiny Monster" line up!It's also my favorite, and I have the TM11 and the TM15.I know it's an expensive flashlight, so probably not a good choice for everybody.But for the Lumen nuts, and Flashaholics, (like myself), it's well worth the cost!I consider this flashlight a must have, and have no buyers remorse.For me, this is a perfect flashlight. I love the larger hot spot, and how this flashlight acts more like a flood, than a spotlight, and the peripheral spill light is very bright.To end, this is one tough flashlight, this is a super Bright flashlight, the build quality is second to none. Plus with 5 levels of brightness, plus a strobe mode, a SOS mode, and a beacon mode, this flashlight is very versatile.Top of the line flashlight, and a Home Run for NiteCore!Very Highly Recommended!
