This Anna and Kristoff fashion doll set is fantastic!  They are both dressed in elaborate costumes and have great facial expressions.  Marketed for ages 3+, I highly recommend this to any Frozen fan!
This Birthday Party Elsa has a uniquely cute expression her face and wears a lovely teal green dress.  Marketed for ages 3+, this fashion doll is sure to be a holiday hit!

This Fashion sized doll of Elsa is gorgeous!  The facial features are stunning. Big, beautiful blue eyes and a pretty pink smile.  Her blonde hair is styled in a long braid.  She wears her beautiful blue formal dress.  Olaf is there, too.  Marketed for ages 3+, this particular doll is a must for Frozen fans!
The are cute.  They are the size of Polly Pocket dolls.  Marketed for kids ages 3+.  Very colorful and fun.

This burlap sack with drawstring closure has a removable lining that can be laundered.  The burlap cannot be washed.  It's practical as it absorbs moisture and allows airflow.  You can fit five pounds of potatoes in this bag.  There is a burlap loop style hook that is used to hang the bag, also.This item is also decorative and will look good in your country style kitchen.  I'm using this as it was intended, to store potatoes and keep them in a dark place.  I am also hanging the bag by the loop.  This bag will work fine wherever you store your potatoes.

This is a nice burlap bag to store onions in.  It has a removable lining that can be washed.  The burlap outer bag cannot be washed.  The bag measures 17 inches tall by 13 inches wide (flat) & has a drawstring closure.  There is also a burlap hook to hang the bag, if you need to, which I plan on doing.This retro inspired onion sack serves a purpose.  It absorbs moisture and allows airflow for your onions.  The lining ensures a dark place for your onions or other root vegetables.  I wish it were larger.Kind of a nifty idea that would make a good gift for that somebody that has everything already.  Nice country decor for your kitchen, too. I'm actually going to use mine to store onions.

This Oxford New York Charcoal Heather Gray T-shirt is nicely made and fits as expected.  To be exact, the XL is 28 inches long and about 20 inches measured across the back, shoulder seam to shoulder seam.  It's made of a cotton and polyester blend of materials, which means it's super soft. The color is fantastic - like the model in the picture - this t-shirt looks great with a pair of jeans or under a dressier shirt or even a jacket.Gray is the new black, and everyone needs a gray shirt.Well made, great color, sized just right.  I recommend it.

La Roche-Posay Innovation BB BLUR Instant Oil absorbing coverage cream mousse really woke my tired face up.  The fair/light shade is perfect for my light porcelain skin.  I literally used the smallest dab that I could squeeze out of the tube to cover most of my face with perfect coverage.  Although the container holds slightly over an ounce of product, it will go a long way because you use so little.I really feel like my face looks more alive and radiant.  Believe me, as an overworked mother and nurse, I need all the help I can get.  I will definitely purchase this product.Follow up:  After wearing this for under a week, I have received compliments.  Yesterday at work a woman asked me what I have been doing to my self.  Did I get my hair done?  Something is different.  I look younger, she said.  There is nothing else but this cream.  Definitely an amazing product.

Vintage Home by Judith Miller, is a beautiful hard cover book that is eye candy for any decorator or collector.  288 pages of breath-taking photographs are beautifully bound in this coffee table style volume.  Chapters include sections on Art Deco period, Organic, Colorful, Space Age, Post Modern, Minimalist and more.  I want one of everything that is pictured in this book!If you are looking for definitions because you are just starting to learn about furniture and design, this book is for you.  If you are already well versed in design but are looking for inspiration in decorating or staging rooms, this book is for you.  If you just love great designs and collectibles, this book is for you.Very well done.  This book is one I will be looking at for a long time.

This cute dog toy is shaped like a candy corn, and it's smiling!  It measures 5 inches tall and 3 inches wide.  It has the standard squeaky toy sound when pressed.  The fabric has the texture of wool.  The only bad thing about fabric like this is that is picks up hair.  When tossed, it kind of drops and spins around a little bit because of its shape.  My dog didn't care about it, but she's not a toy fan.  My cats batted it around and tore up the tag pretty quickly. I'm not finding any laundering instructions, but I gather the company doesn't expect this novelty item to last long enough to be washed.Overall it's a cute novelty dog toy.  I think a puppy would shred this thing in minutes, resulting in a mess and perhaps even a trip to the vet to remove the candy corn contents from the pups GI system.  If you have an older dog that like likes toys and is gentle with them, I'd say go for this item.

If you like sterling silver and Celtic design, this is the pendant and necklace for you.  It comes in a nice gift box for great presentation.  The Celtic knot look pendant is flat and measures almost an inch around.  It comes on a simple, delicate, silver chain.  There is a nice weight to the set.  It looks  & feels quality made.  It will make a perfect gift for a special someone or a great gift for yourself.

Nutro Company Lite Adult Dog food is made of chicken, brown rice, & oatmeal.  The high fiber content allows dogs to feel full after eating, which can contribute towards a healthier intake (less) and weight loss if your dog consumes less dog food.  Our dogs (we have 3) are not overweight because we exercise them on a regular diet, and none of them really care for dog food, especially in summer.  They eat this dog food, but aren't scarfing it down like they do with some other high end brands of dog food.  Of course, they prefer any kind of wet food or people food to any kind of dry food.  I would suspect an overweight dog has weight issues related to people food, too.  But just like people, dogs need exercise and balance with their diet.If your dog is overweight, this is a good choice of dog food for them to eat. The fiber makes them feel full and they don't eat as much.  My dogs are all eating it and they are pretty picky.  I recommend it.

My cats love this brand of cat food.  They fight over it.  I have 5 indoor cats, ranging from juvenile  to nine years old, and they all go for The Nutro Company Hairball Control Adult cat food.  It's high in protein, which is what cats need, and they seem to like the taste.  The pellets are a natural brown color, no artificial red dye or anything, like most commercial brand cat foods.My cats don't have much problem with hairballs so I can't comment on that too well.  But the taste? They love it.  The ingredients?  I love it.  Our cats are our babies and their health is paramount to us.  Healthier kitties means less sick calls & visits to the vet.  Win win situation.

Axe White Label Styling Cream takes just a drop into damp hair to give your style some hold and body.  It also made my hair super soft.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because the smell is overwhelming to me.  I could detect that strong masculine, cheap cologne scent for hours after I applied the cream.  I prefer non-scented hair cream.Otherwise it's pretty good.  Nice hold and body, plus softness.  Not sticky or hard.

Suave Luxe Style Infusion Light Weight Weather Proof hair cream made my  hair very lifeless and dull.  I liked the smell of the cream, and the texture, but it didn't do well for fine, short hair.  I simply applied some to my damp hair and used a blow dryer and brush to dry my hair as usual.  The result was dull, lifeless hair that looked weighed down.  Obviously not a look I am trying to achieve so I won't be using this particular hair cream again.

Suave Firm Control Sculpting Gel works pretty well to keep my short hair in place.  For days when I don't feel like blow drying my hair, I can just wash it, towel dry it, and put some gel into it wet.  This particular gel dries pretty stiff but can be combed out pretty easily, which softens my hair and gives it a bit of body while holding its shape.The gel is clear with little bubbles in it.  It smells floral, but the scent doesn't really stay in your hair.  Gel like this is similar to the old gel - Dippity Do.  Those of you raised in the 60's and 70's will remember that gel.  It can be applied to your damp hair, roll it, dry it, whatever, and your hair holds its shape better.Is Suave Professionals my favorite hair gel right now?  No.  But in a pinch, this gel does fine to ad body & control to my hair.

The infant stim-mobile is marketed as a developmental mobile.  Unlike mobiles of days gone by, with nursery rhyme themes, music, and wind-up rotation that keep the images spinning and the music playing, this mobile is simply educational.  The images are simple, with a babys face, a butterfly,  circular spiral wheels, and a fish, for example.  The colors are basic black, red, orange, white, etc.  The mobile doesn't spin or play a tune to keep baby's attention; the pictures hold baby's attention.This mobile is recommended for babies newborn to about 5 months.  They can't see well or far during that time period, so they aren't enjoying the cute cartoon  characters anyway. They can't really focus on them visually.  This mobile, with its simple pictures and colors, are all a baby needs at that age to entertain themselves for a few minutes at time while laying in bed.The distance the picture discs are from baby can be adjusted over time, and when baby begins to push up on his hands and knees, the device needs to be removed from the crib or playpen.  It's done its job by then as now, baby can see better.  They are also past the mobile stage.I recommend this to any parent that isn't focused on the design on their baby's nursery, but wants a mobile to stimulate their newborns vision and brain.  I will miss the smiling lambs and elephants of mobiles gone by though.

I have 3 dogs and none of them will taste this dog food for me.  I can't say that I blame them; it doesn't look appetizing to me either.  Small, squarish, tanned brown pellets that are similar to bird pellets or feed probably aren't appealing to a dogs appetite.  While I as a human being appreciate the fact there is no artificial colors or dye in the dog food, the dogs probably needs some more color to it to make it seem more palatable to them.  Also, there's no real odor to it.  Just a bit of a grainy smell.  Also not what my dogs want.I guess the whole weight management theory comes into play because they won't eat it.  However, I am pretty sure overweight dogs aren't overweight because they scarf down too much dry dog food.  It probably has more to do with eating human food and not getting enough exercise.I wish I could be more positive about this food, but my dogs won't even try it.

Perfect for my rambunctious chihuahua.  This relatively lightweight, yet sturdy, retractable leash works exactly as advertised.  The action of the leash works very smoothly, and it is plenty strong for little powerful dogs, like my one year old chihuahua.  The leash has a locking function so you can set it at a certain length, if you don't want the give and take happening.  We are happy with this leash and will use it every day for our walks.

This product is touted as the only CC cream that corrects redness.  I have been using it for about two weeks now, and find that it does not aggravate my senior acne (just went on Medicare & still dealing with zits!).  I have also found that it does a decent job of reducing the red appearance of my skin, though I use additional products (base, concealer, etc.) to fully cover up my redness.  Can't say that the redness in my skin is diminishing, but this product certainly isn't aggravating it and does help with concealment.

I like these puzzles pretty much.  As an American, I am occasionally unfamiliar with a reference as they are written by an Aussie for an Australian readership, but that is understandable.  I am an experienced cryptic crossword puzzler, who does not like the puzzles with extra complexities.  For me, these puzzles are about right in level of difficulty - I can solve about half of the puzzle pretty quickly and then have to work harder on the rest.  This is precisely the level of difficulty I like.  By way of comparison, these puzzles are comparable in both format and difficulty to the two that run in Games magazine every month.  (Am I the only person who buys the magazine just for the two cryptic crosswords?).My one quarrel with these is that the solutions do not provide explanations.  Most cryptics do, and they provide an insight into the author's thinking and his/her clue construction.  With MacCallum's puzzles here, I sometimes can figure out the right answer, but still do not understand the cryptic clue's relation to the correct answer.  For this, I subtract one star.

These notebooks are first rate.  The picture did not make clear to me that the covers are sturdy plastic and thus protect the contents of the notebook and are stronger than your average paperbound notebooks.The paper is good quality, the pages lined nicely, and the bindings sound.  Very pleased with these, and the beautiful array of cover colors.

This book had been on my shelf for a while, among my other WWII and Holocaust volumes, and I just happened to pick it up immediately after finishing Lipstadt's book on her libel trial in England.  So, I understand the reviewers who observe that this book includes numerous references to her trial.  For me, that was part of the value of the book, and it makes a fascinating read after the other work.I have read several books previously about the Eichmann capture and trial, and at first, I wondered whether there was anything new to be said about it.  I now know that Lipstadt does have much to add to the scholarship about Eichmann, including an extensive, detailed, and nuanced analysis of Hannah Arendt's famous work on the case (despite the fact, as I learned from Lipstadt, that Arendt actually attended very little of Eichmann's trial!).  I consider myself pretty knowledgeable about these topics, but I learned many new things from Lipstadt . . . e.g. Simon Weisenthal is the source for the much repeated but completely untrue assertion that the Nazis killed 5 million non Jews in the extermination camps.Events such as the Eichmann trial benefit from being revisited from time to time as time goes by.  Lipstadt explains all of the effects that the Eichmann trial has had on subsequent history and on the historyof the Holocaust.  I think this is a really excellent piece of work and it makes me want to read more from Lipstadt.  She seems so reasonable and factual, while at the same time candid about her own emotions and biases.  I am curious about her statement that comparisons of the Nazis' treatment of Jews to Israel's treatment of Palestinians are absurd.  I disagree and would love to hear/read her explanation for this broad statement, which surprised me, coming from her, and does not seem supported by the facts in the Holy Land.That one open question, which, of course, is in many ways beyond the scope of this book, does not detract from this work.  It is a thorough explanation of the Eichmann trial, with astute observations about the court process and clashes between the judges and the prosecutor (as a trial lawyer, this really interested me, and I would have sided with the judges, but I appreciate how Lipstadt uses the passage of time to demonstrate that the prosecutor may have been wiser than he was given credit for at the time), and about the history of the history of the trial.  Really great read.

Don't want to duplicate what other positive reviews have said.  I found this book compelling due to (1) the subject matter - the blatant invention and perpetuation of lies about the Holocaust and other historic events; (2) the description of how the British legal system works in a civil defamation case; and (3) because I am a trial lawyer, the insight into how our courtroom judgments and tactics can seem incomprehensible to even the brightest of clients.Not the finest piece of non-fiction writing, but kept my attention and I read it in about a day.A question I am left with... Holocaust deniers, like David Irving (who is the subject of this book), seemingly greatly admire Hitler and also despise Jews and other non-Aryan types.  Given their antisemitism, why do they try to claim Hitler wasn't behind the Final Solution and/or that there was no Final Solution?  Why don't they embrace the final solution along with Hitler?  It doesn't make sense to me.

I can only evaluate cat food on two basic criteria.  First, do the ingredients seem like they are healthy and good for my cat?  and Second, does my cat like and eat this food?On the first criterion, the ingredients seem to be fair for a cat, at least the turkey part.  On the other hand, cats are supposed to be carnivores, so the rice and cranberry components, while making for a nice Thanksgiving menu, do not seem particularly appropriate for felines.On the second criterion, taste, I must report that my elderly inactive male neutered cat does not like this food at all.  It has been sitting untouched in his food bowl for four days.  I purposely did not put any other food out for a while, and I knew he was hungry from his behavior, but he still would not eat this food.  So, with reluctance and apologies to the manufacturer, I must give this cat food a low rating.Two stars for the turkey component.  No stars for the rest.

I've always wondered about what went through Alexander Butterfield's mind when he became the person who revealed the existence of the taping system in Nixon's White House Oval Office and elsewhere.  This book provides answers, and is a fascinating and new angle on what took place back then from the beginning of Nixon's presidency through his resignation in 1974.I also had hungered for detail about how Butterfield came to tell the committee staff about the taping, and this book, i think for the first time, spells it out clearly.  Butterfield says he went into his interview with Congressional staff prepared to not volunteer anything, but to tell the truth if asked clearly and unambiguously.  Staff came very close to not asking the right question, and ultimately it was a Republican staffer, ironically, who phrased his inquiry in such a way (picking up on John Dean's offhand remark that he thought Nixon had behaved one day in the Oval Office as if there was a taping system in place) that Butterfield had no choice, having decided to be honest and truthful, but to tell what he knew.  Had the precise question not been posed, and/or had Butterfield been prepared to lie, the tapes may never have been revealed and the proof needed to remove Nixon from office may never have been acquired.  Amazing.Author Woodward got Butterfield to trust him enough to share personal recollections and a huge trove of documents which provide a very candid picture of the oddity that was Richard Nixon.  Butterfield's anecdotes provide detailed descriptions of Nixon's awkwardness and also his resentment of many who he thought had done him wrong, and/or who had been born into privilege.  The portrait of Nixon as a person in this book is fascinating.As is typical in books of this prominence, Woodward cites and thanks numerous people who edited and reviewed drafts.  Makes me wonder how so many awkward sentences got by.  There were numerous times in the text where I could not discern the person to whom a pronoun referred, for example.  Hard to imagine so many readers left so many  poorly constructed sentences in the final version.  Next time, call me, Bob!Another criticism is that the documents in the back are not indexed to the place in the text where they are discussed.  I enjoyed reading the documents, but didn't know that they were there as I read the text, and then, when I found the documents at the end, it was laborious to try to find where the discussion had been located.  How about some help for the reader?  Cross reference the pages, perhaps????  I also could not figure out why some, but not other, documents were included.  I would have liked to see the one where RN wrote to his wife, referring to himself in the third person, regarding his need for a larger bedside table.  No historical value to that memo I suppose, but another glimpse of Nixon as a human being.Because of the need for improvement in editing and the failure to cross index the documents to the text, I have deleted a star.  The content, however, justifies the remaining four stars.  As others have said, this is a very quick read that will hold your interest and amaze you if you are interested in the history of those times.

I am loving this eye cream.  I swear it is depuffing my under eye area.  I like that you put it on in the morning, under your makeup; I'm not so good about night time face rituals, but we all have to wash our faces in the morning, and it has been easy for me to dab some of this on every a.m., whether or not i am putting make up on.  So, the convenience of when it is advisable to use it (they recommend twice a day), works really well for me.  It is not greasy, and my makeup seems to go on just fine over it, once the cream is absorbed, which takes seconds.  And, I think it is making a difference, so I am a big fan.

So easy to put together, and, unlike way too many shoe storage racks I have assembled, is sturdy and will not come apart.  The genius of this boot organizer is that the uprights have a hole at the bottom that the rod at the bottom passes through, so there is nothing to come loose or need tightening.  Why can't other products be engineered so wisely?  I am a big fan.

I am not in the medical industry and thus did not acquire these gloves for medical work.  Rather, I use "rubber" gloves for housework and gardening, and I decided to give a latex free type of glove a try.  I got a box of small size gloves.I think these gloves are great.  I am an adult female and the gloves fit my hands perfectly.  They are thicker at the fingertips than elsewhere and are textured at the fingertips as well to make gripping and picking things up easier.  They work just fine, are strong and durable, and will have many applications and uses around my home.

Rarely do I make a purchase where I say to myself "I would have paid ten times more for this than it cost!".  Well, this product induced me to have that rare thought.  This thing is amazing, it picks up stuff (i'm always trying to retrieve dropped hearing aid batteries, which are tiny, elusive, hard to see on my hardwood floors and highly dangerous to children and animals if swallowed), it has a bright light that can be turned on, and it telescopes.  I just noticed that it is also sold by a Michigan company (& I am a Michigan resident), so that commends it as well.  The price for this multi-functional well designed and manufactured item is unbelievably low.  Pick one up before they wise up and start charging more for this wonderful gizmo.

I have to confess . . . I do not own a drone, and I therefore do not have a drone to carry or guard in this case.  That said, I love a good carrying case, and have many needs for same in my life.  This one is spectacular for a variety of needs.  The case itself is lightweight and has backpack straps for easy carrying when loaded.  On the interior, there are a variety of sections, that can be altered and resized for carrying an assortment of things and keeping them separate.  I have the need to transport arts and crafts materials and this case will be most handy in carrying those supplies and keeping them in good order in the process.
these slouch socks are the real deal, thick, heavy and super slouchy . . . totally pleasing purchase!

I really like this case.  It is lightweight, yet sturdy enough in the right places to protect my tablet.  I love the purple color, and I love the way it snaps to close and then can be used as a stand also.  If you have a tablet that this cover will fit, I highly recommend this choice.

This is a very sturdy and (despite the description) not so lean puppet.  Your hand slips in under his belly, and you can manipulate his head, his jaw, and his two tiny little "arms".  His teeth are big and scary, he is a substantial size overall.  He is going to be a gift for a friend of mine who, though inexplicable to me, loves both dinosaurs and puppets.  I'm sure she will be thrilled, as am I to find this perfect gift to suit her interests!

It slices like butta!  this compact device works like a charm, handily cutting through all of the packaging and tapes I've tried it on.  So, for functionality, and doing what it is supposed to do, I give it an A+.What I like even more, however, is how beautifully designed it is, from an ergonomic and aesthetic point of view.  It has three length settings, easily implemented with the orange sliding bar.  It has a hole in the end, should you want to hang it up, or on your keychain.  It is simply attractive and sleek and cute.

This kettle has bells and whistles I never imagined.  It heats water very quickly, and tells you what the water temp is.  You set the target temp, so if you don't want the water to boil, you can adjust the target temp down.  When you pour some boiling water out, it shows you that the temperature temporarily drops, but then it works to reheat the remaining water back to boiling.  I just love it.  and it automatically turns off or you can set it to stay on and keep the water warm.  The cord wraps around the base (underneath), so you only have to expose the amount of cord you actually need and don't have an extra length of cord cluttering up the counter top.  The base is slim and the footprint of the device is no larger than it needs to be.  I love this product.

I am so proud of myself that, after being annoyed at a barely moving bathroom sink drain for months, i decided to try to fix it myself before calling the plumber.  I of course first tried Drano - with no visible improvement.  So then I turned to Amazon, and found three products that I ordered (for a total cost of a lot less than a plumber visit) to try to unclog the drain myself.  This one was the first one I tried (one was a little cheaper and I think would have been too short to do the job, and the other cost four times as much). and voila, with a couple of plunges and twirls my long standing (pun intended) problem was taken care of.  Bravo to this product.  Give it a try!  Easy Peasy and at a great price.

I picked up this book to add to my growing library of works on Israel and Palestine, and I am glad that I did, because it adds the voices of people on the street, and not just any street, to the mix of history and scholarly opinion found on my bookshelf.Nissenbaum follows the history of one unique street in the city of Jerusalem, a street that inadvertently and unintentionally became a demilitarized zone during the first years of the State of Israel, and then morphed back into a street after the Six Days' War in 1967, and has become a microcosm of the plight of the Palestinians at the hands of the Israeli government and radical Israelis since.I was in Jerusalem this summer and I personally observed many of the kinds of things Nissenbaum describes in the book, so I do not doubt any of its veracity.  The story of how the lines were originally drawn between Israel and Jordan was new to me, and fascinating.  And I particularly appreciated Nissenbaum's general approach of using oral histories, for they revealed the humanity, warts and all, that persists in surviving while the Israeli government continues to hope that somehow the Palestinians will just give up and go away.  (note to Netanyahu: ain't gonna happen!).The candor found in the oral histories, including all of the prejudices expressed and the cluelessness evident, is an important contribution to the literature on these issues.  And the stories of cross-cultural friendship give hope for the future.

Functional, washable, totally cotton dishtowels, distinguished by their color palette - red, white and two different blues.  These are solid workaholic cloths suitable for a variety of house hold needs, from drying dishes and hands to mopping up spills.  I like them a lot.
Excellent product.  Does what it claims . . . the bags are super strong, and ultra flexible.  I will buy these again and again.

this is the best foot stuff i've ever found.  i've been using body butters on my feet, which are superior to other moisturizers, but they pale by comparison to this hemp foot stuff, which leaves my feet feeling moisturized for several days after one application.  I am a convert and will buy this product over and over again, i'm sure.  highly recommend.

Supercool new colors included in this package are grey, yellow (okay not so new), turquoise, dark blue, and brown.  The other neato feature of these markers is that you can make thick or thin lines with the tip, depending upon how you angle it to the writing surface.  So, with one tip, you have lots of versatility in the images or print you can create.  I love them!

Like tea used to taste!  The tea of my childhood.  Good, solid, old-fashioned black tea.  I have been drinking it hot and cold, and am pleased to report that it is tasty both ways, and will be my go to Iced Tea for the summer.  Plus it provides a kick of caffeine.  Return to your tea roots and enjoy this traditional beverage.

Mixed feelings.I did learn a great deal from this work.  It gave a practical reason for inner city folks not knowing one another's last names (which I have found to be true).  It explained how jail is sometimes a safe haven, how braggadocio does not always equal reality, how the women who know men are wanted can and do use that knowledge as power, and how commonplace arrest and release are in some communities.I read the 2015 version which includes a last chapter on some of her methodology and the personal changes she experienced while living in the neighborhood.  I would have appreciated, however, an explanation of the moral code, if any, of an ethnographer.  Like other readers, it seemed to me that, if true, Goffman's activities included aided and abetting a variety of crimes at a minimum (& i am a retired career prosecutor, thus fairly confident in my ability to recognize a felony when I see one).  What do the rules of ethnology say about participating in crime in pursuit of one's study?My other criticism is editorial.  I understand that a wrap up paragraph in each section or chapter can be de riguer, but I found the obigatory summary paragraphs in this book to add nothing but length to the text.  The summaries just restated what I had just read and were a waste of time to read.  I would cut them from future editions.

This stuff is fabulous!  I started with the side of my house, moved on to outdoor furniture and my car's floor mats!  Everything is now clean as a whistle with just the point of my hose!  I highly recommend this amazing cleaning product.
Solid, quotidian, no bells and whistles scissors.  They aren't flashy, but they get the job done.  (why do we refer to scissors in the plural?  at least I do!).

What an exceptional work of scholarship, research and writing!  This author has mastered a vast amount of information that spans 70 years and countless countries.  Much of the data comes from government files, many of which are classified, and in a huge number of foreign tongues.The book is beautifully organized.

Opening champagne or prosecco is a breeze with this gadget.  Never again put the room at danger from a flying cork, because you can now uncork any bubbly bottle with a simple twist of the wrist, and the cork will be caught neatly without travelling at all.  This thing is a winner!

This product claims that dog(s) will find these treats "irresistible".  And, guess what?  The claim is TRUE!  My two dogs, a Cairn Terrier and a Long Haired Chihuahua, can be quite finicky about treats . . . not everything sold as a "treat" is welcomed by this duo.  But these baked beefy bones were an instant hit at our house.  So, four paws and two thumbs up for these tasty treats.
Tastes great.  Crunchy, caramel-ly with a definite flavor of coffee.  I was already a fan of KIND products, and this addition to their line is one of the best from a mouth-feel and flavor standpoint.

The key feature of this litter is "LightWeight".  The litter is absorbant, odor reducing, and generally does what litter should do.  Importantly, however, it will not break your back when you lift the container and/or empty the litter box.  Thanks Purina for making a better mousetrap!
I have long been a fan of Contigo water bottles, and this one is fabulous.  The seal works superbly, and the blue burnished metal finish is gorgeous.
the perfect bra for my body

GoodGrips GreenSaver, where have you been all my life?  I am the queen of buying healthy in bulk, and then having the majority of my purchases of fresh fruits and vegetables go bad before they've been consumed.  So, this product is something I have needed for a long time, to keep my grapes crisp and edible and my greens fresh for salads. I think i'll get a second one, so that one can be designated for fruit - with the air holes open - and the other can be for veggies with the air holds closed.  The device uses a carbon filter which must be replaced every 90 days.  These kinds of requirements usually undo me, as I forget to make the replacements, and then I forget the interval involved, and then i forget what I am supposed to buy and where.  Fortunately, OXO must have had me and my kindred spirits in mind when they figured out we need reminders!  So, by signing up at greensaver.oxo.com, I will now get timely reminders via email when it is time to replace the filter!  Isn't that brilliant?

I think this is an important work of legal history.  I am a federal trial attorney who is very interested in the legal battles being waged in favor of Marriage Equality, so this book taught me a lot about what has gone on in lead up to the cases argued from my Circuit (the Sixth) in the Supreme Court just this week, on April 28, 2015.I was fascinated by all the detail about the maneuverings behind the scenes by various groups and entities who share the common goal of marriage equality; despite their agreement on what the prize should be, they have had many differences of opinion as to how to seek said prize, both in substance and in strategy and timing.  These same types of discussions and disagreements were part of the fabric of the legal efforts to seek equal rights for African Americans, from way before Brown v. Bd. of Education,  to way beyond.  I enjoyed learning about the ways in which various marriage equality constituents have agreed and disagreed, and about how Boies and Olson went ahead and did what they thought right (in bringing the case to challenge California's Prop. 8, in pretty much utter disregard of the carefully crafted, deliberately slow and methodical plan others had crafted and expected everyone to adhere to.I also LOVED the author's recognition that trials, governed by the Rules of Evidence, where witnesses are subjected to the greatest engine for truth yet developed -- cross-examination -- conducted ideally under the authority of a judge who requires responsive answers to proper questions are perhaps our only and best hope for finding fact.  I would guess that the author shares my frustration at every congressional hearing which purports to be fact-finding, where none of these rules apply.  In such hearings, the questions ramble, are filled with unproven allegations, no one requires witnesses to be responsive, and what results, though touted as fact-finding, is usually grandstanding, politicization, and a record filled with unprovable allegations masquerading as facts.  I so wish the the crucial issues of our time, Climate Change being the foremost, could be tried in a court of law in a similar way; the ridiculous unprovable allegations of deniers could be put to rest so that we might then unify in the need to act now to save our planet.  I can dream, can't I?That said, I don't know that this is a book for many lay readers, except those determined to master the legal nuances of the various approaches to winning Marriage Equality.  As a federal trial lawyer, I got so much out of this author's effort, and I commend him for recognizing the need for such a history and for writing it.I'm curious what the author thinks about Chief Justice Roberts' attempt to reduce the marriage question to one of simple gender discrimination?  I must admit, I am drawn to the simplicity of the position and the fact that it doesn't depend upon creating a new class based upon sexual orientation (not that I don't agree that sexual orientation should have elevated status for other situations).  I hope the CJ sticks with that view if it will allow him to join a majority ruling overturning CA6.  Read this book if you want to gain more nuance about the issues facing the Court.

I live in a northern clime, so have just now been able to spread this grass seed on the shady parts of my lawn.  It has already taken seed, so it is looking like a success at present, but only time will tell if the grass will continue to flourish as the seasons turn warmer.  I have a due date for this review, so I'm posting this partial review now.  Will update as the weeks go by to report on whether the seed has delivered as promised.  So far, so good though.

I am so happy with this rocker recliner, that adequate (& original) words fail me.  First, it is gorgeous!  and the fabric is sumptuous to the touch.  Second it is made in generous dimensions, providing enough room for my ample behind, as well as for my terrier!  Third, it rocks beautifully.  Fourth, the recliner mechanism is easy to reach and operate (unlike the other recliner I have).  Fifth, it is ultra-comfortable in each position.  Sixth, it was delivered so fast I couldn't believe it.Particularly given the bargain price at which this chair is available, this chair is a 5 star winner all day long!

I read it, every page, every word, and at the end I wondered why I did, and more importantly, why the book was written and published.  I'm taking off the gloves that other reviewers have kept on, I guess, but I found this book to be a very long drawn out detailed account of the author's life to date, wherein she gained very little useful insight about any of the events in her life, despite stewing in them ineffectively for decades.  I wanted to shout out to her "Just get some traditional therapy and anti-depressants for god's sake!" and I still recommend both to her if she is continuing to wallow.  In her view, her dad could never atone for his past absence in her life, yet she failed to see him for the odd fellow he is = three hours a day breathing through a snorkel while not swimming?  She failed to see that his life long quest for the magic new age answer to all of his problems was completely and utterly ridiculous.  She in fact also bought in to every non-traditional self-help treatment that came her way, with very little success or reason to ignore time proven methodologies.  The book has no story arc, nor any resolution  In fact, when I read its last words (before the acknowledgements) I did not realize that it was the end.  The book just stopped (at the author's present age I guess) with absolutely nothing much changed from the first pages in terms of her ability to function in relationships.  It had way too much detail about just about everything, and taught me absolutely nothing except how clueless the author remains.  And, despite the fact that there was very little arc in the story, she ended without letting us know if dad got new teeth (here or in Germany), if dad's prostate cancer was cured by his unorthodox approach to it, or if Marya succumbed to brain cancer.All this book consisted of is a tedious chronology in micro-detail of a person seeking insight in a variety of ineffective ways without making much progress.  I consider the time I spent on this work a complete and utter waste of time.
Stands way out from your belt. Also has somewhat sharp edges. This is a very poor design IMHO.
Ordered a large, I have a 7 3/8" head and it was way too small.

Great flashlight -- very bright and works well. The zoom feature is great because the narrow setting casts a long beam and the wide setting is better for close work and around the house.  Charger is cheaply made but it works, everything is as expected. I would give 5 stars for the flashlight and 2 or 3 stars for the charger, but I expected that and the overall value is great. I bought a better charger separately for all my lithium batteries.
Pros -Bright, compact, contains insert for AAA batteries.Cons -Not as well focused beam as competing products, and doesn't contain insert to fit 18650 batteries.

Pros:The setup process was clear and the unit works as advertised. My house is in an area where my Verizon cell phone has spotty connections (one or two bars on the first and second floor of the house) and this unit works consistently well from the basement. I'm very pleased with this purchase.Cons:One issue I encountered during setup is that there is a web site compatibility issue with my regular browser (IE 11) with the online form that requires you to input credit card (for the $30 annual text service cellular billing). The form's submit button was not active.  I switched to Firefox and it worked OK. A minor inconvenience but something I think the company should work on, as IE still has around 30-40% of the web browser user share.

All I can say is "incredible" how bright it is. It makes my 6v sealed-beam lantern look dim by comparison. The sealed beam is also bulky and heavy while the LED light is easily carried in a pocket or clipped on your belt.I like the slide focus that allows a very narrow long beam or spread beam for closer lighting. The narrow beam is a bit strange because it's square (like the LED source itself). The charger is junk, which I'm going to upgrade... It would have been better to order the light and charger separately. Also, the light needs to cycle through all modes (dim, flashing, etc). between uses.  I think it would be better if it allowed the user to choose which mode it starts with, somehow.

This is very nicely made, with thicker materials and higher quality clear panels compared with the Classic brand cab I used on my prior machine, and it fits my HS928TAS very well. I've been using snow thrower cabs for more than 15 years and it makes a huge comfort difference by reducing wind-chill and keeping me drier. Of course, it also prevents getting a face full of blow-back snow when the wind is wrong.With the auger height of my 2014 Honda HS928TAS set in "normal" position, the inside height of this cab (off the ground) is 79.5" at center, and 77" at the sides.I originally rated this 4 stars because some of the pieces needed slight twisting to line them up together with the length bolts provided. But I have upgraded it to 5 stars because after using it I really appreciate the quality vs. other snow cabs.  This is not an easy install, nor difficult.  I would consider it moderate for a seasoned DIY type, or difficult for someone working alone who isn't handy with tools. It would help to have two people (to hold parts in place while fastening) but I was able to do it myself.  You should have a ViceGrip, metric socket set (10mm,11mm and 12mm sockets), adjustable wrench or 11 and 12mm spanners.  I also strongly recommend an electric driver for the sockets, to save a lot of time/effort.Edit -- BTW this is made to fit Hondas by Original Tractor Cab in Arlington, Indiana.

Update 3/11/15: Bought a second case because the original started to tear (the vinyl covering the metal clip started to separate). This new one is a different size, and too thick for an iPhone 6 with slim TPU case.  Not worth the money to return but going to order something different.Original Review: This fits an iPhone 6 with slim TPU case. It's a nice case sized right, but the belt clip slides up and pops off, and the loops are inconvenient.  I don't like any case that has these belt loops or clip style.  I tried using only the clip, but the phone worked its way off my belt twice in a week and landed on the ground. Fortunately not lost or damaged, so I switched to the loops.In order to use the loops its easier to wear it on the right side, because if you want to wear it on the left side it must be threaded through the belt after it goes through the first pants loop and before it goes through ALL the other pants loops. Inconvenient!There is a problem wearing it on the right side if you drive a left-hand-drive car, because it will be directly beneath the seatbelt buckle and the buckle will press on your iPhone 6 (possibly hard enough to break it or bend it).  If you wear it on your left side, the seat belt is up over the left shoulder and down behind the seat, and there is no buckle on the left to interfere.
Beware of sharp edges.  The holes and edges can slice your fingers as bad as a grater.

This is not a comedy. Amazon's summary description as "comedy" is off base.  At most there are a few chuckles here and there. For the most part, it's  a depressing drama about unhappy people who are each dealing unsuccessfully with their own issues. The story develops at a snail's pace. The only reason I gave it 2 stars is because the character development is well done and subtle.

This is the second Lycra suit I'm buying from K9 Topcoat. I had my first one for about 3 years and unfortunately it shrunk too much when we put it in the clothes dryer (My error: I failed to follow cleaning instructions).We have whippets and use this coat occasionally to keep the dog from messing with any sutures or cuts. They seem comfortable (more comfortable than those awful cone collars) and the dog doesn't seem to mind. The fabric is smooth and breathes, and because it slides easily it does not pull on sutures. I would recommend these to any dog owner.

I wanted something large enough to protect both shoulders (and most of my lower body if not too windy).  It also needed to be able to auto-open, and be sturdy enough to stand up to most winds.  This is a great size (both folded and open).  My only complaint is that it's a bit heavy, but I suppose that's an acceptable trade-off for being a bit larger and more sturdy than others.

It appears to be nice quality, but the description (as of the time of this review) in the Amazon listing is "Width 27.5-Inch". The item I received actually measures 28 inches.This did not fit for me and I had to return it for that reason. Check your measurements before ordering.

This case fits, and is as advertised. It's inexpensive and does the job.  The inside of the cover is the same vinyl as used on the outside, and I think inside of the case should be a softer material than that.I can't understand why there aren't more cases available for this device, or why Samsung didn't step up to the plate.Update: The seller contacted me because this review wasn't favorable, and offered a refund. They do care about customer satisfaction.
A wonderful Brazilian jazz album with some of the best percussion riffs of all time. One of my favorites in my entire collection.

This was purchased about 5 or 6 years ago to remove bottom paint from my boat. I have found it stands up well to the hard use that such a big job requires. The motor is powerful and smooth.  It's a bit heavy for overhead use and sometimes I find myself switching to the smaller palm sander due to weight and ease of handling with one hand, but that doesn't have this level of power. If you want to sling a big pad and use two-handed power to handle the big jobs -- weight's the compromise for the greater power. It's still controllable with one hand though, and much more compact and lighter than my grinder, but this is best used as a two-handed machine.Overall I can't think of a criticism. For this class of machine I find it well-designed and built. I'm a do-it-yourselfer who prefers pro-quality tools, and I think this is a very nice machine.

Not much to write about a replacement bulb: It works or it doesn't. It was as described, packaging was good, and it included a full wire harness (not needed in my case but nice that they included it). Shipment was prompt and packaging appropriate.Why 5 stars? Well I didn't exactly "love it" so 4 stars would have been more appropriate ("like it").  However they did everything right in this case so look at 5 stars as an "A" grade.

These work just fine, but the fit of the connector feels scratchy as you insert it into the iPhone/iPad, like there's a sharp metal edge in contact with the sides of the device connector. I don't know if this will cause a problem over time from accelerated wear, but the possibility has entered my mind.I'm keeping as a backup, but would not buy again or recommend this item.  It's cheap but you get what you pay for.

This is a pomade that's nothing special (in terms of hair holding or look) but it has a strong smell that I didn't care for. It made me feel like I was walking in a "cloud" of scent. Others may like it, but I don't.  It has a firm hold without making the hair feel stiff.I do like the Framesi "CHILL" paste (and that's the reason I tried this product). So much for brand-loyalty.  Different scent, different packaging.  If it wasn't for the name/logo I'd think it was made by a different company.

My title says it all.  Lately my damp cellar has been seeing more insect activity than ever, especially camelback crickets (cave crickets).  I bought a 4-pack of these traps and they arrived today from Amazon. I put them around on the floor around 7 PM and went down to check at around 11 PM.  My review title says it all...  Just placed another order for 3 more 4-packs. Happy customer.  Hopefully these will do the trick.

This is the fifth book in the Pegasus series. I absolutely loved it!Emily is The Flame of Olympus. She thought she was an ordinary girl, but she is very special. She is a fantastic character, who has faced many challenges in the previous books and triumphed. I really like her. She is full of determination and spirit. However, she may be facing her hardest challenge yet! Can she survive?I have a soft spot for Emily and Pegasus, and when I heard that this book was due for release, I immediately pre-ordered it! This is a fantastic adventure, filled with danger and amazing twists and surprises. It was wonderful to meet all the previous characters like Pegasus, Joel, Paelen, Chrysaor and Chiron. However, there were new characters introduced: Fawn, a young girl who is a night dweller (where the myths of vampires come from), Lorin, a girl with her own piece of the flame and Pele, the Hawaiian volcano goddess.*Minor Spoiler!*After Emily helped defeat the Titans in the past (book 4), time reset and a new timeline was created. Lorin awakens from a deep sleep and finds herself trapped in Tartarus. And Emily makes another shocking discovery that changes her life once again.I started reading this book and read it in one sitting as I couldn't put it down! I found myself on an emotional roller coaster ride from beginning to end, as there are some very sad scenes that had me shedding a tear or two, but there is also a few witty scenes that had me smiling or laughing out loud. I love the imagery created by Kate O'Hearn, as it felt like I was actually there. I love the incorporation of several mythical creatures too, the descriptions of which were vivid enough for me to picture them quite easily. The action is intense and had me sitting on the edge of my seat. I felt sad when I reached the end because these characters have become my friends and I will miss them. I don't know if there is another book due in the series, or if this was the last one as it does not finish on a cliffhanger. But, if there is to be another book in the series, I'm on it like white on rice!Kate O'Hearn has created a world for Pegasus and the other Olympians that is completely believable. I love her writing style, which is very descriptive and the story flows beautifully. She is now one of my favourite YA authors. I have another one of her books from another series sitting on my Kindle, and I hope to get to read it soon.I highly recommend this book (and series) to children of 11+ and to adults alike (who love reading YA), as this is one of the most exciting stories I have read in a long time. - Lynn Worton

I was recommended this book from Audible due to my browsing/reading history. I read the synopsis and decided to give it a try. I'm glad I did because I loved it!I downloaded this as an audiobook after listening to the audio sample. I loved the narrator, David Rintoul. He brought the story and characters to life with his clear and precise reading.Thomas Fool is a wonderful character. He is an "Information Man", a policeman to you and me, who investigates things when the denizens of Hell cause chaos or misbehave. I really liked this person. I don't know what he did in his previous life to end up in Hell, but I got the impression that he was a good man. Perhaps he was in the wrong place at the wrong time. When a denizen is found murdered in a very brutal way, Thomas and his fellow Information Men are sent to investigate and quickly find themselves facing a dangerous adversary.Though I am not a huge lover of horror, I love detective stories. I started to listen to the story with no idea of what to expect. What I got was an unexpected journey through the eyes of the main protagonist, Thomas Fool. Hell is not a pleasant place to be in this book, and the demons are not exactly puppy dogs either. I love the descriptive quality of the horror in this book, though it can be pretty graphic and a little shocking. Some readers may find it too gruesome. Then again, my imagination can be a little too quick to paint vivid pictures and some may find that it may not be graphic enough for them. As only a moderate reader of horror, this story definitely shocked me (in a good way). I was quickly hooked and sat entranced as the story unfolded. It was a pleasure to see Thomas Fool's character grow throughout the story. He has to make some hard decisions in the course of his investigation. I wasn't so keen on his superior, Elderflower, though I only met him a few times. He reminds me too much of a government official, which I suppose he was to some degree. The Angels' Adam and Balthazar are interesting characters in their own way too.The story has several twists and turns that kept me guessing for quite some time. I am a huge fan of detective novels, and this story has several red herrings and distractions cleverly placed so that when the culprit is revealed, the reader is surprised. There is another surprise near the end that I never saw coming but, after thinking about it, it made perfect sense. I felt sad when I reached the end of the book because Fool has become a friend and I will miss him. I wonder if he will be investigating anymore incidents in Hell in the future? I sure hope so.Simon Kurt Unsworth has written a fantastic debut novel. I love his writing style, which starts slow but quickly picks up speed. I also love the flow of the story, the scenes flowed seamlessly from one to another. This author has found a fan in me and I would definitely consider reading more books written by him in the future.Due to the use of graphic horror and gore, as well as the use of foul language, I do not recommend this book to younger readers and to those who have a nervous disposition. I do, however, highly recommend this book if you love horror, suspense and detective stories. - Lynn Worton

I received a complimentary copy of this book from the author in return for an honest review.This is a touching and heartwarming story. I loved it!I am not one for reading many true life stories, but when the author contacted me about reading this book, I decided to try it. I am glad I did. Unfortunately, due to my rather large reading list, it has taken me quite a while to get to read it, for which I am truly sorry.This story took me on an emotional roller coaster ride. I am a highly emotional person when it comes to animals anyway. I have had my share of pets over the years (four dogs, one feral (turned tame) cat, a rabbit and a hamster. Oh, and some gupies - fish) and, although I currently don't have any at the moment, I would love to have either another dog or cat. Unfortunately, it is not possible at this time as I cannot afford to have one.Nevertheless, I fell in love with Leaf, who has a fantastic character. This dog has not had an easy life up until the Anderson's adopt him, and reading about their experiences with him made me laugh and cry. Gaining the trust of an abused or wild animal is one of the most rewarding experiences a person can have. The affection and love they share is more precious because it takes bravery to trust after being hurt. Leaf is one of those dogs that you wish you had found at the pound. However, not many people would have been brave to take on Leaf with all his issues. The Anderson's are that brave. This story is a mix of heartwarming and touching events, together with some very sad ones. However, it is mostly a story of hope, love and happiness. Animals are a gift; I believe they have souls and when they give their trust and love, we should grasp it and hold on to it for dear life.Allen Anderson has written a deeply touching story that captured my heart. I loved the photographs that were sprinkled throughout. They gave the story a visual insight into Leaf's character. I did feel that the story, although well written, to be a little slow paced for my taste. However, I am used to reading fiction, which is embellished to include fast paced action. A slower pace is sometimes good for the soul. I would definitely consider reading more books written by him in the future.I highly recommend this book if you love true life stories, memoirs or stories about dogs/animals. - Lynn Worton

This is the fifth book in the Eye Of The Storm Series. I loved it!Lydia is a fantastic character. I have really liked her from the start. She is a strong and stubborn woman, but she has not had it easy being a storm-wielder, mated to three sexy werewolves. After the battle with the Tridents, she is now grieving the death of her best friend, Brendon, and her father. However, there is more challenges to come. Will she manage to keep her family together, or will Selena get her revenge?I have been eagerly awaiting the release of this book for months (almost a year)! I started reading this story and couldn't put it down. In fact, I read this in one sitting! The story continues from the end of the fourth book and is again told from various points of view. I have missed these wolves a lot!I am still a little speechless about this book. It completely blew me away! In this book we get to see a little of Gladys's past. She has been a mysterious woman for most of the series, so being able to see her history in the manner of flashbacks or dreams brought her more to life. Her story is not a particularly nice one. I really felt for her as she dealt with some really nightmarish and hair-raising events and made me understand her a little more. However, it's the shocking revelations that are revealed later in the book that completely left me breathless. Now I'm worried what this will mean for the quartet in the near future.Selena is not my most favourite of characters, but even I felt for her as she had to make a most difficult choice. Again, I wonder what the future holds for her.I love how the relationship between the four: Lydia, Lawrence, Ryan and Taylor has grown even more.Lawrence is not one to show his vulnerability much, as he hides behind a wall he erected to protect himself. However, it touched me deeply that he would drop his defenses to show his vulnerability to Lydia. He has come a long way since his arrogant facade in book one. I don't normally include quotes in my reviews, but I love what Lydia says to Lawrence, "They never got you, don't you know that? You irritating, charming, stubborn, evolved, intolerable, sweet, complex, caring, melodramatic bastard with your heart of gold. They never got you. You're wholly you, and you're perfect.", and it's true.Ryan and Taylor. What can I say? I love these two men as individuals, but as they become closer, I love them as a couple; they made me envious. I love the scene in the van. It made my knees go weak, it was that hot! The bedroom scene is just as sensual. I love the way the author has written those scenes, as it shows the love these characters have for each other. I haven't read many m/m stories, but those I have read pale in comparison.The story has several twists and turns, not to mention shocking revelations, and is masterfully told. The sensual heat factor in the story is hot enough to start a fire, and the ending has left me wanting more! I cannot wait to read the next book as soon as possible!Dianna Hardy is one of my favorite authors. I love her writing style, which is fast paced and fluid. Reading her books are a joy, and I will continue to read them for as long as she keeps writing them.Due to the explicit sensual content and some bad language, I do not recommend this book for younger readers. However, I highly recommend this book (and series) if you love HOT erotic paranormal romances with sexy werewolves. Please note there is m/f and m/m action in this book, as well as violence, and may offend some readers. - Lynn Worton

I received a complimentary copy from the author in return for an honest review.This is the fourth book in The Master of Whitehall Saga. I loved it!Charlotte Ann Erikson is a fantastic character. I liked her very much. We were first introduced to her in the first book, The Master of Whitehall. This is her story and follows her journey from being a young daughter of a sea faring merchant in 1625, to one of the most enchanting but deadly immortals still alive today. I really liked getting to know her better, and enjoyed watching her growth as a character worthy of respect.Having read the other three books in the series, I was excited when the author contacted me and asked if I would be interested in reading this one. I jumped at the chance and was not disappointed.I was quickly pulled into the story and was swept away into the past. The author has done a lot of research into the history of not only countries, specifically the European continent and the United Kingdom and lastly America, but the important events within those countries through the centuries. His descriptions brought the past to life, as well as certain characters. I loved meeting Ferdinand, Charlotte Anns future mate, though his history is a bit of a mystery even to this day. He seems to be warm and loving though, so I hope his story will be told one day. I also loved meeting Jemison. He may be a mortal, but he (along with his family) plays an important role in Charlotte Anns life. Immortals seem to have no concept of time, unless certain events or people they meet interact with their normal day to day existence. Jemisons character definitely makes an impact on Charlotte Anns life and gives her a reference point for time. Another character that makes an impression on her life is James Dubois (The Master of Whitehall, book one in the saga). He becomes her child, lover and friend. However, her heart still belongs to her mate and one true love, Ferdinand.This book is told through the eyes of Charlotte Ann and it took me on a roller coaster ride of emotion. I found myself empathising with Charlotte Ann as she dealt with the terrible loss of a parent. It is not easy to lose someone you love. I also felt her happiness in finding Ferdinand and the sadness at their parting. I also was a little envious of her for finding a wonderful companion and friend in James. But I was totally ecstatic when a surprise visitor makes a return. Charlotte Ann has lived a long and sometimes turbulent life, and I have thoroughly enjoyed taking a journey through history and her memories of them with her. I hope that she will have many more years to make new memories in the future.Rick Veal has written an intriguing series of love, loss, friendship and emotional growth that will take the reader on a roller coaster ride of emotion. His characters are lifelike and likable. His writing style has improved a lot and is faster paced than ever before. The flow of the story is wonderful, and this kept me turning the pages. I do not know if there will be any more books in this series, but even if there are not, I would definitely read more of this authors work in the future.There are some scenes of a sensual nature that are a little on the hot side (although not as explicit as some books I have read), so I do not recommend this book for younger readers. I do, however, recommend this book (and series) if you love paranormal romances with sexy vampires or immortal beings. - Lynn Worton

I received a complimentary copy of this book from the author in return for an honest review.This is the third book in the Seven Forbidden Arts series. I loved it!Lann Dran is a complex character. I liked this man very much. He can come across as cool and aloof at times but, this hides his deeply felt emotions. He knows that if he lets his emotions out, his ability to control air could cause serious damage. He entered a contract with Katherine White, never expecting to see her again after thirty days, but when she comes to him with some unexpected news, he finds himself having to protect her from a dangerous foe.Katherine White is a wonderful character. I liked her very much but felt that she wasn't given enough rein by the author to fully explore her strengths. She came across as strong willed, but seemed to submit too easily to Lann's authority. I don't know if this is a good thing or not. Maybe it has something to do with their contract/relationship in book two.Having previously read 'The Astronomer' which was written by this author, I was pleased when she contacted me, asking if I would like to read this one. I quickly took her up on her offer. However, I think it would have been better for me to read the series from the beginning, rather than from just book 3. This is because there are references made to events that happened to the characters in book one and two which completely went over my head. There are also conversations between characters that seem to be continued from earlier too. But, this is only the small gripe I have.Once I got over the confusion, I was quickly pulled in and I didn't put the book down until I had finished it. There are many paranormal romances out there that touch on the elements of fire, air, water and earth, but this series seems to be unique. The author has created a world where wielding an element is forbidden. If found out, dire consequences follow. The characters come alive on the page and I found myself on a roller coaster ride of emotion, especially when Katherine finds herself in a very difficult situation. I really felt for both protagonists as they came to terms with something that could potentially break their spirits, if not take their lives.There are also a couple of interesting characters introduced. I didn't like the creepy Adam; he made my skin crawl. However, I did feel sorry for Nicholas and the way Adam treated him (as if he was a bug under his shoe). Joss and Clelia return in the book and, although I haven't read their story, their love is palpable. Speaking of palpable, the heat generated by Lann and Kat is definitely hot. There are explicit scenes in this book that had me wanting to grab a cold drink to cool off! Talk about scorching! There is also a lot of danger and intrigue mixed in to make this one series I am looking forward to continuing. However, don't make my mistake. Read the first two books in the series before starting this one.Charmaine Pauls has written an entertaining standalone erotic romance. Her characters are lifelike and come alive on the page. I love her fast paced writing style and the flow is wonderful. I would definitely consider reading more of her books in the future.Due to the explicit nature of some of the scenes, as well as use of foul language, I do not recommend this book to readers under the age of 18. I do, however, recommend this book if you love science fiction, erotica, erotic romance or paranormal romance genres.  Lynn Worton

This is a fantastic tale. I loved it!Abbie is a wonderful character. At first, Abbies abrasive behaviour rubbed me the wrong way and I didn't like her very much. However, as the story unfolded and I began to understand that she used verbal slights as a way of protecting herself  a thorny disposition to hide her true self. After being kicked out by her mother at seventeen, a pregnant Abbie finds herself living in a trailer park. When her mother dies fifteen years later, Abbie finds herself facing memories she would rather forget, but desperate to claim the locker her father left for her before his death.Having previously read 'The Jewel Box', when I heard that this book was being released, I quickly bought a copy. I started the book and didn't put it down until I had finished it. I found myself quickly caught up in the story and intrigued with the various characters introduced. Though I didn't care for Julienne (she's a stuck up, money grubbing piece of work in my opinion), I fell in love with most of the other characters. I think my favourite, outside of Violet, Geoff and Bryan, is Kevin. He is Violet's son, who has slight brain damage and, though he's in his twenties, has the mental capacity of a thirteen year old. He has a unique ability to make me laugh with his enthusiasm and joy of life.This is a very touching story of loss, sadness, joy and happiness. Although I have never lived in a trailer park, the sense of community within the pages of this book made me feel very envious. Violet is the matriarch and glue which holds it all together. I must admit that I have always had a close relationship with both my parents, so reading about Abbie's lack of one with her mother made me feel quite sad. But, she finds a mother figure in Violet and it made me glad. As you can tell, this book took me on a roller coaster ride of emotion from beginning to end. There is a lot of sarcasm and wit from not only Abbie, but from Geoff too. Their verbal sparing made it difficult to understand if they hated each other or not, but their mutual respect shone through near the end. There are some twists and turns that kept me wondering, but there is one huge surprise that had me shedding tears. I'm not saying whether they were tears of joy or sadness, because you'll just have to read the book for yourself to find out. I must admit that I did a little fist pump when a character got their comeuppance and is outed. I reached the end of the story and had a bittersweet reaction. I was sad that the story had ended, but happy that all issues had been resolved.C. Michelle McCarty is an author with a talent for writing a captivating story. I love her descriptive writing style, which brought the characters to life. Though it is not as fast paced as other books I have read, the pacing makes it easier to get to know the characters better. The story flows wonderfully from scene to scene. I look forward to reading more of this author's books in the future.I highly recommend this book if you love contemporary fiction. - Lynn Worton

This is the first book in the Shadow Kissed series. I loved it!Kaye Brand is a fascinating character. I liked her a lot, though at first she didn't enamor herself to me. She comes across as a bitter and sarcastic drunk, but as I got to know her better, I grew to like her, though I wanted to slap her on occasion for the way she treated Jack. She has not had an easy childhood and this affects her behavior and attitude. She is a fire mage, and wielder of shadows. Selling her talent to the highest bidder in order to survive, she finds herself facing a past she would rather forget when she meets Jack Bastian, a man who is meant to be her enemy.Jack Bastian is a wonderful character. He may be an angel, but he has his own share of secrets. I enjoyed getting to know this warrior better. He can be a little arrogant at times, but this is part of his charm. When he hires Kaye to help him, he knows he could get burnt, but there's something about her that draws him to her.This is one of the books I have been wanting to read for some time. When it was first released, I added it to my wish list and bought a copy as soon as I could. Unfortunately, due to my rather large reading list, it has taken me a while to get to read it. I feel rather bad about the delay, because as soon as I started reading, I didn't put it down until I finished it.I must admit that when I first started to read this book, I felt like I was reading from a book in the middle of a series rather than the beginning of one. This turns out to be partially correct. There is a series prior to this one called "Shadow Series" which, although I haven't read them, has many of the other characters in them. However, when I first bought this book, I didn't realise it at the time. So when I began reading this book, I had a feeling I was missing something. Some of the characters, especially those like Jack and Adam Thorne, have a history and their interactions gave me the impression that they were continuing a conversation they were having from previous visits. This is not a bad thing, though it did make me curious as to how the two met. Nevertheless, this story hooked my attention from the first page and didn't let me go until the last.The story is told from both Kaye's and Jack's points of view, which I liked. This gives the reader an insight into both their thoughts and feelings.There are several twists and turns in this story too; just when I thought I knew where the story was going, something would occur that completely threw me. I was expecting a romance story, but it is so much more than that. There is an undeniable spark between the two main characters and their chemistry is hot! They compliment each other quite well; perhaps it is good that Jack is ice to Kaye's fire, because they could definitely set something on fire with the amount of heat they generate! However, it is the intrigue and danger of Kaye's mission regarding her former fiance, Ferrol Grey, that sent shivers down my back. I took an instant dislike to this man. It may be a little unfair of me to hate him instantly, but I have never liked what I call "snake charmer salesmen". You know the type of person - so smooth and charming, though undeniably evil, it turns your stomach - that you shudder at the thought of them? Well, that was my reaction to Ferrol. I love the way the story took me on an amazing roller coaster ride of emotion, so when I reached the end I felt quite sad; I felt I was leaving some new friends. Though this story doesn't end in a cliffhanger, I am looking forward to reading the next book in the series as soon as I can.Erin Kellison has written a fantastic paranormal romance. I love her fast paced writing style and the flow was wonderful. She has created a fascinating, believable world where fae and angels live amongst humans, though hidden by spells and enchantments for the most part. Her characters come alive on the page and I could picture the scenes in the book quite clearly. I would definitely consider reading more of this author's work in the future.Due to the heat level, I do not recommend this book to younger readers. However, I highly recommend this book if you love older YA or erotic paranormal romances. - Lynn Worton

This is the first book in the Lux series. I loved it!Katy is a normal, everyday teen, who also happens to be an avid reader, book blogger and reviewer. She is full of angst after moving to West Virginia with her mother after the death of her father. I liked her a lot, though her (sometimes) bitchy inner monologue, as well as her constant swooning over Daemon grated on me at times. After meeting Daemon, her new next door neighbour, things begin to get interesting.I bought this book (in paperback format) from http://Amazon.com way back in 2013 (though there seems to be no record of it in my account now?), as I had heard good things about it. Unfortunately, due to my rather large reading list, I have only recently been able to read it.I began to read and was quickly hooked; I managed to read this book in one sitting. The story is told from Katy's point of view (in first person). This gives the reader the opportunity to watch things unfold from Katy's perspective. I really liked this, but often wondered what Daemon was thinking or feeling. However, reading between the lines, I got an impression of Daemon's character. He can be a total arrogant jerk, but he can also be a caring person. I must admit that I felt like slapping him a time or two myself, but I also realised why he was acting the way he was - he was protecting not only himself but his family too.In a way, this story reminded me of my favourite YA TV programme as a teen, Roswell, which was also based on a series of books. You have a gorgeous guy, who happens to be an alien, and a teenage girl who lands herself into trouble. Throw in a lonely sister and you have a recipe for an exciting YA adventure/romance. Speaking of Dee, I liked her a lot more than Daemon. She is enthusiastic and bubbly, nothing like her sterner twin. The story is a little predictable if you have read a lot of similar YA stories *cough* Twilight *cough*, but if you are new to this genre, this has to be one of the best books to begin with. There are several twists and turns that kept me riveted from beginning to end, and the ending left me wanting to keep reading. I am hoping to read the next book in the series as soon as I can. Hopefully, it won't be another two or three years; it's sitting on my bookshelf, staring at me, so I had better get a move on and read it!Jennifer Armentrout has written a fantastic YA romance. I love her fast paced writing style. The dialogue is sharp and snappy, though some of the characters are not as well developed as they could have been. However, the flow is wonderful and scenes flowed seamlessly from one into another. I would definitely consider adding this author onto my favourite authors list, and I will be reading more of her books in the future.I highly recommend this book to teens aged 14+, and to adults who love reading books in the YA genre. - Lynn Worton

Review 6*This is the third book (and concluding story?) of the Legends Saga. I absolutely LOVED it!Ireland Crane is twenty four years old and a relation of Ichabod Crane of Sleepy Hollow fame. I liked this stubborn, witty woman very much. She is still struggling with having the spirit of the Horseman inhabiting her body and coming to terms with the loss of her friend and mentor, Rip Van Winkle. Now on a mission with the father of time travel, H.G. Wells, Ireland will have to face her deepest fear, letting the Hessian take control in order to break the curse.I have been eagerly awaiting the release of this story.
