I don't know how many stars to rate this. On one hand I could not stop reading. I love these type of second chance stories. I was never bored while reading this. I love the angst and how Emma was leery of Gabriel. Then things took a turn and it was crazy, but I did not mind it.However here are my issues and why I was just a little irritated, Major spoilers. Do not read if you do not know what happens towards the end.Spoiler below...Keep scrolling....Keep scrolling.....Keep scrolling for major spoilers.I hated that Gabriel told Emma he had something to take care of that Sunday that they had planned together only that that "something" was taking care of Embry who told Gabriel she took a bunch of pills. Embry lied just so that Gabriel would stay the night with her. There is no cheating. It is clear that Gabriel loves Emma. However, I think he knew at this point what a snake Embry was and why he believed her, I do not know. Was it because he was her Dom and she was his sub? All the lies he told Emma bothered me. Part of me understands that Gabriel lied so that Emma would not know that he was a Dom and he was into BDSM, which would scare her off but then he seemed so angry that he had to act "perfect" because that is what she wanted.I enjoyed reading this book, but I am not sure if Gabriel could ever be completely honest with Emma.

So I was going to DNF this book 3 times, but every time I thought of quitting, I looked at the great reviews again and asked myself "what am I missing???  The third time was the charm.  I could not stop reading.Sophia is kidnapped by a vampire and brought back as a gift to the prince, Derek, who has woken up after 400 years. Sophia will now be Derek's  blood slave.  However, Derek sees Sophia do something very sentimental to another human and is drawn to her.  I wanted to initially DNF this book because I thought some of Derek's behavior was a little too insta for my liking.  However, the way everything else came together...it was not.  The way the author took her time with Derek and Sophia.  I loved their private scenes.  I needed a break from heavy sex/erotica scenes so I enjoyed the intense chemistry  without the sex in this book.I ALSO almost DNFed the book because I was annoyed with Sophia and the way she was thinking about Ben...her BFF, who ditched her on her birthday.  If my BFF treated me that way, I would not be his BFF anymore.  But Sophia is a little naive and she does care her friend, so I guess I will have to put up with that whole part of the series.  Sophia is a kind person so wants everyone to be cared for.My third reason for ALMOST DNFing was that I am not a fan of dual POVs and especially when the switch happens every other chapter, but I got used to it.  Initially the dual POVs, I felt gave away to  much, but later in the story there was enough suspense going on that it worked.I can not wait to move on to the next book.  I love all the evil that is lurking and how everything is NOT sweet.

This was not a bad quick read.  Boston is a very rich man.  He makes  Julianna an offer she can not refuse.  Julianna has an older brother who was in an accident and now needs a lot of medical attention that she can not afford by just being a waitress.  Boston tells Julianna that her brother will get the best medical attention money can buy but in return she gives him her body.Boston is 10 years older than Julianna.  Boston comes off as a jerk.  Boston is not kind. He is very honest that he is just using her, but the author did a great job giving me a glimpse that there may be more to Boston and why he is the way he is.  This book ends in a cliffy.  I liked the story, but not sure if I will read book 2 yet.  The cliffy I am worried will just drag out Boston's mostly nasty attitude to Julianna.  Plus, I did not hate the characters, but I did not love them enough to care what would happen to them.

The first quarter of this book goes back and forth in flashbacks which is not something I like in my stories.  It was done well and it did not bother me as much as I thought it would.I liked the characters.  These two characters went through something horrific when they were 17 years old.  Kane and Helene were best friends even though they flirted with becoming more, but after the tragedy Kane left with a goodbye.  Now he is back 11 years later. He wants and needs Helene back...his "Hell".There was a switch in POVs every other chapter which became too much for me.  There were times I was not sure which voice was "speaking".The book had its moments, but for the most part I felt that the characters' actions were redundant. Same ol thing and the sex scenes became boring. I was just waiting for the story to be done.  I bought this book for $3.99 and it was a regret.

DNF at 20%Heroine meets a stranger and has sex with him the first night without a condom. Not hot. She is on the pill so that makes unprotected sex with out a condom okay and safe??? loc 12%Plus it felt like the heroine was pining for a guy names Bash.I could not connect to these characters so I had to quit.

Book 2 in the Empathy series.  I would recommend that you read the first book in the series, Empathy.  Desolute takes place 18 years later.  The review will give away spoilers if you have not read Empathy yet.I liked this one but was nervous where it was going until about 25%.  So creepy, but it was so good. I do love books about serial killers.  I usually do not care for multiple POVs, but the author did a great job.Ryan is just evil and has no feelings, but he wants to meet his niece Cereus after being locked up in a mental institute.What annoyed me about the story was how Blake and Melody knew the danger of Ryan and all his evil yet never communicated. At points, their attitude was ruining the story for me.There is a twist and other things that kept the story interesting. Like I mentioned, the only things that annoyed me was Blake and Melody's secrets from each other.

I really liked this book.  I loved the protective alpha male Jake was. I really enjoyed the mystery in the story.  It was a great read. I am glad my friend Michelle recommended it to me!!Isla knew Jake Devine back in college 10 years before.  Jake left unexpectedly and she never saw him again until she she collided with him at a function she was working as a server.  Jake and Isla were never really friends and when she sees him for the first time in 10 years, he does not really look happy to see her.  However, there is more to the why Jake left and what happened to Isla 10 years before.The author did a great job just giving snippets of Jake's POV here and there.  Just enough to keep me questioning everything.

I just finished THE AUSTRALIAN  by Lesley Young and really liked it so I picked up THE FRENCHMAN.  I am so glad I read THE AUSTRALIAN first before THE FRENCHMAN.  I would never would have read another book by Lesley Young if I read this book first.  The heroine, Fleur, moved to France after finally being reunited with her birth mother. Her first week in France, she meets Louis who is a big rugby star.  Fleur is a virgin but is desperate to lose her virginity and her first week in France, she meets Louis. Fleur says she feels passion like never before and wants to give it up for Louis except Louis puts the brakes on it.  Fleur just annoyed me.  She appears desperate even though she tried to appear as she was not. Louis treated her poorly that first night they met, but she was still willing to give it up to him since he was soooo good looking. Not sure what to think about that...There are snippets of Louis coming off as "nice" but for every nice, you got a lot of pages of attitude from him.  I love bad boys, but Louis to me came off as such a jerk in the first 25% that I could not get over his attitude and Fleur's "desperation".Fleur has the annoying and slutty BFF.  Even though that friend went back to Texas,  Fleur talks to her on the phone a lot.This book did not work for me at all.  It may work for you.

I loved the first half of this book. I love quirky heroines and I loved the mystery behind the hero. I would have given this book 4.5/5 stars but at 75%, the book took a turn for me.  I did not like the decisions the heroine made.I loved how they played "do you know how much I liked you?"As I mentioned, I really loved this book until 75% or so.  It reminded me of Penny Reid's Neanderthal Seeks Human and Janie.  It was the same, but different. I loved Janie in Neanderthal and all her quirky behavior so when I started reading this and saw how quirky Charlie was as well, I really got into the story.  However, the decisions that Charlie made felt wrong to me and that is when I disconnected.Spoiler below:What ruined it for me at 75% Part of me understood her wanting to protect her friend, B, but on the other hand her siding with the cops just felt wrong. I would not be able to forgive her. The story went downhill for me after she deceived Jace the way she did. Yes, Charlie had a hard time with understanding people's emotions, but she should have gone with her gut. She was not that naive.

Lindsey, the heroine, just annoyed me.  Spoiled rich girl with huge trust fund.  Why any man would want to actually keep her after they had sex with her was a mystery. Not sure why Dimitris would want her or Brody. One of my favorite statements in the book that was made to Lindsey which was along the lines of "good luck to any man that can handle attitude 24/7".  T I am not even sure why she had such attitude all the time.  Nothing ever made her happy.  Plus she had that attitude of "I can do what ever I want to do whenever I feel like it." Dimitris asked Lindsey to wear a bra...out of respect when dining with his family and she could not even do that.  It was "Me this. Me that." loc 18%The attitude became redundant.  Ruined the book for me.

3.5/4 StarsI have had this book in my Kindle library forever.  I was in a mood for a clean romance...no erotica, no detailed sex scenes.  I just wanted a love story.  This one was one also that had a second chance theme which is one of my favorite genres.Where do I begin.Josie is 13 and Sam was 18.  They were friends who talked, read, and listened to music on the bus to and from school.  I loved these scenes.  Josie always knew that Sam wanted to be a marine so after graduation, he left. She wrote to him, but after some time, Sam stopped writing to Josie.10 years later Sam is back.This is where I would have liked one chapter in Sam's POV.  I do not care for dual POVs, but I was so frustrated with Sam sometimes. I just wanted to know for one or two paragraphs how he felt. Many times, his attitude was "I love you and I do not want you with anyone else, but I have to go away again and leave you here."  My heart always broke for Josie who did everything for everyone, but when would it be her turn to have someone give everything to her?  I liked this book a  lot.  The author does an amazing job connecting you to the characters, to the town, to the story.  However, I wish I would have gotten more of Sam going after Josie.  Josie was just so easy to forgive and to accept what little people gave her.  I want some one to fight for her. I never felt that from Sam.  Sam was genuine and I know he loved Josie, but it is like he always knew that she would be there.  Sam was very kind and towards the end there are some revelations, but I have to say that even at 95%, I had no idea how this book was going to end. The epilogue was beautiful.I would recommend this book. It was a very nice read and a break from the continuous releases of erotica which I am getting tired of.

I really love stories when the nerdy girl catches the eye of the popular guy.I first got the sample of this book, read it, liked it and clicked buy for $3.99.  Thinking back, not sure it was worth $3.99. The story was nice.  The characters were okay.  Tripp is not your possessive, alpha jerk.  He had had a hard time/life at home.  Hadley assumed he had it all when he really didn't.  She made assumptions like everyone else about him even thought she should have known better since people at school made assumptions about her.What I did not understand and why the author wrote Hadley's character to always be annoyed by her little step-siblings.  It made her appear very cold.  This threw me off about her and I hated the scenes where she would complain about something so juvenile.I liked the story, but I think there were moments where the execution could have been better. That "something" was missing and days after reading this book, I still can't put my finger on it. It is written in dual POVs - first person.  I think it would have been better if the switch did not happen every other chapter.  I knew what each of the characters were thinking at every moment. I like the intensity of not knowing sometimes.

DNFI just could not connect. From the reviews, it looks like it is one of those...it may work for you, but did not work for me.Spoiler belowThe heroine goes on a trip and cheats on her boyfriend (almost fiance) with the hero. She can't help or something she says/thinks. Whatever.  And the hero has a "girlfriend" that he wants to break up with but before either of them "break up" their relationships with their partners, they have sex.  They have sex the first night they meet. I can't stand this type of cheating.  I loathe heroines like this one. Plus the hero waited for the heroine to come up to him at the bar. Not sure how I felt about that.

I could not connect. Holli goes to a business thingy in Vegas meets Jack Dalton while trying to buy a drink at the bar. She has sex with him. This is not Holli's first one night stand and she admits that to him, but he is okay with it. Not sure how any guy wants to hear that you have had a few one night stands and hear you talk about the walk of shame, but to each its own.  Later Holli finds out that Jack Dalton is not who he said he was, but the lead singer of one of the hottest bands and goes by the name Johnny Outlaw.  She feels lied to, blah, blah, blah and it goes from there.Holli was not a heroine I cared for.  Her friends annoyed me. I was never sure what to think of Jack. There was a lot of sex without  much else going on unless they fought.I regret buying this one and am grateful that I did not waste more by getting/adding narration on audibles. I love rock star books where the heroine has no idea she is actually meeting a rock star, but  this did not work for me.  It may work for you. I felt the writing was okay.  I just could not connect.2 stars because Amazon rating states that is "I did not like it".

I could not connect to the characters. I did not feel this "connection" that they were supposed to have when they see each other at their high school reunion. I love these type of stories but this one lacked everything for me. I thought nothing of either Megan or Tyler. This was one of those books that I was disappointed that I wasted my money on. The author wrote the book in third person, which I think was the other problem. I felt like everything was told to me in stead of allowing me to feel.

I just could not connect. I think it was my problem with the heroine.  I did not understand why in the beginning  and middle of the story Olivia was defending Andy, her abusive boyfriend, except that her parents are on the brink of bankruptcy and she only has a few thousand left that her grandmother left her.  Why could she not get a job to continue school? Why can't Olivia get a job???  I did not understand what Bash saw in Olivia that made him want her so much. I understood why he helped her when Andy was on the verge of attack (Bash is a very nice person), but the rest I could not understand. I did not feel the connection.  I did not either like or hate the characters.  They were just there.  I feel bad for Bash since he is going to get the bad end of this deal.  I feel bad for Bash because he is a hard worker, but then he should have known better that get involved with a girl who (more or less) defends her boyfriend  when he tries to warn her and her response..."You don't know him, Bash." (Loc 690/61%)Dual POVs.  The switch happens frequently.

I bought this because I thought it would be funny, cute and romantic.  The beginning was funny, but then it got awkward and many of the scenes just made me cringe.The fact that Rosie at 23 years old was that naive to sex and a penis was ridiculous.  I could believe the fact that she was a virgin because of her upbringing, but the restno.  There is Google and porn.I regret buying this book for $3.99.  I saw all the amazing reviews, but this humor is not for me.So many scenes in this book were so uncomfortable.  Below are spoilers.#1 - When Rosie farted on one of her dates while he was giving her oral.#2  When she threw up on the one guy while trying to give him oral.#3  It got annoying when Rosie continued called her vagina, Virginia.  The joke got old.#4 - Henry going through his all his dates got exhausting. I did not like (even though he was drunk) that he called one of his many dates,  Rindy one of the hottest pieces of a** he had seen in the longest time.  This was supposed to be the time he was supposed have his feelings changing for Rosie.  Maybe he was trying to hurt Rosie.  However, he could be hurtful.

My opinion and has some small spoilers, but not about the ending.  Just what made me not connect to the characters.Here are my thoughts.I was excited to read this one but I am tired of the annoying BFF that pushes her friend to have sex with a stranger. (The friend can tell by the guy's looks that he is not a serial killer?!?!)  I just did not feel the connection. I mean what was it about the Chloe that had Max so taken by her? Was she that beautiful?? What made her so beautiful??? I mean he barely spoke two sentences to her before she pushed herself down his cock.  How did he know she was all "innocence and seduction"?  She was at a bar attending a bachelorette party?!?!  Written in dual POVs so you know what each character is thinking at all times. It is probably all me and may work for you.  Honestly.  You should probably give it a try. I love when couples meet at  bar, but this one had no connection for me before they went and did it minutes after meeting.The heroine meets a stranger at a bar at her BFF's bachelorette party.  She has sex with him and then leaves without telling him goodbye or anything only to see him 2 months later.

This is my opinion.I love these stories...LOVE them but this was a DNF at 45%. Allison was not likable at all. She was so bitter and that chip on her shoulder... My GAWD!!!! I did not grow up with much either, but I was never so bitter. Yes, it is hard, but you don't blame other people. Allison had nothing nice to say. SO angry. A bad vibe. Who would want to be friends with someone so bitter?!?! I could not connect. It would have been better if the heroine was in the same situation, but just said "this is my life and I am the one that can change it by getting a great education, working hard, and BEING NICE!!!" Allison was going to a great school through a grant!!!! She should be happy, not complaining.

I was hoping for better. I think the heroine was going to give it up too quick. I mean within two days she was doing/going to do everything he said she would. In these type of stories, I just expect the heroine to hold out a bit longer even "in doing things" were not actually sex.I will not be reading the sequel since it is hard for me to believe that the hero felt that connection to the heroine.

2.5 StarsLooking at the reviews, I am in the minority with this one.  I have had this book in my Kindle forever and decided to get the whispersync.I did not like this book at all and was extremely bored.  Both of these characters were very insecure.  By the time all the information about the heroine was provided, I did not care.  I love New Adult college stories and I love the way the main characters met and how their relationship started, but that is where it ended.The hero is very insecure because of something in his home life. The heroine is just there.

3.5 StarsThis book had a bit of everything that at times I was not sure if I liked or hated.Rose is part of the Fleur Cosmetics.  She is Violets sister. Rose wants to quit her position at Fleur since she feels unappreciated and she feels that her fathers girlfriend is just waiting for the chance to get the company.  Caden is a thief.  He steals jewelry from the wealthy and there is a piece of jewelry that Rose has that he wants.  They meet at Cannes when Caden saves Rose from a guy who gets a little bit aggressive and from there their story begins.First I was not sure what to think of Caden.  He is a thief.  I would not say he is likable. Then there is Rose and I felt that she is a bit of a spoiled little girl.  Her reasons for quitting Fleur I felt were ridiculous.  I was thinking rich people problems the whole time I heard her whine. There is some drama which I love.  What goes on in the story is pretty obvious but I was still drawn to the story and wanted to see how things would unfold. I love drama and that crazy angst when the heroine finds the whole truth.A copy was provided in exchange for an honest review.

I loved the broody Garth in the previous books and I could not think of anyone better for Garth than Josie. However, I dont know how to say exactly what I thought without giving too much away.  Therefore this will be short and to the point, I hope.In the beginning of this book, Garth is reminiscing about his love for Josie.  He loves her.  He sees only her even though he has women wanting his attention all the time.  He sends others to pretend to be him so that he does not have to deal with his crazy fan club.  I love when the hero only loves and sees the beauty in the heroine.  When Garth finally feels that he is out of the darkness that he has been in for a long time, something happens and takes Garth back to that dark place.Nicole Williams is an amazing writer. My problem is that for me this was predictable and I was expecting more.  I did want emotions and angst and drama, but I did not want to see Garth go back to his self-destructive pattern.  I did not blame him for the way he felt, but I was a bit annoyed with it all.  Garth was again feeling his worthlessness.  His behavior at times was so stupid, so selfish.  Why cant he ever just step back and think how his behavior impacts others?  Honestly, I just did not want Josie to go through this with Garth; maybe less attention on Garth and more on Josie. If Josie and Garths relationship needed to be tested, maybe there should have been something that Josie went through.  Josie being so sweet does everything to give Garth everything as do their friends, Jesse and Rowen.  Garths bad temper and mood was a just a repeat of what I had seen before and all of it was predictable.I have been a fan of Nicole Williams for a long time.  I know I will be forever reading and rereading her books.A copy was provided in exchange for an honest review.

3.5 StarsI really liked the premise of this book.  This is part 1 of a 3 part series.  You can read this novella in one sitting. It is 100 pages.First I am glad that I did not know a thing about this book before I read it.  There is a little twist (not sure even to call it that) but I was surprised by that information.I am not sure if I felt that intense connection between Erin Easter and Weston.  This was not bad.  I just felt it was missing something.  I love these stories.  Erin Easter has been bullied for the past 9 years by the other Erins in her grade.  Erin Easter more or less takes care of her absent druggie of a mother. Erin works and studies hard so she will have the ability to get out her town and away from the day to day bullying.I am not sure if I will read the next two books in the series. There was nothing that made me want to pick up the next book in the series ASAP.

Rex is member of the MC and has women always trying to get his attention. He does not seek relationships, only time with women to satisfy his needs.  Caroline has only one thing in mind and that is to be successful at her job.  However, now she is being threatened as well as her dream job and she seeks the safety from Rex and the MC.I really liked the premise of this book.  I love stories of when opposite attract.  Caroline is a business woman while Rex is part of the MC.  Both of these characters have a background story.  Life was never easy for Caroline and she does have a past that has come back to hunt her. This past I not sure how I felt about it and maybe it was something that changed my opinion about a lot of things.  Rex has regrets and things he is trying to change. The story and the characters were fine.  There was just nothing that made me feel an intense connection to both of them.Dual POVS.  The switch was a bit too quick for me.  Sometimes, I wish authors would stick with one POV and maybe put a switch here and there and not every other chapter.A copy was provided in exchange for an honest review.

I really loved the love story. I loved how it developed for the most part. However, towards the end, Janie's insecurities got on my nerves. But saying that, the ending made up for it and how it all came together. I want to add that I will definitely be reading everything by Penny Reid moving forward.  Off to read the second book in this series because I want more Quinn!!!

I have enjoyed Alessandra Torre other books, but this one I just did not care for.There were several issues I had.I did not feel the connection with Kitten to really care what happened to her.  The reader does not know who Kitten is.  The mystery for the reader is trying to figure out who Kitten is.  By the time the twist was revealed, I was done, I did not care.I did not feel the love connection between Riley and Brett.  Not for a minute.

3.5 StarsK. Bromberg is an amazing writer. The Driver series with Ry and Colt is one of my top 5 favorite series of all time. From the first book to book 3, the story never slowed.  There was an equal amounts of compassion, love, angst, and drama ad none of it felt dull.I was excited to read SLOW BURN mostly because it was written by K. Bromberg.  I never really thought much of Ry and Colts best friends Haddie and Beck, but I remembered them having  that friendly flirty, and fun but I am not sleeping with you attitude.  I wanted to see what their journey would be.Haddies sister just died of cancer.  Haddie thinks she may be carrying the same cancer gene that killed her sister.  She swore she would never get close to anyone. She saw her sister die and then to watch how her sisters husband watched his wife go through treatments and then die was too much. She did not want to put anyone through that pain.  The night of Colt and Rys wedding, Haddie and Beck agree to one night no strings attached.  However, both of them are surprised by how that one night felt like so much more.  In SLOW BURN, Haddie and Beck play the game of we made an agreement of no strings attached, but now all I do is think about you, but not going to be the first one to tell you and I have to admit, that bothered me.  In SLOW BURN, there are a lot of misunderstandings. Haddie has an ex-boyfriend who keeps coming around.  Beckett stating that he really does not want to slow down even though he gets jealous the minute he thinks that Haddie is back with the ex.  Then we have Haddie worrying about possibly caring the cancer gene, but not wanting to have anyone worry with her.The writing as always was 10 stars. I just wish that the switch in POVs was not so frequent.  Colt and Ry stood out.  I just felt like Haddie was still just a secondary character.

3.5 StarsThis was not a bad book.  I just wish I was given a little more background or something that would give me a stronger connection to the characters.  One flashback would have done the job.The sexual tension was high.I love that even though the characters have known each other for 6 months, they are not having sex the minute we meet them.  Clay and the group of men he works with are bodyguards of sorts for Haileys family.  Haileys father and sister had recently gotten into some problems which have brought media attention to not only them but the rest of the family.  Hailey, unlike her father and sister, stays out of trouble.  Clay thinks Hailey is beautiful, sexy, innocent, and too good.  Hailey thinks Clay is hot and very bad, but she cant stop thinking about him.  Hailey is a good person, but when the phrase innocent is used to describe Hailey, I am not sure I agree. Like I said I would like more background.This is a quick read.  I read it in one sitting.  This was a nice late night read for me before bed, but I felt like something was missing.  I was not fully connected and committed to this couple for it to end and in a cliffy. It is written in dual POVS.A copy was provided in exchange for an honest review.

3.5 StarsBook 2 in the Cold Fury series.Garrett has the money and any woman he wants.  Garrett sees Olivia at a party and she blows him away.  However, Olivia is not interested.  She has other things to worry about like how to overcome her cancer. When Garrett finds out about Olivia, he wants to be the man she needs and not the womanizer that he has a reputation of being.  Olivia feels guilty and selfish for starting anything with Garrett because of the cancer.It was very sweet romance even though it was an insta-love, insta-attraction type of story.Even though I enjoyed the story, I found myself bored at certain parts of the book.  There is something that happens in the book but it came and went.  When I finished I thought to myself that is it?? The premise was good, the beginning of the book was really good, but then I felt it fell flat before it picked up again.Nonetheless, I am glad I read it.A copy was provided in exchange for an honest review.

You need to read HE FOUND ME before you read HE SAVED ME. This is a series that must be read in order.I loved HE FOUND ME and was anxious to read the sequel.  Whitney Barbetti did not disappoint. Andra has had a very difficult life with running and then trying to keep all her secrets close.  Since Andras mother passed away and she was left with an abuser which put her in a place of darkness and constant danger.  In HE SAVED ME, Julian and Andra reunite, but Andra is terrified that she putting Julian in danger.  She knows she has one choice and that is to face the evil.  Some of her actions could have been seen as stupid or courageous.  What would you do to protect the one you love?How romantic and sexy if Julian???I liked the characters and Andras story in HE FOUND ME, but fell in love with them in HE SAVED ME.  Andra is the perfect heroine.  Kind, but strong at the same time.  There is heat between these characters, but more than physical, it is emotional.  There is a twist, suspense and romance in this gem.We get a glimpse at the secondary characters, Mira and Six.  Mira is a strong, but she is angry.  Clearly having had suffered through some type of abuse, she is still very protective. You have to admire her and Six. Mira and Six will have their own story in Whitneys next book SIX FEET UNDER.

Three brothers  Jax, Donovan and Sean.The Morrow FamilyBillion Dollar Bachelor  The premise was there, the characters were all set up but in the end all I kept thinking was that it lacked something.  No matter how much I tried I could not get emotionally attached.I loved these types of stories: Jax Morrow is a dangerously handsome, spectacularly wealthy entrepreneur whose world is turned upside down when Pandora Garret walks into a dark, smoky bar one nighta stunning combination of sex and innocence. He knows shes trouble at first sight, but Jax cant let her leaveunless shes leaving with him.I felt indifferent to Jax and Pandoras relationship.Billion Dollar Bad Boy - The face of the Morrow company, Donovan Morrow is the ultimate Trojan. But despite his giftsin the boardroom and the bedroomhe always comes in second to his big brother, Jax. Until Victoria de Winter, a sexy and brilliant corporate rival, enters the picture and proves that sometimes, the biggest challenges offer the best rewards.This story left me wanting more and feeling disappointed that it was cut short. I felt I was not given enough to connect. I rather have a great introduction to the characters and have opportunities to connect, but it felt like something was missing in this story again.THE BILLIONAIRE BIKER - Wild and reckless, and more at ease with his biker gang than his business partners, Sean Morrow has always longed for Abigail Prescott, whose life he ruined when an innocent friendship turned into a night of red-hot passion back when they were in high school. Now that his brother, Jax, has decided to hire Abby to work for the Morrows, Sean can no longer ignore his old demonsor his desire.I was so excited to get to this story the most.  I love these type of friendship turned to so much more in one night stories. Sean and Abby shared passion until Sean left.  Abby never understood and therefore held a lot of hurt.  Sean took Abbys virginity all those years leaving with no explanation and feeling he was not worthy.These are quick stories.  If you are in between book and dont know what to read these are good for those moments.A copy provided in exchange for an honest review.

I loved the initial meeting between Julia and Geo.  Also I love the way Julie handled the rich lady in the clothing boutique.  Julia was just a great heroine.  I love heroines like her and I hope when I read more of Ruth Cardello's books her other heroines have as big of hearts as Julia's.I do think that Come Away with Me needs a sequel.  I feel that Geo and Julia's story just ended.  There are so many unresolved issues like Geo's mother and how she feels about Julia. Plus, I want to know about Julia's business and her parents.  I want to see Geo meet her parents and maybe see their love since he never saw that with his parents.  Plus, I want to know how Geo handled his mother when he came back to the States. And I want angst with some awesome groveling on Geo's part.Sidenote: I feel like I missed a chapter because it was never explained in the story how Geo found out how his mother propositioned Julia.  Plus who is the new investor of the furniture store???My only disappointment with the story itself was that I feel that the angst in the story ended too quickly.  Julia was too easy to say "okay, Geo." I do not want to give away anything, but I wanted Geo begging.  Julia should have made him sweat. I feel like Geo did not realize his own mistake in the situation until it was pointed out to him  I love a man who grovels and there was not enough groveling for me.

This was a nice NA college story.  Yes, it was probably one that was done a hundred times, but I there was something about the characters and the writing that I really enjoyed. The heroine was not a virgin, but not a slut either.  It seems like those are harder to find more and more in NA stories.Scarlett has social anxiety.  She is asked to tutor Tucker, the star soccer player at her university.  Tucker has a reputation of getting what he wants when he wants it.  At first Scarlett does not want to do it, but feels forced since it means money for the math department. Slowly, a friendship starts and I loved that this was not insta-love. I loved that the secrets that each character kept secret were NOT revealed until the very end and what was held until the end was necessary for the story. The scenes when they were training and would talk (Q&A) were my favorite.  There was so much more to these characters than they showed to the public.  I never read anything by Denise Swank before and I know after  listening to AFTER MATH  I will.I am not sure if I will read the next book in the series, REDESIGNED. It is about  Scarlett's BFF, Caroline.  I am not sure how I feel about Caroline.  She had her own dating issues, but seemed to have to many opinions about Scarlett's. I know that Caroline was probably just overprotective of Scarlett, but sometimes her attitude annoyed me. She was so judgmental.  Caroline seemed like a girl that liked to party at bars.  I see that Redesigned has great reviews, but I think I will need to take a break and forget about Caroline for a little bit. However, her others books look interesting, plus I love the book trailers.

The heroine was the problem in this story. First she made this ridiculous promise (about the land) to her dead husband that she did not even love two years ago when he dead. However, she has no problem breaking a promise to her friend and Cameron's mother. Then she says ridiculous things to Cameron that she has to take it slow because of the memory of her dead husband AND remember this is not this is the husband that she did not even love...ever. Cameron was the one that she thought of for all those years. And then there are other ridiculous comments but I do not want to give those away. I do not know why Cameron even wanted to be with her. Sure the town "loved her" but she was ridiculous.

4.5 StarsThis book started around two years after Katia left Marcus.  I do not want to give too much away so I will keep the review short.Katia had left Marcus when she found out that the only reason he married her was so he could obtain his grandfathers business.  This left Katia broken.  She left making it impossible for Marcus to locate her.  Katia is having a hard time surviving while working as a waitress, but she is determined to have nothing to do with Marcus.  I usually get annoyed when the author switchs characters POVs frequently, but this was done perfectly.  Chapter after chapter the flow and pace of the story was smooth, controlled, and engaging.There is a lot of angst.  I felt all the emotions of Katia and Marcus.  I felt what Katia was feeling.  I felt all her anger, all her hate, all her angst, all that pain.  I felt her desperation for peace from what she was feeling.  My heart raced with anticipation of what was going on.It is important that Till Death Volume One be read first. Bella Jewel is becoming one of those authors that I will read anything and everything she writes.A copy was provided in exchange for an honest review.

I love stories that take place in boarding schools.  So when I saw that Night School is a thriller that place in a boarding school in England, I was excited.First this is not a paranormal.  This is a YA story that has some strange things that happen throughout the story, but it is explained later.  Sixteen year old Allie has gotten in trouble time and time again since her brother has gone missing.  Her parents have had enough and thought the best solution was to send her to a boarding school that would be able to help her.  When Allie arrives to Cimmeria Academy she is immediately instructed to learn the rules and guidelines.  After sometime Allie does not hate Cimmeria as much as she thought she would.  She makes friends as well as catches the eye of two boys, Sylvain and Carter.  There are a lot of strange things that occur at Cimmeria Academy.  There is a Night School that takes place that no one discusses.  As more and more strange things occur, Allie wants to know what goes in at night.Allie is an okay heroine. I felt indifferent to her. I am not sure how or why she caught the attention of supposedly the two most wanted boys on campus.  Sylvain and Carter were both boys that had reputations, but I never saw it and it felt like it was forced into the story to cause drama.There were a few things that made no sense even after I got some of the facts. At certain times throughout the book, Allie speaks of her gut not to trust this person and then she would trust them.While I was reading, I even tried hunting for spoilers hoping that it would draw me back to the story.  However, every time I stopped and picked the book back up hoping that something would grab me, nothing would.  The love triangle between Sylvain and Carter is there, but everything is a rumor.  I got bored with nothing being relieved until almost 75% of the book.As I mentioned I was excited to read this, but to say it dragged is an understatement. Every chapter felt like a repeat of the previous one.  I understand when an author is trying to build suspense before the big revolution is given, but once I found out what was going on in the Night School, it was not that exciting to me.A copy was provided in exchange for an honest review.

A nice sweet short story.  Great for a Sunday afternoon read.At first I was nervous that Cinda was going to be too masculine of a heroine for me.  I love stories about girls who think they are the ugly duckling when in fact they are the opposite, but I like the heroine to be feminine as well and some of the descriptions Cinda sounded like she was not very girly.  The heroine does not have to dress in high heels or wear flashy clothes or even have a ton of make-up for me to think and feel that she is feminine, but has to have some feminine qualities besides being attracted to men. This is a personal preference in the stories I read.Cinda is very smart and is a double major in engineering.  She has a sister who has always been the pretty one while Cinda was always the smart one. Even though Cinda loves her sister, she has always felt like second best.  When Cinda catches the eye of Blake at first she is leery and avoids his advances, but Blake is not so quick to give up.Putting Cindas attitude aside, I could not stop reading and truthfully read the story in two sittings.  However, the angst or revolution in this book bothered me. I do not want to give away any spoilers, but when I found out the truth, I noticed myself disconnecting.  Personally, I dont think I could have forgiven or gotten over the revolution. It felt wrong and the wrong person, in my opinion, was apologizing. I wish I could say more.The flow of the story was very good. It is a short read.  Things move along very quickly. I did not love the characters, but found myself wanting to finish.I will read other books by Amy Patrick.A copy was provided in exchange for an honest review.

3.5 StarsIt was okay.  Predictable.  I love when books are written only in the male POV, but sometimes I thought the male POV in this book sounded a little more feminine than masculine.  It was a nice quick read.  Can be read in one sitting.The hero is dealing with cancer and the heroine is a great character.

DNF at 45%I have loved J.M. Darhower other books, but no matter how many times I picked this one up and tried to like it, I could not connect or get into the story.  When I bought this book, I was so excited to start reading it.  I love paranormals with angels and demons and especially stories where the angel falls for the demon.  However, this one was not for me.First, I could have done without the intimate details between Serah and Michael.  When Serah visits Luce to make him stop the war and Luce tells her to go back because he can not handle the smell of Michael on her, I AGREED. She smelled like sex from Michael and went to negotiate with Luce about the war?!?! I did not need the detail of the sex between Michael and Serah in the open flower fields. UGH. I could have done without that whole visual not once but twice.  When I read a story, I do not details of the characters' sex life if it is not between the hero and heroine. And I thought Serah was supposed to be a good angel and she is sneaking off with Michael?!?!So when I thought Serah was finally opening up her eyes and seeing Michael for what he was, the story dragged.  There were scenes that I did enjoy like when Serah would sit with the one family at dinner.  However, the scenes I actually enjoyed were few and far between.This just did not work for me.

Dana Marton writes the best kind of romantic suspense.  Her stories contain complex characters with lots of action and Flash Fire is no exception.Clara Roberts is tasked by her father to find a missing young woman.  Light Walker is a former SEAL who now works for others to further his own quest: find his brothers killer.Light is supposed to help Clara find her missing person but his own agenda keeps getting in the way.  He feels he is beyond redemption and fights his attraction to Clara.  Clara likes who she is but doesnt feel that she is really attractive to men.  She is not the type that Light usually goes for but he admires her tenaciousness and finds himself falling for her.  Clara is horrified by some of the things she witnesses Light do but gradually comes to understand why he is the way he is.This story has many twists and turns and thoroughly captivated me; once I started reading it I couldnt put it down.  Bravo to Dana Marton for another excellent, suspenseful story.I received an ARC of this book in exchange for an honest review.

This is the first book Ive read by Tracy Ewens but now I plan to read more of her books.  I received an ARC of this book from the publisher via NetGalley in exchange for an honest review.The heroine, Kate, is difficult to like at first.  However, as the story moved along I came to understand why she acts the way she does.  In the beginning the hero, Grady, comes off as a devil-may-care, immature playboy.  Both of these characters have a lot more going on than what you first see on the surface.Kates ex-husband cheated on her so she no longer trusts her judgment in men.  Grady felt abandoned by his father as a child because it always seemed that his career was more important than family.I found Candidate to be an entertaining story with well developed, complex characters.  When Kate and Grady finally get together everything seems great but the author wrote a conflict that I probably should have seen coming but I didnt.  Not to worry, this is a love story so there is an HEA but getting there was sometimes heartbreaking.I have to note that I found one error that stood out to me.  A reference was made to Monday, Election Day in Chapter 36.  In the U.S. Election Day is the Tuesday following the first Monday in November.

This book may be short in length but it packs plenty of punch!  I love books by Delilah Devlin and her Lone Star Lovers series is one of my favorites.  I cant recall right off if all of them are some type of menage story or not but I know a lot of them are  including this one.Angelina (Angel) loves three brothers but she was escorted from her home in shame when she was 18.  Four years have passed and her mother begs her to return to cover for her at the ranch where she works so that she can go care for her sister, Angels aunt.Angel is now older and wiser but she returns against her better judgment.  Many things have changed during Angels absence  not all of them bad. <grin>This story is hot, hot, hot!!  Youve been warned, if you cant handle the heat stay out of the kitchen!I received an ARC of this book in exchange for an honest review.

I received an ARC of this book from the publisher via NetGalley - correction, not NetGalley it was from Hot New Books in exchange for an honest review but I also purchased the book because I loved it.I dont often purchase the books that I receive for review but this was such as wonderful story that I wanted to support this author by purchasing a copy.Ive never read any books by Lucy Score but I do have one in my TBR pile that Im going to move up higher.  This story touched all of my emotions; which is my favorite kind of romance.  At times I laughed out loud and at other times I had tears running down my face.This is a complex story, with well-developed characters.  While the Hero is in the National Guard the military aspect of this isnt the front and center focus.  The author does a wonderful job of concealing certain things from us and unveiling them slowly throughout the story.  Both the H and h have had bad things happen to them in the past.  Having the details unfold slowly kept the story interesting; I didnt want to put it down.If you love a very strong, [I hate it when I make typos!] kick-a$$ not kiss-a$$ heroine and a tortured, sometimes a**hole, protective Hero you should buy this book.  I cant believe that its priced at only $.99  perhaps thats a sale price that might not last  snap it up now!

I have to admit  some parts of this story made me a little uncomfortable, but reading the story was totally worth it.  Ive never read a book about a male sub before and it took me a bit to let go of my notion that the male is always the dominant.  Roni Loren treated this subject with great respect just as she has all of her other stories.Gibson (Gib) and Samantha (Sam) met at the Ranch where Gib helped train her as a Domme.  During their training Sam saw the submissive tendencies come out in Gib and wanted to explore that side of him and dominate him but Gib couldnt handle it and walked away from her.  He is ashamed of his submissive feelings and thinks there is something wrong with him wanting to be beaten and dominated; he thinks others will feel he is less of a man if they find out.Both Sam and Gib believe the things they endured during their childhood have influenced their sexual proclivities.  Gibs father beat and humiliated him and once he discovered he enjoyed that during sex play he felt ashamed because he hated what his father did to him.  Sam was nearly raped by another girl when she was young and now she needs to be dominant.  When Gib tells her how ashamed and embarrassed he is by his desire to be dominated she helps him to see that it doesnt have anything to do with his father.This was a very emotional story for me.  I felt so bad for both Sam and Gib but particularly for Gib.  He wants so badly to love and be with Sam the way she wants him to be but he just cant get past the feeling that it makes him less of a man.The writing, as always, is richly descriptive and makes me totally lose myself in the story.  It was nice to catch glimpses of characters from previous books in the Loving on the Edge series.  While this book can easily be read as a standalone you might enjoy it more if youve already read the other books in the series.Roni Lorens stories always have an HEA but getting to this one for Sam and Gib really tugged on my emotions.  I was happy that Pike put in an appearance and provided a bit of comic relief during a part that was particularly difficult for Gib.Roni Loren sure packed a lot of stuff into this novella and I loved it!I received an ARC of this book from the publisher via NetGalley in exchange for an honest review.

Ive had a hard time writing this review.  I think there are many reasons for that and a couple of them are: I love this serial so much and didnt want to see it end; there are some really mind boggling things that happen in this episode and Im having a hard time sorting things out in my mind.  I finished reading this book more than a week ago and still feel overwhelmed by it all  in a good way.Reading this series has been worth every cliffhanger as Blair Babylon delivers a fantastic story.  When Georgie was kidnapped at the end of episode three I wondered how Blair could possibly finish this series with only one more book.  Well, the way she did it was by writing an epic story over 350 printed pages long.As the book blurb says, Georgie didnt want Xan to try to find her because Tatiana Butorin, the Russian who kidnapped her, has threatened to kill him if he does.  Of course, that doesnt stop Xan.  This part of the story is heartbreaking and I couldnt believe what I was reading; I just couldnt wrap my mind around it.  Im not putting in any spoilers; youll have to read it for yourself.  All this happened in just the first 10% of the book!This story left me with a book hangover for days.  All I can say is: Blair Babylon is a master storyteller.  The way she has connected the characters in her BID: Rae, BID: Lizzy and BID/RID: Georgie and Xan series is incredible and yet each of them can be read independently of the others.Its been a wild ride with Georgie and Xan, Ms. Babylon.  Im not sure that you can ever top the Georgie and Xan stories but I cant wait until your next book/series comes out so I can find out.  Thank you for many wonderful hours of reading enjoyment.I received an early copy of this book from the author for review but I also pre-ordered my own copy.

This is the first book Ive ever read by Laura Lee and I loved it.  No one could be more surprised than I was when I discovered that I really enjoy reading New Adult stories.  Im over 50 you see and I just didnt think those types of stories would hold my interest.  Boy was I wrong.  In the last year or so Ive found several authors whose NA books Ive loved and now I can add Laura Lee to that list.I picked this book up on a whim when NetGalley sent an email offering a review copy.  I read a lot of ARCs and I keep telling myself that I have to cut back so that I can find time to read books I pick just for me but the description for this one was just too tempting.  Add that to the fact that the book was already out so I could read it at my own pace and not feel any pressure to get it read and reviewed by release day and I just had to download it.  Boy am I glad I did.I read this book in one sitting and blocked out everything else while I read it.  I love how the book starts out with Part One: The College Years with one chapter for freshman, sophomore, and junior years with Devyn and Riley taking turns at telling the story.  We get just enough of a glimpse into each year without so many details as to be boring.  Senior year gets 12 chapters because this is where the meat of the story for part one is.We already know from the book blurb that something big happens between them and that they meet again 5 years later.  Its not hard to guess what the big thing is but that doesnt matter.  The compelling part of the story for me was the friends to lovers trope and the connection that Riley and Devyn have yet either dont know it or just decide to ignore it until THE night.This story had me laughing out loud in places to the extent that my husband made me read passages to him so he could know what made me laugh so hard.  I also cried (not unusual for me when reading a good story) for the heartbreak that both Riley and Devyn go through before they get to their HEA.As with most NA stories Ive read, this one contains a liberal amount of four letter words.  If that offends you move on to something else or read it and dont complain in a review how there was too much bad language.  The author is upfront about the story containing an overflowing swear jar.I look forward to reading more books by this author.I received an ARC of this book from NetGalley in exchange for an honest review.
It was only $1 and it fits the Nook HD+ well.

Chase Marsden, former playboy, now lives on the ranch he inherited from his grandfather.  He had to spend 2 years there in order to inherit but now he loves living there.  Hes befriended Sadie Lovely, a women with a past who is 15 years older, and credits her with helping him pull his life together.  Sadies daughter died recently and she is now raising her grandson, Jake.  Strange accidents have been happening to Sadie and Jake so Chase has hired Covert Cowboys Inc. to help provide protection for Sadie and Jake until they can figure out whats going on.Kate Rivers is a former Texas Ranger, hurt on the job and medically retired.  Now working for CCI, she has been sent her to provide the protection Chase requested for Sadie.  She arrives in town just in time to witness a car running down Chase and Sadie.  Chase has Kate come stay at his ranch while Sadie is in the hospital so she can help protect Jake.  Chase is unaware of what happened when Kate was injured and doesnt know why she cant be around kids.This story held my interest right from the beginning.  Kate and Chase are attracted to each other but things dont really escalate too quickly.  As they learn more about each other Kate finally trusts Chase enough to tell him her secret and he opens up about his former playboy lifestyle.Theres a lot of mystery and suspense in this story and there are plenty of suspects to choose from.  The mark of s good mystery is not being able to figure out whodunit to early on and I didnt guess the right one at all  which was great!  I thought the story unfolded at a nice pace, not too fast and not too slow.Although this book is part of the Cover Cowboys Inc. series you dont need to have read any of the other ones to enjoy this book.  If youve been reading the series you will be happy that characters from earlier books make brief appearances in this one.Books by Elle James always provide me with an enjoyable escape and this one was a great way to spend a few hours away from my normal life.  :-)I received an ARC of this book in exchange for an honest review.

How to Train Your Skjaldmaer by Delilah DevlinTorvald was promised one of Hagars daughters a wife; one so fair roses blushed in dismay but what he got instead was one with a tall angular frame and ruddy complexion. Hagar had pulled a switch on him. It didnt take Torvald long to realize he much preferred Solveig to her sister.Solveig wasnt meek and didnt dress like a maiden but Torvald was intrigued by her. She was strong of body and will; qualities that would serve him well; a ladys skills could be taught.This is a short story but Delilah Devlin is adept at creating a complete picture with few words. Reading how Torvald and Solvi interact with each other is steamy and entertaining. I thoroughly enjoyed this story.I purchased the Conquests anthology where this story first appeared.

This is the first book I've read by Cat Johnson and I can't wait to read the rest in this series.  I read some of the negative reviews... give me a break!  This is romantic fiction and in novella length there just isn't time to go into great depth.  If you are looking for that then go somewhere else.  There is action, romance and passion with hot, sexy men and steamy scenes.  Just the right length for when you don't have a lot of time to devote to a full length novel.

This is the 7th book in the Covert Cowboys, Inc. series but you wont be lost at all if you havent read any of the others.  This is a complete story with an HEA.Reggie lost her husband a year ago to an accident and was left with their young son to raise.  She is determined to hold on to the ranch her husband inherited so it can be passed down to their son.Angus lost most of his right leg while serving his country.  As a result of his injury he feels less of a man and is surprised when he is hired by CCI.  His first assignment is to act as a ranch hand for Reggie while at the same time providing protection without her knowledge.  There have been too many accidents on the ranch and her foreman, CW, recruited help from his friend Hank Derringer, the owner of CCI.This was an engaging and suspenseful story.  It was quick paced and it wasnt until near the end that I realized who the bad guy was.  Elle James writes entertaining stories and I enjoyed reading this one very much!I received an ARC of this book in exchange for an honest review.

I love all of the Night Fall books but this one is particularly hot and steamy!  There was also a big surprise for me in it.  Maybe I just wasnt paying close attention but I was caught off guard and I loved it.  Max doesnt like vampires at all.  He meets Pia and the attraction is swift and mutual.  Only after theyve done the nasty does he find out who/what she is (thats not the surprise I mentioned above).This book was fast paced and kept my attention throughout.  Although you dont need to read the other books in this series to enjoy this one, they are great.  I personally prefer to read a series in order, even if the books are standalones.  If you like paranormal stories you will love this one.I received an ARC of this book in exchange for an honest review.

This review is for Bound by the Viking by Anne Marsh as it's the only story I've had a chance to read so far.Although this book is part of a series you don't need to have read the other books to enjoy this one.  Colden is on a mission to prevent the assassination of Odin.  He meets Bera, a fairly new werewolf, and rescues her from the one who turned her and is now holding her captive.  When he spots her his bear says "this one is ours" and it shakes him up; he's not ready to take a mate but apparently his bear is.  He also realizes the he's met Bera before.Bera just wants to get away from the pack where she's been held captive for about a year.  She has knowledge about the planned assassination of Odin and agrees to help Colden in exchange for her freedom.  This was an interesting story that kept my attention throughout.  While there is no cliffhanger I do wish that it hadn't ended quite so abruptly.I was provided an early copy of this story by the author in exchange for a review but I also purchased the boxed set so I can read the stories by the other great authors, may of whom I am familiar with.  I love boxed sets for the low prices and because I often find many new authors I come to love.

I keep saying that Delilah Devlin is the queen of short, naughty stories and this one doesnt change my mind one bit!Zoe and Grayson are step-siblings and Trace is their boss.  I normally dont enjoy the step stories because there is too much oh, its wrong, we shouldnt do this in every other paragraph.  Theres none of that in this book!  Zoe and Grayson dont apologize to anyone for their attraction to each other  and boy are they attracted.After attending a party at Traces house Zoe is surprised when she is summoned to his office the next day at work.  What Trace has to show her and offer her was a big surprise and I loved it.If youre looking for something short and naughty to read this is a great story!I was a beta reader for this book but my opinion wasnt influenced by that.

This is the third book in The Boys of Summer series but you dont have to have read the other books to enjoy this one; they all standalone.Gavin King was a hitting star with the Dodgers but he injured his knee and they traded him to the much less desirable New Jersey Sonics.Jessica Hart is a sports therapist for the Sonics and Gavin is assigned to work with her to restore his knee so he can begin playing again.  Jessica doesnt like or date baseball players.Gavin has a girlfriend when he moves to New Jersey but she soon breaks up with him.  There is an attraction between Gavin and Jessica but neither of them is interested in a relationship.  Working together so closely creates sparks that eventually come to a head.I enjoyed this book a lot; it was a nice summer read.  The pace was good and the characters interesting.  If youve read the first two books you will be happy to revisit those characters in this book but you wont be missing anything vital if you havent read them.The Boys of Summer is a good series and I look forward to reading more books from Katie Rose.  Note:  I was given an early copy of this book from the publisher via NetGalley in exchange for my review.  I see that the name of the series appears to have been changed to the Bad Boys of Baseball.

So far I've only read the two Billionaires in Disguise: Lizzy stories from this boxed set (I've actually read the whole series and it's fantastic!).  I know I will get to the other stories soon but here's my review so far, based on those two stories.  Cliffhanger alert: only the first two episodes of a 4 part serial are contained in the boxed set.We met Lizzy in the Billionaires In Disguise (BID): Rae series but you dont have to have read that series to read this one. Lizzy is somewhat troubled. She thinks she loves the Dom of the Devilhouse but hes in love with Rae.This is a hard book for me to review. Ive read the entire series and loved it. Since I read them all, one right after the other, its a bit difficult to separate one episode from the other.In this episode Lizzy kind of falls for two VERY different men: Theo and Mannix. Before the end of the series she will have to choose between them.The BID: Lizzy books are a bit darker than the Rae books but it fits for Lizzys character. This series is full of sexy and not so sexy times. It is also full of intrigue and some violence. I did not want to stop reading this series once I started.Be warned that there is strong language and some possibly disturbing scenes in this book. There is also a cliffhanger, which I usually hate. I love Blair Babylons books, though so I will read her books with cliffhangers.Episode 2.In this episode we learn more about Lizzys past. We also find that things are getting more and more rough between her and Mannix. This episode contains even more disturbing things than episode 1 but it seems necessary for the overall story.If you read the BID: Rae series, and you want more of her and Wulf, you MUST read BID: Lizzy.

Kinsey Phillips is running away from an abusive relationship.  Her car catches on fire and Becket Grayson gets her away from it before it explodes.  They realize that they know each other from growing up together many years ago.  The attraction between Kinsey and Becket cant be denied even though neither of them is looking for a relationship.This book has a lot of suspense and kept me on the edge of my seat until the very end.  The sexy time is hot and steamy.  This is a complete story with no cliffhanger (yay!).  Becket has several siblings and I hope there will be books for each of them.Another great story by Elle James!I purchased a copy of this book in the 12-Alarm Cowboys boxed set but I also received a preview copy from the author.

Yum, it would be nice to have 2 hot neighbors like Jason and Robert.  Emily has been spying on her two neighbors for a while.  Read what happens when she finally gets caught.This is a very short story and shouldn't be judged by the same standards as even a novella as there is little time for character development.Enjoy it for what it is - a nice, hot, titillating read - perfect to read right before bedtime. :-)

The hotness continues!  Cant wait for the final book. [Edit 10/12/15 - I just learned that this is going to be the final book so I read the ending again.  I can see where the author is coming from - that this is an OK place to end the series and there isn't really a cliffhanger.  I was so excited about the possibility of one more book with a menage story that I may have over-reacted when I left my original review.]The story of Gianna, Cruz and Luc continues with Cruz needing to attend to business as sheriff even though he doesnt want to leave Gianna.  The action heats up in this installment as wolves from the Breed MC try to get to Gianna.Luc isnt wanted on Cruzs property but his help proves to be valuable to Cruzs pack.  Gianna still wants a relationship with both Cruz and Luc so they need to find a way to make peace if they want to keep her.I almost screamed when I got to the end of this one. :-)  Just when things really start to heat up between Cruz, Gianna and Luc up came the cliffhanger.  I love where the story is going and I cant wait to read the last installment.I received an ARC of this book in exchange for an honest review.

I received an ARC of this book in exchange for an honest review.If you saw this book when it came out as a serial, and passed it up because of cliffhangers, heres your chance to get it as complete book with bonus scenes at the end.  These bonus scenes add so much to the story that even if you read the individual episodes you might want to buy this set just for them  especially while its on sale for such a crazy price.Cole and Hailey begin with kind of a love/hate relationship.  Cole works for her father and Hailey hates that his company helps to cover up bad things that rich people do.Cole has wanted Hailey from the first moment he saw her but he knows hes not good enough for her.  Even so, he cant seem to stay away from her and she cant resist him.  The sexy time between them is HOT!Their relationship begins to deepen but Hailey still doesnt completely trust Cole and hates that he has to keep so much hidden from her.  There are some fantastic twists in this story  things about her family that I never saw coming.Ainsley Booth does a nice job of setting things up for additional stories about the other members of the Horus group and I look forward to reading all of them!

I loved the original 5 book serial of Uncaged Love and felt that it came to a very satisfying conclusion.  What a great bonus it is to get a sixth book!Cole and Jo are preparing for their wedding in Hawaii and Jo goes on ahead without Cole.  Jos younger brother has been training to be a boxer and he has scheduled himself for an off the record fight before he is really ready.  Jo wants to be there for him so she agrees to attend the fight as his trainer.  What happens that night sets things in motion for Jo to get back her hurricane.  She learns that she has it within herself to control the hurricane.I loved this extra book.  We get more information about Jos family in Hawaii and we get to see her fight back her fears and become the strong women she was before she and Cole were attacked.The conclusion of book 5 was so good I almost found it hard to believe that book six could be any better.  Hats off to JJ Knight for writing a fabulous bonus story that fans of Jo and Cole might not even have known they needed.  Bravo!!I received an ARC of this book in exchange for an honest review.

This was my first book by Sable Sylvan. It was a sexy book with some very hot scenes. Talia meets Cedar when he comes into the yarn store where she works. She has no idea that he's a billionaire owner of Asher Lumber - not even after he spends over $4,000 on yarn as a present for his grandmother.Cedar has been looking for his mate for a long time; he realizes pretty quickly that Talia is his mate. Talia is attracted to Cedar but she believes she is cursed and can not give him the cubs he wants.There were a few interesting twists and turns to this book and it certainly gives a different perspective on the Sleeping Beauty fairy tale. :-) This book was just an OK read for me but if you enjoy adult fairy tales this will be right up your alley!I received a copy of this book from the author in exchange for my honest review.

I love books by Roni Loren; every single one of them that Ive read (10 so far, counting novellas).  Her Loving on the Edge (LOTE) series captured my attention from the very beginning.  In some ways I was lucky to discover her books after several of them were already published because I was able to read one right after the other without having to wait for the next one.  Although each book is a standalone, I loved them so much I could hardly wait to finish one so I could start the next.Call On Me is about Pike and Oakley.  Oakleys main focus is taking care of her daughter.  To do that she works two jobs; a respectable day job and a not so respectable night job that only her brother knows about.  Pike, a bad-boy type, is the drummer for a rock band but he is getting tired of the wild night life and all of the groupies that come backstage after a show.Pike meets Oakley meet when he agrees to help with a charity project for the non-profit group she works for.  Their first meeting strikes sparks but not necessarily the good kind.  Pike is confident and a bit cocky and flirtatious.  Oakley had her fill of that type when she was a teenager.  Unfortunately (or not) Oakley must work with Pike on the charity project or risk losing a promotion that will allow her to quit her night job.Oakley does not want to like Pike but she cant seem to help herself.  Its been years since shes been with a man so she decides that shell just have a fling with Pike  no one will get hurt, right?Call On Me is a hot, sexy book with very mild BDSM themes.  If youve read Ronis other LOTE books you know that The Ranch is a BDSM resort and features heavily in the other books.  The Ranch is not at all prominent in this book but the sexy time is still here.If youve read the other LOTE books you wont want to miss this one.  If you havent tried Ronis books yet this would be an excellent one to start with.  I almost guarantee you will want to go back and read the other ones later.I purchased a print copy of this book in an online charity auction; no review was requested or required.

JJ Knight tells a wonderful story full of ups and downs about Jo and Colts budding relationship.  The blurb is accurate and I couldn't do better with my own words so I won't try.Going in I knew this was a serial and that there would be a cliffhanger. I typically avoid them at all costs. However, this series was already complete when I started reading it so I didnt have to wait to finish the story.After reading this serial I have come to realize that if the author and story are good enough cliffhangers dont bother me as much as they used to. And this is a great story.  Once I started reading I couldnt stop!

And this is a great story.  Once I started reading I couldnt stop!
