And this is a great story.  Once I started reading I couldnt stop!

I read this series when it originally came out.  JJ Knight tells a wonderful story full of ups and downs about Jo and Colt's budding relationship.  There is a lot of angst and suspense and the series is one of my favorites.  If you haven't read the individual books the boxed set will save you money!

I purchased this set but so far I've only had a chance to read one story: Hellfire Texas by Elle JamesKinsey Phillips is running away from an abusive relationship.  Her car catches on fire and Becket Grayson gets her away from it before it explodes.  They realize that they know each other from growing up together many years ago.  The attraction between Kinsey and Becket cant be denied even though neither of them is looking for a relationship.This book has a lot of suspense and kept me on the edge of my seat until the very end.  The sexy time is hot and steamy.  This is a complete story with no cliffhanger (yay!).  Becket has several siblings and I hope there will be books for each of them.Another great story by Elle James!

This is the third episode of Billionaires in Disguise: Georgie and Rock Stars In Disguise: Xan and it does end in a cliffhanger.  I used to hate cliffhangers but I have come to appreciate them when authors I love write books that have them.  No I pretty much just hate books that arent disclosed as having cliffhangers.  Reading this series has been worth every cliffhanger as Blair Babylon delivers a fantastic story.  I really dont know how she manages to weave all of the BID (Rae, Lizzie, Georgie)/RID (Xan) stories together and yet each series can be read without having read the others.Georgie is now part of Killer Valentine and has agreed to perform with them for 3 months.  Xan has promised to keep her safe from the Russian mobsters that have threatened her life.This episode introduces a new character, Peyton, Georgies High School sweetheart.  Peytons character adds a new level of conflict into Georgie and Xans relationship.  We also learn quite a bit more about the complex personalities living in the body of Xan/Alex/Alexandre.The book blurb provides a much better synopsis than I could ever write.  I just want to say that I am completely captivated by Xan and Georgies story and I will be waiting on pins and needles for the final installment.I received an ARC of this book in exchange for an honest review but I also purchased a copy because I loved the book.

This story is part of the Unchartered SEALs series and is connected to Cat Johnsons Hot SEALs series but it is also a stand-alone story. The blurb for the book is accurate so I wont restate it.Wolf and Piper meet at a barbeque his friends are having; Pipe is staying in the house next door. Shes sassy and hes awkward when making small talk with women. Their chemistry is electric and the sexy time between them is hot.If you like stories with lots of hot, sexy time; a strong woman and a hot SEAL you will love this book. Warning: the language is coarse and the sex is graphic and hot. If this offends you it would be best if you skip this book  just know that youll be missing a great book if you do.I received an ARC of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Hailey hates that her family is always in the spotlight for doing bad things. Cole's firm works for her father as a fixer. Neither wants to be attracted to the other but they can't seem to help themselves. They finally give in to their attraction but after a night of hot, steamy sex Cole is called away on business. The next morning Hailey sees Cole on TV and boy what a cliffhanger!Don't read this book if frequent strong language offends you.  Of course, what else would you expect with a title like Hate F*@k!  :-)

Ive read a lot of books by Elle James (and Ive read all of her Take No Prisoners books) and I think this one might just be my favorite.  Although this is part of a series, and is also a crossover into Cat Johnsons HOT SEALs series, you dont need to have read any of the other stories in either series to enjoy this one.  This is also a very complete story with an HEA! [OK, I have to mention, though, that this story runs parallel to Elles SEALs Honor story.  That is also a fantastic book so you might want to check it out.]Cory (Reaper) Nipton has suffered a terrible loss while on active duty as a SEAL.  Leigha Fields also suffered a career-ending loss when she was a D.C. police officer.  Leigha has recovered from her injury and started over with a new career as a physical therapist.  She is assigned to Reapers case; her first one where shes working on her own.  Reaper is feeling like hell never be able to function as a worthwhile man again.In spite of it being against the rules, Leigha is deeply attracted to Reaper.  In spite of being engaged, Reaper has never had the feelings for another woman that he has for Leigha.There is action, suspense and heroism, worthy of any SEAL, in this fantastic story.  I fell in love with Reaper and Leigha and Im so happy that Elle finally wrote a story for this fantastic couple.I received an ARC of this story in exchange for my honest review.

I wont restate the books blurb because it summarizes the story much better than I ever could.  The story is told from alternating points of view and I love that in this type of book.Sparks fly between Jenny and Chance and they have one mind blowing night together.  When pictures from that night hit the tabloids and internet Chance decides to take off again; he and Jenny didnt even exchange last names.When Jenny goes to Chattanooga to look for Chance she finds out why he left home and learns more about the person he is.  While parts of the story seem somewhat unrealistic this is romantic fiction and I read it for what it is  a way to escape reality and this story allowed me to do that for several hours of reading pleasure.Im not really doing justice to this book with my review; sometimes its hard for me to really describe why I like a book.  All I can say about this one is that once I started reading it I couldnt put it down.I have loved all of the other books Ive read by Deanna Roy and this one is no exception.  If you like her other books you wont want to miss this one.  If you read this one Im sure you will want to read her other books as well.I received an ARC of this book in exchange for an honest review.

So far I've only read three stories from this anthology; my rating is based on those stories. I have purchased the set but ARCs were provided for the three stories I've reviewed below.Always Enough by Molly McClain  5 starsThis is a short, hot story about Tony and Nicole, from Can't Get Enough. I actually think this stands quite well on its own so don't worry if you haven't read Can't Get Enough yet (but you should read it because it's great). Nicole is worried that she and Tony have jumped into their relationship too fast and she's afraid he's going to regret it and/or get tired of her. Nothing could be farther from the truth as you will find out when you read this great story. :-)Kidnapped by Blair Babylon  5 starsIf you've read Blair's Billionaire's in Disguise: Rae you won't want to miss this epilogue. It's a fantastic short story with beloved characters, Rae and Wulf. But be warned, you might want to strangle Blair after you read this one. She is one of the masters of a great cliffhanger. I used to hate books with cliffhangers until I started reading her books. I can't honestly say that I *like* cliffhangers but her writing makes them worth the wait. If you haven't read BID: Rae yet, what are you waiting for?Like Home by Mira Bailee  4 starsThis was a great follow-up story to the Devon Stone series.  I actually think you will enjoy this one even if you havent read the series first.  Olivia is going home for the first time in years and Devon is going with her.  They are attending the wedding of Olivias bestie from high school.  The trip home brings back memories and some unexpected bad vibes from her besties sister and Olivia is perplexed at the animosity.  Theres also an appearance by Olivias old boyfriend that creates some interesting scenes in the story.  I enjoyed this look at whats going on with Olivia and Devon after The Lust List  Devon Stone ended.

I bought these for my husband; they are the second pair of this style we've bought.  He is very hard on shoes and these sandals seem to be holding up very well.  He also wears an extra wide shoe but these normal width sandals work fine for him.

The screen protectors I received did not have a matte finish even though the package said that is what was in it.  I contacted the seller and we came to a satisfactory agreement.  The protectors did fit my Nook HD+ perfectly and application, with no bubbles, was fairly easy.

This story is connected to the Billionaires in Disguise: Rae series but you dont have to have read that (but you should; its great) to enjoy this short story.This takes place after the end of Billionaires in Disguise: Rae (complete series). Wulfs father didnt approve of his relationship with Rae and that leads to some interesting times in this story. This is a more lighthearted story than BID: Rae and theres a lot of laughing and sexy time. The story also answers some questions that you might have had at the end of BID: Rae. It would be wrong to give anything away. Suffice to say that if you enjoyed BID: Rae you wont want to miss this story.I purchased this story as a part of the LOL #3 Romantic Comedy Anthology which is no longer available.

This was my first book by Katie Rose and I really enjoyed reading it.  Darcy and Chase were very likeable characters.Darcy is a house-sitter for famous socialite, Lydia Logan.  Lydia is going out of the country so she tells Darcy to take her place at a charity event.  Since the event is hosted by her favorite baseball team, the Sonics, she is excited to go.  At the event she meets her favorite player, Chase Westbrook.  When Chase doesnt want to listen, Darcy just goes on pretending to be Lydia.  Before too long things snowball and Darcy finds herself impersonating Lydia at more events and hanging out with Chase.  She falls hard for him but is in constant fear of what will happen when he finds out how she has been deceiving him.Chase is perplexed by the mixed signals he gets from Darcy/Lydia.  Her public profile paints her as a self-centered, spoiled rich girl.  Yet when they are together he sees many other facets to her personality.  Shes kind to children and she pitches in to help a friend in the kitchen at a social event.  He is falling hard for her.This was a very engaging story with a few twists.  It has an HEA and I was very entertained while finding out how Chase and Darcy managed to resolve all of their problems to get there.

Glutamine is the most common amino acid found in your muscles - over 61% of skeletal muscle is Glutamine. Glutamine consists of 19% nitrogen, making it the primary transporter of nitrogen into your muscle cells.  During intense training, Glutamine levels are greatly depleted in your body, which decreases strength, stamina and recovery. It could take up to 6 days for Glutamine levels to return to normal - and Glutamine plays a key role in protein synthesis. Studies have shown that L-Glutamine supplementation can minimize breakdown of muscle and improve protein metabolism.Purported benefits of L-Glutamine supplementation are:(1) Glutamine has been linked to protein synthesis. It prevents your muscle from being catabolized (eaten up) in order to provide Glutamine for other cells in the body.(2) Glutamine helps maintain cell volume and hydration, speeding up wound and burn healing and recovery.(3) Glutamine benefits you by replenishing declining Glutamine levels during intense workouts.(4) Research has shown Glutamine can help you produce growth hormone levels. A study has shown 2 grams of L-Glutamine increased growth hormones by over 400%.(5) Glutamine may serve to boost your immune system. For bodybuilders, this is important since heavy workouts tend to greatly deplete Glutamine levels. (Glutamine is a primary energy source for your immune system.)(6) Glutamine is one of the most important nutrients for your intestines. It has the ability to 'repair a leaky gut' by maintaining the structural integrity of the bowels.(7) Treating ulcers.Studies have found that 1.6 grams of Glutamine a day had a 92% cure rate in 4 weeks.

This film is a compilation of speculation from secular historians. It calls the holy gospels "a mixture of fact and fiction."  They refer to "C.E." (common era) instead of "A.D" (Anno Domini).  Combined with several other slights against the bible and Christ, I would recommend that Christians, and anyone else, avoid this junk documentary.  The only purpose that secularists can have in making a Christian documentary is to undermine Christianity.

Erich Von Daniken's book "Chariots of the Gods" is a so-called documentary based on wild speculation and lack of imagination.  While piecing together the great mysteries of archaeology and ancient civilization, whenever the author doesn't know the answer, he assumes extra-terrestrials were responsible.  He often says, "There can be no other explanation," effectively shutting down the debate.The presentation is built on the assumption that ancient civilizations were knuckle-dragging morons, incapable of feats of engineering of any kind.  Any impressive work or monument is attributed to a gift from the ancient alien visitors.Of course, the real motive of Chariots of the Gods is to convince people that their "God" was nothing more than an alien visitor with impressive technology.  The author cites supernatural events in the Holy Bible to further his E.T. drivel, but doesn't acknowledge that the same Bible states that ancient people were engineers brilliant enough to elicit a response from God (i.e. The Tower of Babel).Every claim in this movie has either been debunked or resolved an explanation other than aliens.  I recommend the website AncientAliensDebunked.com.

It brings back memories to watch a real-time Bulls game starting Michael Jordan.  He was truly the all-time best.
Grainy video quality.  No substance. Boring.

Produced in the 1980s, this movie discussed the concept of scientifically modeling earth's systems and predicting outcomes.  The experts make a number of weak presuppositions, and the material is outdated.  Imagine: 30 year old predictions of Global Warming.

The documentary follows the wasted lives of several degenerate youths in the UK as they get high with drugs they can buy legally.Drug prohibition should be completely abolished, but drug use should still be culturally discouraged.  Its a choice, but a dumb choice.

"As It Is In Heaven" is about an apocalyptic cult of around 20 members that lives under twisted pseudo-christian theology.  The cult is led by a "prophet" who claims knowledge of the end of the world.  Like all cults, nobody in the group knows much about the Bible.  Apparently every member missed the Book of Matthew, which states that no one knows when the end is coming -- not even Jesus -- but the Father alone. (Matt. 24:36)Problems arise when the prophet's authority starts to be challenged by some of the members.  The movie was slow and not memorable.

"A priest, a rabbi, and a "liberation theologist" walk into a bar...."  That sounds like the opening to a joke but it is actually how this film panned out.  A cast of mostly non-Christians give their lame theories and interpretations about who Jesus was.  Answers ranged from "a good teacher" to "a fun loving party animal."  And a great deal of the people interviewed had an obvious bias against Christianity.  I'm not sure what value there is for any Christian to listen to a bunch of ignorance and heresy from unbelievers.  One statement in film put forth the idea that Christians persecuted Jews for 2,000 and were responsible for the Holocaust.I would not recommend this film.

This movie claims goofy things, like claiming Osama Bin Laden's name is in the bible, if you jumble the Hebrew letters and make huge logical leaps.  There is no real documentation and the idea is absurd anyway.  Do not buy into this garbage or waste your time watching it.

Here are several arguments put forth by author Matthew Vines:1.  Vines claims that the sin that led to the destruction of Sodom and Gomorrah (Genesis 18-19) was not homosexuality.  "The only form of same-sex behavior described is a threatened gang rape," Vines argues.  Therefore, it is the author's conclusion that homosexuality was not actually condemned, but rather, the threat of forcible rape, and the other sins mentioned in Ezekiel 16:49.  While it is true that homosexuality was not the sole sin that induced God's wrath, it was certainly a part of it.  We know this because of the clarification given by Jude, which states, "just as Sodom and Gomorrah and the surrounding cities, which likewise indulged in sexual immorality and pursued unnatural desire, serve as an example by undergoing a punishment of eternal fire" (Jude 7).  Unnatural desires, like homosexuality.2.  Vines claims that the condemnation of homosexuality as an abominable sin in Leviticus 18:22 and Leviticus 20:13 can be ignored because it was part of the Old Testament law.  As Christians know, the Old Testament was fulfilled by Christ (Romans 10:4) and the Law is now obsolete (Hebrews 8:13).  Vines points out that the word "abomination" was used to describe other sins that were later lifted by God, such as the prohibition on eating certain foods (Leviticus 11:7-12).  His argument fails because, for one thing, the wording is different in the verses on food compared to the verses on homosexuality.  The prohibition on homosexuality says that "it is an abomination," whereas the prohibitions on eating certain animals were repeated decreed, "they shall be an abomination TO YOU" (emphasis added).  In other words, God stated that the former action is an abomination, and the latter action was to be treated as an abomination by the Old Testament Jews.  The parallel between diet restrictions and homosexuality breaks down further after recognizing that the commandments on food were specifically lifted in Acts 10:13, whereas the sinfulness of homosexuality was never lifted.  While the OT Law is no longer a source of righteousness, the character of God has been revealed through it, and God's view of certain actions has not changed.  Christians cannot simply disregard everything from the Old Testament, as Vines seems to imply.  Certain OT prohibitions remain sinful to this day, such as breaking the 10 Commandments, and the engaging in the abomination of homosexuality.3.  Vines claims that the Book of Romans does not condemn homosexuality.  Apostle Paul states, "Because of this, God gave them over to shameful lusts. Even their women exchanged natural sexual relations for unnatural ones. In the same way, the men also abandoned natural relations with women and were inflamed with lust for one another. Men committed shameful acts with other men and received the due penalty for their error" (Romans 1:26-27).  Vines argues that "His description of same-sex behavior is based solely on a burst of excess and lust."  If only the homosexuals in the passage had been involved in loving, committed gay relationships, then Apostle Paul would have approved, the author asserts.  This argument doesn't pass any logical scrutiny.  If lust was the primary issue, Paul would have taken on that issue directly and given no partiality to heterosexuals or homosexuals.  Instead, Paul identifies "shameful acts" occurring between homosexual partners, reaffirming that the "abomination" that God condemned in Leviticus has the same moral standing.4.  Vines claims that two more biblical condemnations of homosexuality are misinterpretations (1 Corinthians 6:9-10 and 1 Timothy 1:10). The Greek words "Malakoi" and "Arsenokoitai" are used in lists of unrighteous characters that will not inherit the kingdom of God.  Vines chooses to deny that these words refer to homosexuals in context and definition, and claims that "the concept of sexual orientation didn't even exist in the ancient world."  The author's argument stretches the limits of plausibility and has no historical basis to be stated as fact.  It is quite irrelevant if the ancients had concocted the concept of "sexual identity" or not.  The bible is clear that homosexual behavior is "an abomination" and a "shameful act."It is wise to look to the bible for answers and it is also wise to refer to original Greek language.  But Mr. Vines has put forth a doctrine of immorality, either by ignorance or by deliberate twisting of scripture.  None of his scriptural arguments hold any water.  Vines' personal life is one matter, but his twisted theology is another,  These biblical acrobatics must be shown for the heresies they are, for the sake of others and for the church.  Nearly every book in the New Testament warns about false disciples of Christ spreading deadly lies, and the myth of the "Gay Christian" is a prime example.God created man and woman to be together, and declared homosexuality an abomination.  Disciples of Christ must necessarily turn away from sin and walk in obedience to God.  Christianity is incompatible with Gay Pride.  Apostle John tells us, "No one born of God makes a practice of sinning, for God's seed abides in him, and he cannot keep on sinning because he has been born of God. By this it is evident who are the children of God, and who are the children of the devil: whoever does not practice righteousness is not of God, nor is the one who does not love his brother." (1 John 3:9-10)

Over the last 2,000 years, the Apostles of Christ have been viewed less as men, and more as superhuman saints.  This film attempts to humanize the twelve Apostles.  They were, after all, no one special on their own.  They came from humble backgrounds and had all the weaknesses and flaws that we would expect.  The bible does not attempt to hide their failings, doubts, and lack of faith.When read properly, we should notice the very relatable characteristics of the Apostles.  This film is successful at pointing out those features and does so in a responsible way that is true to the bible.  This film features reputable biblical scholars such as John MacArthur, and as such, contains a message that is logical and scipturally sound.I would recommend this movie to anyone who would like to learn (or re-learn) about the Apostles and the early church.

This movie analyzes several events of the Old Testament and argues that they really happened, except by natural causes instead of miracles.  (Sodom and Gomorrah were destroyed by the ash from a volcano.  Jericho was destroyed by an earthquake.  The Red Sea was parted by some sort of wind that exposed a patch of earth.)The producers do not appear to be directly attacking the bible, as their conclusion is that it is true.  But their effort to turn God's miracles into ordinary phenomenon raises red flags.The film is also very dated.  It mentions Saddam Hussein as the current leader of Iraq.I would not recommend.

According to the movie, "food insecurity" is when people don't know where their next meal is going to come from.  Allegedly 50 million Americans fit this description.The premise is that the problem is not a lack of food, but poverty and the inability to afford healthy food.  The government was universally considered the solution to every problem presented.  "Charity is great, but we don't pay our defense budget with charity," says Jeff Bridges.  Bigger government was his answer.  No effort was spent on the underlying causes of poverty, such as the breakdown of the nuclear family, the exploding entitlement culture, the exportation of America's manufacturing jobs, and other forms of government-caused economic distress.The movie makes the absurd claim that government food subsidies are "very hard to qualify for," and that those who qualify don't get enough money to survive.  This is demonstrably false as other posters have mentioned.  The film also decries the "low" federal subsidy for school lunches.The film points out how federal farming subsidies has skewed the cost of consumer goods, especially processed, unhealthy foods (which is true).  The movie then goes on to explain that poor people are forced to eat tons of noodles and junk food to survive, which evidently explains why people can be completely obese and "food insecure" at the same time.  No effort was spent advocating gardening or other means of creating food or stretching food budgets.The film was one appeal to emotion after another.  Teary-eyed welfare recipients explained their plight; one kid described hallucinating in a classroom because of hunger.  Naturally, the solution to all of this is unrestrained welfare spending in Washington DC.The film claims that hunger was "stamped out" in the 1970s thanks to the gigantic welfare programs of Presidents Johnson and Nixon.  A video montage was shown of speeches from Reagan, Bush I, Clinton, Bush II, and Obama, all sounding the familiar call to solve hunger through more government welfare.  Amazingly, poverty rates have risen with the size of the American welfare state.  While its true that "corporate welfare" (farm subsidies) and "defense" (aka foreign wars) are sources of great waste, government has contributed to this problem in more ways than one.One worthwhile point that the the movie makes is how ignorant many Americans are about food.  One child interviewed said he eats only soda pop, cookies, and chips.  Another scene showed a teacher explaining to her class what a melon was.  America's problems lie in its profound ignorance, tragic irresponsibility, and the entitled, selfish attitude about demanding charity by force.

As others pointed out, this "documentary" on the Bible is not produced by Christians and was built on the presupposed theory of evolution, rather than God's creation.  The "experts" interviewed within include Bigfoot-chasers like Loren Coleman rather than biblical scholars.  It speaks of "millions of years before humans" and other counter-biblical assumptions.  Why speculate about the beasts of the bible if the first chapter (7-day creation) is going to be thrown in the shredder?  The only purpose for such works is to undermine God's word.

This series touts the existence of spiritual phenomenon but embraces all things contrary to the Word of God.  Worshiping the earth, "Mother Nature," practicing witchcraft and other forms of blatant idolatry are presented as "not evil at all."  The segments about angels had no biblical basis whatsoever.  Satan smiles at this kind of programming.

Below is a full review of the Renew Life Total Kidney Detox product, its contents, its directions, its warnings, and my personal experience with it.KIT CONTENTS:  The package consists of two bottles of herbal capsules: a Morning Formula (Total Kidney Detox #1) and an Evening Formula (Total Kidney Detox #2).  Each bottle contains 60 capsules.DIRECTIONS:  The kit is designed for a 3-part cleanse lasting roughly 6 weeks.  For the first 3 days of the cleanse, take one (1) capsule of Total Kidney Detox #1 in the morning and one (1) capsule of Total Kidney Detox #2 in the evening.  After 3 days, increase to two (2) morning capsules and two (2) evening capsules.  Take the morning formula on an empty stomach; either 30 minutes before breakfast or 60 minutes after breakfast.  Continue at full-strength until 2 weeks has elapsed since the cleanse began.  Then take a 2-week break, to allow your organs a rest.  Then resume the cleanse at full-strength for roughly 2 more weeks until the bottles are empty.DIETARY RECOMMENDATIONS:  Water (8-10 glasses daily), fresh fruit and vegetables, fish, chicken, turkey, eggs, well-cooked grains (millet, buckwheat, amaranth, quinoa, spelt, and teff), pasta made from above grains, essential fatty acids (flax oil, fish oil, borage oil), butter, raw almonds and seeds, raw almond butter.DIETARY AVOIDS (SUGGESTED): Fried food, greasy food, junk food, soda pop, alcohol, sugary foods, candy, red meat, excessive calories.  Minimize consumption of processed or refined foods.  Avoid refined sugars and high-fructose corn syrup.RECOMMENDED SUPPLEMENTS:  Fiber supplement (to carry out toxins and to aid natural elimination functions of the bowel), probiotic flora supplement (to promote optimal digestive bacterial balance).  Take other vitamins & supplements as normal, at another time of day.MORNING FORMULA (BOTTLE #1) INGREDIENTS:  Cranberry fruit extract, Parsley leaf, Horsetail herb extract, Stinging Nettle leaf extract, Dandelion leaf extract, Couch grass, White Kidney Bean pod extract, Corn silk, Buchu leaf extract.  Encased in vegetable capsule.EVENING FORMULA (BOTTLE #2) INGREDIENTS:  Potassium, Uva Ursi leaf extract.  Encased in vegetable capsule.OTHER RECOMMENDATIONS:  It is recommended that the user first perform a colon cleanse before moving on to a kidney cleanse.  The colon must be operating at optimal health and regularity so that it is prepared to keep up and eliminate any toxins that the kidney releases during this detox program.  Renew Life recommends its "First Cleanse" or "CleanseSMART" colon cleanse programs.WARNINGS:  Do not use if pregnant or nursing.  Consult physician if taking medication or have medical condition.  Not for prolonged use.  Do not exceed recommended dose.  Notice: Total Kidney Detox is designed to be taken for two 2-week periods with a 2-week resting period in between.  You should not take Total Kidney Detox for longer than two consecutive weeks without utilizing the suggested rest period.  Discontinue use if adverse effects occur.= - = - = - = - = - = - = - = - = - = - = - = - = - = - = - =MY PERSONAL EXPERIENCE:  As recommended in the literature, I performed a colon cleanse (CleanseSMART) prior to attempting a kidney detox program.  I began this program in optimal health, without any kidney problems or nagging reasons to detox.  My intention is to undergo a full-body detox this year and eliminate any possibility of lingering kidney stones.I followed the kit directions faithfully and found the diet recommendations easy to follow.  I took the recommended 2-week break in the middle of the cleanse.  Everything went smoothly and I did not notice any effects or side-effects -- positive or negative -- whatsoever.  Unlike the noticeable effects of a colon cleanse, it is difficult to notice your kidney detoxifying.  Life continued as normal throughout the Total Kidney Detox program, as I expected.My intention is to go through cleanses in the following order:  (1) Colon, (2) Kidney, (3) Liver, (4) Parasite.  I will use Renew Life products for each.

Below is a full review of the Renew Life CleanseSMART product, its contents, its directions, its warnings, and my personal experience with it.KIT CONTENTS:  The package consists of two bottles of herbal capsules: a Morning Formula (CleanseSMART #1) and an Evening Formula (CleanseSMART #2).  Each bottle contains 60 capsules.DIRECTIONS:  The kit is designed for continuous daily use for roughly a month-long cleanse.  For the first 3 days of the cleanse, take one (1) capsule of CleanseSMART #1 in the morning and one (1) capsule of CleanseSMART #2 in the evening.  After 3 days, increase to two (2) morning capsules and two (2) evening capsules.  Take the morning formula on an empty stomach; either 30 minutes before breakfast or 60 minutes after breakfast.DIETARY RECOMMENDATIONS:  Water (8-10 glasses daily), fresh fruit and vegetables, fish, chicken, turkey, eggs, well-cooked grains (millet, buckwheat, amaranth, quinoa, spelt, and teff), pasta made from above grains, essential fatty acids (flax oil, fish oil, borage oil), butter, raw almonds and seeds, raw almond butter.DIETARY AVOIDS (SUGGESTED): Fried food, greasy food, junk food, soda pop, alcohol, sugary foods, candy, red meat, excessive calories.RECOMMENDED SUPPLEMENTS:  Fiber supplement (to carry out toxins and to aid natural elimination functions of the bowel), Omega 3-6-9 fatty acid supplement (to aid in elimination and lubricate the bowel), probiotic supplement (to promote optimal digestive bacterial balance).  Lastly, digestive enzymes (I like Nature's Sunshine food enzymes).  Take other vitamins & supplements as normal, at another time of day.MORNING FORMULA (BOTTLE #1) INGREDIENTS:  Artichoke leaf extract, Ashwagandha root extract, Beet leaf extract, Bupleurum root extract, Burdock root extract, Celandine leaf, Chlorella, Corn silk, Dandelion root extract, Hawthorn berry extract, LAG (larch arabinogalactan), Milk Thistle seed extract, Mullein leaf, Red Clover leaf and stem, Turmeric root extract.  Encased in vegetable capsule.EVENING FORMULA (BOTTLE #2) INGREDIENTS:  Cape Aloe leaf, Rhubarb root, Slippery Elm bark, Marshmallow root, Fennel seed, Ginger root, Triphala (a blend of Amalaki, Bibhitaki, and Haritaki).  Encased in vegetable capsule.WARNINGS:  Do not use if pregnant or nursing.  Consult physician if taking medication or have medical condition.  Not for prolonged use.  Do not exceed recommended dose.  Do not use if you have or develop abdominal pain, diarrhea, or loose stools.= - = - = - = - = - = - = - = - = - = - = - = - = - = - = - =MY PERSONAL EXPERIENCE:  The CleanseSMART program made a 100% unmistakeable difference in my digestive elimination pattern; not only during the cleanse program but also months after.  Prior to doing the cleanse, by bowel movement (BM) frequency was very, very slow.  It was normal for me to have one (very large) BM every 2-3 days, on average.  A dietician & health guru informed me that this was incredibly unhealthy and that the optimal elimination frequency is one BM per meal.  That much pooping was unheard of for me.I decided to try CleanseSMART based on a friend's recommendation.  I followed the directions faithfully and did not find the dietary recommendations to be difficult at all.  I took fiber, omega 3 fatty acids, and probiotics as recommended.  The results were remarkable.  My bowel movement frequency increased noticeably by the third day.  Instead of one BM every 48-72 hours, I was having one BM every 8-12 hours.  In other words, a poop after every meal, on average.  The most BMs I experienced during the cleanse was 4 in one day.  The BMs should be solid consistency with a clean wipe -- we are not talking about diarrhea here.More importantly, the positive effects of the cleanse have continued well after I took the final capsules.  I am writing this 3 months later and I am maintaining a schedule of 1 or 2 BMs per day, which is comfortable and healthy for me; it is a vast improvement from my sluggish schedule before the cleanse.  I have to say I feel better to be operating on a regular schedule, not carrying around days' worth of waste inside me.I must warn you: the flatulence I experienced during the cleanse was incredible.  It was a gas FAR more potent than anything I have ever released.  I am talking about nostril-burning, eye-watering farts from hell.  And a lot of them.  The farts kicked into high gear on the third day of the cleanse and didn't taper off until maybe 2 months after I completed the program.  This is attributed to the ongoing detoxification of your organs, and the release of stored bacteria.  The colon becomes a battleground of various bacteria, and the result is an audible wind-turbine of room-clearing flatulence.  Eventually the bowels find a balance of healthy bacteria and the gas production returns to normal.  To combat the smelly fart-storm, I experimented with a few supplements known assist with flatulence production and smell: liquid dietary chlorophyll, fennel capsules, activated charcoal capsules, and of course daily probiotics.All in all, I found the cleanse to be very effective and rewarding.  My intention is to go through a kidney cleanse, liver cleanse, parasite cleanse, and eventually do another colon cleanse.  I would recommend this product.

In this documentary, a muslim female videographer from Pakistan travels across Afghanistan to assess whether the standards of living for women have improved since the American military campaign in that country.  The film shows a depressing and honest look at how women live in that war-ravaged and desolate land.Afghanistan has always been a target of invading foreign empires, and the last 3 decades have been no exception. The country has been war-ravaged since the invasion of the Soviets in the 1980s, and the invasion of the Americans in the 2000s.  As a result, the people of Afghanistan have a very low average lifespan of only 60 years.  Warfare decimated the male population, leaving tremendous amounts of widows and orphans in Afghanistan.  Many of the survivors live in squalor and barely get by through begging.  Others are literally sold into marriage, are treated as property, and are often viciously abused.  Extreme poverty and crude technology makes life very difficult for the average person.Women are rarely educated and looked down upon, in general.  It is usual to see women wearing a head-to-toe garment known as a burqa that has only a small mesh area for seeing and breathing.  Although onerous to wear, the burqa provides women with some anonymity when dealing with the abusive male population.  Afghan men candidly admit that they could not imagine allowing their wives to expose her faces in public, and admit that if they saw women walking around without burqas, that they would be unlikely to control themselves from using some kind of sexual violence against them.The documentary smashes the myth that the American invasion improved the living conditions of Afghans.  For many, like the orphans and widows, they are worse off after U.S. intervention.

I have been using American Health probiotic wafers for several years.  The brand delivers consistent quality in its wafers and packaging.  There are numerous benefits to taking probiotics, including positive effects on digestion and immunity.  I have been taking them 3x daily with my meals.  The bottle states that they should be refrigerated after opening.I have tried all the flavors: Banana, Blueberry, Strawberry, Fruit.  I don't really find any of them objectionable or overly delicious.  I really don't mind them at all.  It puzzles me when people freak out about chewing a semi-sweet wafer.

This is a great little brush that fit my needs perfectly.  It easily stows in my camera bag and helps me remove dust from my lenses without having to resort to using my shirt or some other improvisation.  The brush is gentle and does the job as expected.  No complaints!  I would recommend.

The UA balaclava is a nice addition that helps cover up exposed skin and stay warm in cold weather.  You can snug it up so only your eyes are exposed.  You can pull down the front, if desired, and let your mouth and nose breathe freely.  Or, you can roll the hood down so that it only covers your neck.  In the coldest weather, I used a hat on top of this hood.As with any mask, if you breath into it for a long time it is going to collect moisture from your breath.  And that moisture may not be comfortable trapped against your face in cold weather.  I don't know of any way around this, other than to roll it down every so often and let it dry out.  When skiing, I would cover my mouth/face as I skied downhill, but as we stood around talking at the bottom I would roll down the front of the mask.Overall I like the product.  If I want to take it off, it is very compact and can fit in any pocket.

I have been using these devices for 2 years and have not had a recurrence of mice or ants during that time.  It may be a coincidence, or they may have been repelled by the ultrasonic pulses.  Spiders, on the other hand, do not seem to mind being in the same room with the devices (10' away).

I purchased these for a 2003 Honda CRV and have been very satisfied.  The mats are affordable, sturdy, and functional.  They collect dirt and protect your carpet.  You can easily dump them off and hose them down.  The front and back mats fit in my vehicle without modification.  I would recommend them.

I purchased this cayenne supplement because of cayenne's numerous health and dietary benefits.  It has been shown to speed up metabolism and help you burn extra calories every day without effort.  It also purportedly helps to suppress appetite, aid digestion, decrease inflammation, and boost immunity.  I take cayenne 3x/day.The NOW Foods brand consistently provides great products, with secure packaging, and consistent quality.  I would recommend this product for its ease and convenience.  I would also recommend getting some powdered cayenne to use with cooking.

I bought this boonie hat to keep the sun off me when I was hiking the Grand Canyon.  It fit my needs and expectations.  It appropriately fit my 7-3/8" diameter head, and also comes with a drawstring in case it gets windy.  I found the had to be sturdy worth the price.  I will use it again in the future.

The tape measure accurately marks off inches and centimeters.  Believe it or not, some cheap-o brands represent inches that are too short or too long.  I assumed Singer would have some quality control and I was correct.

I purchased these clips because they looked identical to the name-brand kind and the price is dirt cheap.  That was a MISTAKE.  After waiting several weeks for the package to arrive from Hong Kong, I finally received a pair of flimsy alligator clips and wires.The first issue I noticed was that the two female ends of the alligator clips (which are supposed to accept the male ends of the wires) were crimped shut.  I have no idea why a company would ship me clips in this condition.  I was forced to get a pair of needle-nosed pliers and try to un-crimp them so I could connect them to wires.  (See Attached Photo #1)After un-crimping the first clip, I attempted to join the male end of the wire to the female end of the alligator clip.  Immediately the wire came loose from its male-end connector.  I retrieved a mini-screwdriver to attempt to re-connect it.  That was a futile endeavor.  The tiny screw which presses against the copper wires does not tightly seat against the opposite side of connector, making a tight connection of the wire impossible.  The wire could not be securely reattached to the male-end connector.  (See Attached Photo #2)I confirmed that these clips were unusable junk.  There is no way I would want to deal with the frustration of having these fall apart on me in the middle of a project.  I threw them in the garbage.  Do not waste your time on these.

Tri-Onimos is a novel concept and I was excited to try it with my family.  We love playing games and love conventional Dominoes, so this game had a natural appeal to us.The product is well made and well packaged.  The Tri-ominos come in a metal tin and are sure to last for years and years of use.  Everything about the set is quality.However, the gameplay left me desiring more.  While the concept seemed like a nice change of pace, it slows down the game and makes it overly complicated.  Rather than matching up your pieces with a single already-played number (as in old-fashioned Dominoes), you are now obligated to simultaneously match your pieces to at least 2 (sometimes 3) numbers that are already in play, and have them fit in the configuration in which they are laid on the board.  While I am not intimidated by the mental challenge of this, I found that the gameplay really gets slow based on the limited number of playable options.  This gets especially true when playing with 4 players, when the Tri-ominoes are divided 4 ways.  The game involved a lot of waiting for people to lay down a piece.I don't hate it, but I would rather play with conventional Dominoes, honestly.  The original was hard to beat; rather than toiling to find a playable piece, I can focus on playing things that score the highest.I'm giving Tri-ominos 3 stars for "It's okay."

No more do I have to fumble around with numerous pill bottles, clumsily twisting lids every day.  This pill organizer lets me neatly arrange my supplements into 28 generously-sized compartments.  You can follow the labels and arrange pills into Morning/Noon/Evening/Bed doses, or you can use the compartments to divide up your supplements for multiple weeks.  The choice is yours!Overall this is everything I could ask for in a pill container.  The compartments are deep and hold a ton of pills.  I use it for vitamin supplements, some of them are very large.  The lids snap on securely, and are also removable for easy cleaning.  It is quite convenient and worth the purchase.  I would recommend.

This is dried powder from the exotic aa (ah-sah-EE) palm berry.  The powder itself has a mild berry taste, but to be honest the taste usually gets overwhelmed by the ingredients I mix it with.  I use this powder to boost the nutritional value of my smoothies.Aa is a veritable superfood with numerous health benefits. It is a natural anti-inflammatory and is packed with antioxidants which fight various diseases. Its "ORAC" (Oxygen Radical Absorbance Capacity) value tops the charts, higher than ANY fruit and puts it among the highest level of antioxidants of any food known to man. In perspective, Aa has 20-50 times the amount of antioxidants as most staple fruits found in the USA.The packaging was secure and the product was consistent and fresh.  I would not hesitate to buy again, although it would be nice to buy in larger quantities at a bulk discount.

This is dried powder from the exotic maqui berry, which grows in the rainforests in Chile.  The powder itself has a tart berry taste, but to be honest the taste usually gets overwhelmed by the ingredients I mix it with.  I use this powder to boost the nutritional value of my smoothies.Maqui is a veritable superfood with numerous health benefits. It is a natural anti-inflammatory and is packed with antioxidants which fight various diseases. Its "ORAC" (Oxygen Radical Absorbance Capacity) value tops the charts, and beats nearly all other fruits and puts it among the highest level of antioxidants of any food known to man. In perspective, maqui has as much as 40 times the amount of antioxidants as most staple fruits found in the USA.The packaging was secure and the product was consistent and fresh.  I would not hesitate to buy again, although it would be nice to buy in larger quantities at a bulk discount.

This is dried powder from the exotic camu camu berry, which grows in the rainforests in South America.  The powder itself has a noticeable tart taste, but to be honest the taste usually gets overwhelmed by the ingredients I mix it with.  I use this powder to boost the nutritional value of my smoothies.Camu Camu is a veritable superfood with numerous health benefits. It is a natural anti-inflammatory and is packed with antioxidants which fight various diseases. It is packed with Vitamin C, and actually has 60 times more per serving as an orange.The packaging was secure and the product was consistent and fresh.  I would not hesitate to buy again, although it would be nice to buy in larger quantities at a bulk discount.

This tea is a delicious blend of green tea and exotic aa (ah-sah-EE) palm berries.  The tea has a pleasant taste and I often do not add any sweetener to it.  The Republic of Tea brand is top notch, packing its teas into air-tight tubes, and using round bleach-free tea bags.  I have never had a bad experience of tea escaping the bag.Aa is a veritable superfood with numerous health benefits.  It is a natural anti-inflammatory and may help fight disease.  Its "ORAC" (Oxygen Radical Absorbance Capacity) value tops the charts, higher than ANY fruit and among the highest of any food known to man.  In perspective, Aa has 20-50 times the amount of antioxidants as most staple fruits found in the USA.I have purchased several flavors from the Republic of Tea and would happily recommend their products.  Also try Coconut Cacao.

I purchased several Jon vanDyk ties recently and have been very pleased with them.  I really enjoy the narrow 2.5" skinny design.  The ties are sold at a bargain price but do not look or feel cheap.  I would recommend this brand.

I purchased several Jon vanDyk ties recently and have been very pleased with them.  I really enjoy the narrow 2.5" skinny design.  The ties are sold at a bargain price but do not look or feel cheap.  I would recommend this brand.

I purchased several Jon vanDyk ties recently and have been very pleased with them.  I really enjoy the narrow 2.5" skinny design.  The ties are sold at a bargain price but do not look or feel cheap.  I would recommend this brand.

I purchased several Jon vanDyk ties recently and have been very pleased with them.  I really enjoy the narrow 2.5" skinny design.  The ties are sold at a bargain price but do not look or feel cheap.  I would recommend this brand.

Our family loves card games, and purchased several of these trays as gifts.  The unit rotates 360 and has very deep slots.  I think the most we have used is 4 decks of cards while playing "Hand & Foot."  Overall this was a satisfying purchase and met our needs at a bargain price.  I would recommend this product.

My son is very interested in joining the Imperial forces when he grows up.  He says he's not sure if he wants to help police the homeland or if he wants to invade foreign countries.  So I thought a new Predator drone toy would be a nice gift for him.  These drones are used both domestically and internationally, to spy on people and assassinate them at the Emperor's discretion.  He just loves flying his drone around our house, dropping Hellfire missiles on Scruffy, our dog.  He kept saying that Scruffy was a terror suspect and needed to be taken out.  I asked him if Scruffy should get a trial first, and he quoted Lindsay Graham, Imperial Senator:  "Shut up Scruffy, you don't get a trial!"  I was so proud.  I think I'll buy him some video games that promote martial law for Christmas.

I had so much fun playing this game with my fellow enforcers during our shift.  We kept arresting each other and locking each other's tokens in jail, which is the basic dynamic of the game.  The objective is to grow your department's budget and imprison as many players as possible.  I chose to be the "Taser" token, my favorite.  The "Chance" cards are different reasons you get to arrest each other, and different ways to collect revenue from people trying to travel around the board.  If you roll anything higher than a 6 (on two dice), you have to pay the government half a week's wages.  "Community Chest" cards are reasons you get to send the SWAT token into people's homes at night (always a blast).  One highlight for me was when I got to confiscate someone's hotel using the civil forfeiture rule.  Another time a player was suspected of growing illegal plants so the SWAT Token came to his property and shot his Dog Token.  This game is a must for anyone who enjoys enforcing tons of arbitrary rules and taking people's money.

Roadblocks in the streets, spying on fellow citizens, Big Brother surveillance, martial law... Everything a boot-licking American could ask for!This game is great if you want to condition yourself or your child for a future in law enforcement.If you confiscate enough private property you can unlock "PATRIOT ACT MODE", where you can see through walls and perform sneak & peek searches of residential homes.Burn enough constitutions and you can access secret levels where you are tasked with relocating people into Internment Camps!!  SUPER FUN!!But watch out for your nemisis, Congressman Ron Paul.  He stands in the way of your mission!When America becomes a prison camp, YOU WIN!!

This is not my first read by this author, so when I received word that this book was coming out i was very excited. I absolutely loved her previous books Entangle and Entice and couldn't wait to get my hands on this one. I didn't think that I could possibly love this one more than the last, but I think I might have said that about that one too. Ms. Larsen's writing is so amazing, she has totally outdone herself with this book, she is definitely on my auto one-click list. I didn't even read the synopsis before reading this book, I just jumped in headfirst. I totally loved Julia & Giles's story. The story is emotional, and funny, and heartwarming and just sucks you in and doesn't let go. So plan for some time to read. As with the previous books, I really got quite a few laughs from this book. The author has a hilariously wicked sense of humor. I just can't recommend this book enough. I was generously given a complimentary copy of this book by the author for an honest review.

This is my first time reading anything by this author, and I have to say that he has just blown me away! I was sucked right into the story and could not, would not, put it down! I just totally devoured this book. The story flows effortlessly, and I literally raced through the pages. This is a definite chills up your spine read. It one hell of a ride for certain! It is full of mystery, suspense, and twists and turns, its totally crazy good. (Ha! Crazy) I don't want to leave any spoilers, but if you're reading this in bed, you might want to grab a night light. I can not wait to read more from this talented author. I was generously given a complimentary copy of this book from the author for an honest review.

This is an amazing debut novel. I have read a lot of debut books and this one really shines, it has the feel of a very seasoned author and has put this author on my ones to watch list! I absolutely loved Zoe and Logan's story, it is so very intense and it is packed with a myriad of pure, raw, emotions, angst, love, hurt, and on and on. I was completely drawn into the story and couldn't put it down.  Logan and Zoe have such electric chemistry and a very intense connection. They are very relatable characters. Zoe has gone through horrors and is still a strong, beautiful, albeit damaged woman, and Logan is just so easy to fall in love with. He is sweet and sexy and funny and loves wholly. I loved the twists and turns in the book, keeping you going, needing to know everything. I definitely recommend and can't wait to read more from this awesome author. I was given a complimentary copy of this book for an honest review.

This book is phenomenal. I didn't realize at first when I picked up this book that it was the third in a series. I usually do not read a series unless I start at the beginning, but I really enjoyed this read. I fully intend to go back and read the first two. I loved the author's writing, she weaves a very complex, intriguing, and unique story. I am a huge fan of post apocalyptic stories and this one definitely stands out. I was drawn into the story right away and just could not put it down. The twists and turns and plot as a whole just kept me glued to the book. I also absolutely loved the characters and they are so well developed with a lot of depth to them. I definitely recommend this book, and will be watching out for works by this author.

I just love this author's writing style. This is the second book that I've had the opportunity to read from her and I had high hopes for this book as I loved the first read. I was not disappointed. This book has a great plot with such fascinatingly detailed descriptions that you really feel like you are right there with the characters living out the story with them. It is a complex yet easy read full of adventure, suspense and the added bonus of a romance. There is a lot going on in this book with multiple characters, but it is so skillfully written that you are always right in step during the read. I definitely enjoyed this read immensely and am looking forward to reading more from this talented author.

I absolutely loved this book. The book started off a little slow but then once I got a little way into the story, BAM! I was sucked right into the story and held captive totally unable to put it down! The author has done a tremendous job with this one, the world that she has created, the characters, the writing, just everything. The read just flows so effortlessly, and the descriptions are so fantastic that you are transported directly into the story. I just loved how Scarlett evolves throughout the read, becoming this strong amazing female lead, and Drakon... what else can I say except yum! He is a total hot alpha that you don't want to miss! I was generously given a complimentary copy of this book for an honest review.

This was a terrific lighthearted, fun read. I just loved Phoebe. She is a total sweetheart, cute, quirky, and so funny and a walking example of Murphy's Law. Just wait until you see the things that she gets up to. Colton is an edgy, dirty talking, sexy, alpha, bad boy. The kind of guy you never see settling down. I absolutely adored the witty banter between these two. The humor was almost my favorite thing about this book. I loved the romance of course, but I found myself laughing out loud, which earned me a few strange looks, but my family is (or should be) used to me reading quietly and having sudden outbursts by now. I will definitely be looking out for more from this talented author. I was given a complimentary copy of this book for an honest review.

This is the first read for me if anything by this author. I found this book to be quite intriguing. The author has done a great job with creating a seriously intricate plot. I was totally pulled into the story. It's seriously difficult to put down! I really got into Abi and Jacks characters. Both characters are so skillfully well developed, both sexy as hell, while Abi is young,  smart, strong, shy and totally relatable, while Jack is this dark, sensual man with a darkness all his own. The author has taken us on this journey full of sensuality, mystery, and so many twists and turns, you just have to keep going to find out what happens next. I already grabbed my copy of The Devils Gate two. I was generously given a complimentary copy of this book for an honest review.

The author has done an absolutely fan-freaking-tasting job with this series. She has created a very unique world with characters that I absolutely fell in love with especially Cameron. She is brave, sweet, selfless, and fearless. It's awesome that this is a box set, because I devoured each book and if I had to wait between volumes, I would have screamed. The story is told from multiple POV's and is done so in a very skilled manner so that there is no confusion as to who you are following along with, which can often happen with multiple POV's especially when there are more than two, as is the case here. The entire story is just epic as it unfolds from page one of book one to the very last page of the epilogue in book four. I am sad to see this story and its characters end, but the author also did a fantastic job with the ending, though it wasn't at all what I had expected. I definitely recommend that you take this amazing journey. I was generously provided a complimentary copy of this book by NetGalley for an honest review.

I really enjoyed this read. It is definitely not for the faint of heart or people sensitive to foul language. I thought it was a hoot. I have to admit though that at first I didn't care for Adalyn all that much, she was kind of off-putting, but as I got to know her better I began to understand her better and really accept her. I totally loved Ian, and I really found myself loving Stacy. The author has written a very good story with a great plot, tons of humor, romance and suspense. I definitely will be looking out for more from this author, and recommend you give this one a try. I was given a complimentary copy of this book for an honest review.

This is my first read by this author and I really liked her writing. I love the way that she wove such an intricate story that is literally full of suspense, mystery romance, drama, and intrigue. There are truly some really horror worthy stuff contained within these pages! I was swept up in the book and became totally engrossed in the story and just wanted to keep reading until the last page and read it straight through. I also loved the twists and turns and the ending was like... woah! I won't say why because SPOILERS!, but what I will say is that I definitely recommend this book. You should definitely grab a copy! I was generously provided a copy of this book for an honest review.

This is my first time reading anything by this author and all I can say is WOW! I absolutely loved these books! Once I started reading I was totally hooked and devoured each and every word, turning page after page after page, just needing to know what was coming next. When I hit the last page I was still wanting more and am ecstatic to report that there are 4 more! Yay! The author's writing is fan-freaking-tastic. I don't often become a fan of an author from just one read, I may like the authors writing an look for another from that author but it takes me a bit to add to my auto one-click list. Not with Ms. Swift, she is total one click material. Each book is a fast paced quick read that quickly sucks you in and ends in an epic cliffhanger, so it's awesome that the first four are all packaged together here, so you can go right into the next instead of dying to wait for the next release. Right away I loved Megan and fell instantly into lust with Landon. We are swept up into the mystery and suspense following the murder of Julia's boss, and the suspicions fly in the second book. In the third book we get to know Landon even better and things between him and Megan are really getting hot. I love all of the suspense, reading it is so intense I at times felt my body rigid with tension as I flew through the pages. This story just gets better and better as you go. The there are so many twists and turns keeping you going eager for what is to come. I can't wait to sink my teeth into the next in this series! I was generously provided a complimentary copy of this book for an honest review.

This is my first time reading this author, so I wasn't sure what to expect, but I was pleasantly surprised and will definitely be watching out for her future releases. I have to admit that when I first began reading the book it took me a little while to get into the book, but after that I was totally hooked. I love Sophie, she is a strong but sweet, independent woman with a great sense of humor. I also have to admit that I started out really disliking Ashton, not only because of the role he and his high school girlfriend played in torturing Sophie during high school but he acts like a total tool, so totally rude and full of himself, that I was positive that there would be no way that I could ever end up liking this character. I was happy to discover that there was something more to him under all of that tool-ishness. I liked the way that the author "played" Truth or Dare and really ended up enjoying the story. I was given a complimentary copy of this book for an honest review.

This is the first book in this series and I just can not wait for more. This is my first read by Ms. Murphy, but I can assure you that it will not be my last, I was super impressed with her writing. The author has don a fantastic job with this one. The title and blurb were pretty enticing and it seriously does not disappoint. It is totally hot and drool-worthy. The plot is great and the characters were very well developed. I totally loved Razer was Claire's story, as well as the family background, I am very much looking forward to reading the next in the series. The chemistry between Razer was Claire is electric, and their steamy encounters are totally smoking hot. I was generously provided a complimentary copy of this book for an honest review.

I have to admit that I was first drawn to this book because of the beautiful cover, I know what most people say about judging a book by it's cover, but this rarely fails me, then when I read the synopsis I knew that I wanted to read this book for certain. I think that the author did a great job in creating this world and the lovely characters. It took a bit but once I became immersed in the story I really didn't want to put it down. I just needed to know what was going to happen next what with the unexpected twists that the author artfully throws our way. As for the heroine Eyelet and the hero Urlick, I just adore them, together they are just so terrific, both perfectly imperfect, and man do they have everything but the kitchen sink thrown at them. There is very little in the way of things that I didn't like about this book, and I look forward to reading more from this author. I was generously provided a complimentary copy of this book for an honest review.

This box set has nine really great romance reads. All of the books are quick, fun steamy, romantic and different reads, that each very easily make you feel as if you've read a full length book. I also found myself a few new to me authors to watch out for. You have something for everyone from straight up romance, to the paranormal to out there futuristic tales and everything in between. I can not tell you how much I liked every story, which is unusual for a collection, often there are at least one or two that are kind of nah... to me but I really liked all of the stories included in this set. My favorite was Silent Sky by Regina Kammer. It was very emotional for me and I just felt very involved in the story and found myself very much able to relate to Jennie. I definitely recommend this collection and as of the writing of this review you really can't beat the deal, on Amazon it is only 99c and FREE on Kindle Unlimited! I was generously provided a complimentary copy of this book for an honest review.

A Fun, Funny, Sweet and Sassy Paranormal ReadThis is my first read by  Tellulah Darling but I can say that it will not be my last. I absolutely enjoyed this book. I love the characters, they are all unique each with their own supernatural abilities and each very well developed by the author, and totally relatable. The book is told from multiple POV's which I love because you really get to know the characters, I totally love Frankie & Rafa, who have so many challenges, obstacles and issues that they have to deal with, as well as the rest of the merry misfit band of friends. I really loved the laugh out loud banter and snark. The author starts you off running and draws you right in, and from there it only goes up. I definitely had a hard time putting this one down, because of that pesky thing called life. :p It is total non stop action and mystery and just makes you want to keep going. I also loved the wit and humor, and found myself snorting with laughter, giggling and just laughed quite a bit. This is the first in the series and I can't wait to read more, but in the meantime I intend to busy myself with the authors back list, there are quite a few yay! I was generously provided a complimentary copy of this book for an honest review.

Where to start? First I was drawn in by the beautiful and intriguing cover, and then when I read the blurb and saw this, "I am darkness; what you would consider a thief amongst the living. Ive spent time, so much of it that it seems a trifle word to call it, in that gloom being swallowed whole by human grief and human tears. I am the angel of death.", I knew that I just HAD to read this book! I so was not disappointed, it far surpassed my expectations! I absolutely love this book. This is one of those books that you run to your book-y friends and insist that they must read it, and then being the pain in the arse that I am, I keep asking "Have you read it yet?" "Where are you in the book?" "What did you think of it?" "You loved it right? Am I right?" "Of course I'm right." Yep, I'm THAT girl, but there is just everything to love about this book, it's really hard to write without fan-girling, I just can't. The story is just beautiful, the author has painted us into a fantastical story full of emotions that grab you and take you along for the ride, there will be smiles and tears, yes tears, elation and pain, and so much more. This book left me with one of the hardest book hangovers that I've had to date. I definitely recommend it. I can't wait to read more from this very talented author. I was generously given a complimentary copy of this book for an honest review.

I really enjoyed this book, not only am I a sucker for a friends to lovers story but this book really grabs you, its fun, funny, and just a real feel good read. The only complaint that I have, and maybe it's just my personal reading preferences getting in the way but they way that the story is told as a present tense, first person, kind of throws off the flow of the book a bit, but I was still able to enjoy it. I think if it weren't for that part this would be a 5 star rather than a four star review. I was really able to connect with Nina being a person that has taken care of my siblings, and her strong family values. If you are looking for a fun, sweet romance then grab a copy of The Nine Month Plan! I was generously provided a complimentary copy of this book for an honest review.

I loved this book from start to finish! I was immediately drawn into the book and read it straight through. There is no way that I was going to be able to put this book down. It is fast paced and flows really well. The author has done an amazing job with literally every aspect of this book, from the characters, the romance and heat, the action and suspense, and along the way we get some pretty funny humor, it really is the total package. This is only the second book about a phoenix that I've read, they seem pretty hard to find and are pretty unique. I really loved Aurelia, she is just one totally kick ass female! Be ready for twists and a surprise that you will never see coming! I totally recommend this book and can't wait to read more from this amazing author. I was generously provided a complimentary copy of this book for an honest review.

This is a very quick read, perfect for a lunch break or just a little book break when you need one. Even though it is a short read it lacks absolutely nothing, though it is a bit fast paced, bordering on rushed, but come on people it's a novella, and I find that to be somewhat expected. This is a twisted telling of Sleeping Beauty and the author has done a tremendous job with it. I like that she added in Hansel and Gretel and a very unique twist. I was given a complimentary copy of this book for an honest review.

This is a fast paced, quick read that has so much to it and leaves you wanting for more. I am a total lover of the paranormal and therefore read a lot of it and this book is definitely up to snuff to be in my favorites list. I was drawn right into the story and read it straight through. The book is packed with action and adventure, suspense, and hot, hot romance. I loved the authors writing and imagination, and vivid descriptions that transport you right into the center of everything so much, and the characters are all so well developed and amazing. I will definitely be seeking out this author's work from now on! I was generously given a complimentary copy of this book for an honest review.

I absolutely adore this book! The author has done a bang up job with the writing of this really unique book! I was drawn into the book and held fast flipping page after page until I found myself at the end! (which was great by the way, no cliffhangers!) I was so entrenched into the story that the outside world just faded away, at the beginning of the book we are given a lot of information to absorb and it is important to pay close attention. The read is fast paced and totally thrilling, full of fantastic magic, and surprises and twists. As we venture into the world of the light and darkness, the It will really keep you glued to the pages. I laughed and teared up and was so totally emotionally invested in Macy, Bastian, and Tolen's journey. I definitely recommend this book if you are a fantasy lover. You really don't want to miss this one I was generously provided a complimentary copy of this book for an honest review.

This book starts you off with a bang, sucks you right in and keeps you held fast turning page after page after page. Right from the prologue we are totally shocked and needing to know what happens next. This read is so amazing, the author has created a wholly intense, emotional, heart palpitating, passionate, and beautiful romance. Not to mention the twists and turns around every corner! Emma and Alexander's story is a rocky one at best but is so definitely worth the read. You are really going to miss out on something tremendously special if you pass on this one. I was totally emotionally invested in this one and absolutely recommend it! I can not wait to read more from this super talented author! I was generously given a complimentary copy of this book for an honest review.

This is my first read by this author so I wasn't sure what exactly to expect, but when I read the blurb, I knew I had to read this book. The author has done a fantastic job with this book. He has a real talent for grabbing you and keeping you turning the pages. His imaginations are exceptional and very unique, and it really shows in the read. I have to admit that I have read very little in the way of ghoul and zombie reads, but this book makes me want to search more out to see if there are more that I am missing out on. I absolutely love Howard and immensely enjoyed his coming of age as a ghoul story. As Howard is a ghoul with a long family history, he is also a teenager and you really get that teen angst along with the humor an everything else in this book. I definitely recommend this book and can't wait to read more from this author. I was given a complimentary copy of this book for an honest review.

"Do you like to watch?"This is a seriously fast paced, scorching read. Definitely not something you want to be reading in public, unless you have super control over your reactions while reading, it's that smoking hot!I loved Celia and Jack and their instant blazing chemistry. I can't wait to see what the author has in store for us next! I was given a complimentary copy of this book for an honest review.

This is an novel written for young adults but as an adult I enjoyed it very much and think that others will too. The author has done a terrific job with novel as a whole, the world she has created is not only very realistic and totally believable, but the way that everything is described, it is also very vivid. The plot was awesome and as a lover of dystopian novels, I read quite a bit of them and this one definitely stands up within the ranks of dystopian fiction. The read itself is fast paced, exciting and engaging. I was drawn in right away and wanted to keep going. There are twists that will leave you reeling, it is definitely a page turner. The characters were also very engaging and had real depth to them, especially the main character Mira. I loved her strength and character and was really able to connect with her. I definitely recommend this book and can't wait to read more from this very talented author. I was given a complimentary copy of this book for an honest review.

This book had me hooked from start to finish. I was immediately drawn into Petty's life. The strangeness and intrigue of it all. The author has done an awesome job with the plot, the characters, and descriptions of everything. I loved getting both Petty and Dekker's POV's getting insight into their thoughts and personalities. I can't even begin to imagine growing up the way that Petty did. The story is layer upon layer of mystery, intrigue and suspense. Add that in with the multiple twists and you have a seriously awesome book, a total page turner that you will be hard pressed to put down. I definitely recommend this book, and can't wait to read more from this talented author. I was generously given a complimentary copy of this book for an honest review.

I absolutely love this series, from the moment that I began book 1, and throughout the series, I was totally hooked. I have just been so captivated by everything, the plot, the characters, the love and laughs. Before I began reading book 1 Calling Me Back I had not had the opportunity to read this author, so I wasn't sure what to expect, I am so glad I was presented the opportunity to read and review this series. I have to say that I totally love the author's writing, her creativity and wit are really terrific. There is a series previous to this one, that I have been meaning to go back and read called the White Lightning Series which, I definitely will be going back to read that series now that I have finished this amazing series. It is my understanding that we will get to know even more about the characters from that one. Each book in the series needs to be read in order and books two and three pick right up where the previous one leaves off. Even the ending, though it is always sad to see a great series end, is just the absolute perfect ending to the series, it is so romantic and heartfelt. I just cannot recommend this series highly enough! The story is just so amazing and I was drawn right in to each and every volume, and read each one straight through, I just could not put them down! I loved the love and laughs, and intense heat and smoldering passion. This series just has everything and though I am sad to see it end, as I said it ended awesomely . I can't wait to read more from this very talented author. I was generously given a complimentary copy of this series for an honest review.

Never having read this author, I wasn't sure what to expect, but with the lure of the paranormal, I had to give it a shot. I am glad that I did. The author has written a story with a great and unique plot, and is also very unique with her verbiage. I really ended up loving this book. I admit that I wasn't sure at first because it was kind of a slow starter in my opinion, but keep going because it gets really good! First let me say that I love the name of the main character Justice, though at times I felt so frustrated with her I wanted to scream. She is definitely not a take charge bad ass heroine, but more a damsel in distress, which is more realistic of how I think most of us would act if we were in her shoes. She has way too many reasons to be distressed though, for certain. I love how the author threw in twist after twist, and am now in agony waiting for the next installment of this series because of the totally epic cliffhanger! I have so many questions! What just happened m? Who can Justice trust? Who is her mystery Vamp? I could go on and on. I can't wait for the next book! I was generously provided a complimentary copy of this book by the author for an honest review.

I loved the premise of this book, I was totally sucked into the story right away and just devoured the book. I absolutely loved the tension, chemistry and heat between Elizabeth and Roman is off the charts. This book is not about blood related cousins, marriage only so though it is a bit taboo, it doesn't cross over into "that" territory. I was so engrossed in the story that I didn't realize that the end was coming until I was smacked in the face with a cliffhanger! Thankfully I have book two and can't wait to dig in! I was given a complimentary copy of this book  for an honest review.

As soon as I read the synopsis for this book I was in, having read books by this author before I had high expectations and I was not disappointed.
