I don't play Borderlands 2 so I can't give you much of an opinion on that

I've been using multivitamins as a hangover prevention tool for years. Water and vitamins before bed. The reason it works is a hangover is caused by dehydration and mild malnutrition (loss of vitamins). Pretty much any multivitamin can help you in this regard. You mainly want alot of the B group vitamins (i.e. vitamin B1-B12, Niacin, Riboflavin, Thiamin, etc).Each packet is one serving (3 pills). I keep a packet in my luggage and overnight bags, so when I travel I have some available.Drinkwel specifically has worked well for me. Recommended usage is 3 pills before drinking and another 3 pills before bed. I only do the 3 pills before bed and that works enough for me. Also taking half the recommended dosage saves money since you don't have to keep buying these as fast. Alcohol is a diuretic and makes you pee, and you'll pee out any extra vitamins. It makes more sense to me to replensih vitamins rather than front load them.If your going to have a few drinks and need to be on your game the next morning. go grab some of these!

I've been using multivitamins as a hangover prevention tool for years. Water and vitamins before bed. The reason it works is a hangover is caused by dehydration and mild malnutrition (loss of vitamins). Pretty much any multivitamin can help you in this regard. You mainly want alot of the B group vitamins (i.e. vitamin B1-B12, Niacin, Riboflavin, Thiamin, etc). These also have stuff in them that supposedly support liver function and reduce toxins. Those things are hard to prove, but if they do that then I count it as a bonus!Drinkwel specifically has worked well for me. Recommended usage is 3 pills before drinking and another 3 pills before bed. I only do the 3 pills before bed and that works enough for me. Also taking half the recommended dosage saves money since you don't have to keep buying these as fast. A bottle is 90 pills, so thats only 30 servings. If you take 3 before and 3 after it only covers you for 15 drinking days rather than 30 drinking days. Alcohol is a diuretic and makes you pee, and you'll pee out any extra vitamins. It makes more sense to me to replenish vitamins rather than front load them.If your going to have a few drinks and need to be on your game the next morning. go grab some of these!

I decided to read this book because I enjoy military biographies and the author described it as a biography of Gen. Howard Peckham. However, this book is not strictly speaking a biography at all. The book is written from the perspective and viewpoint of the author, which often makes her the subject of the book rather than Howard Peckham. The book often digresses from Howard Peckham to relate personal stories of the authors about life growing up in a military family.The authors unnecessary overabundance of similes often made the book hard to read, and the prose just seem forced. For example "at the sight of each needle that stung my arm like a thin metal wasp".The book was okay, but it would have been better served had the author taken on a co-author or editor who was not related to the subject of the book.

Gave these to my girlfriend (along with 2 other earrings) and she loves them. She now wears these more than any other earrings. They are nice enough to be worn for formal occasions but not so dressy that you couldn't wear them everyday. They are lightweight and don't weigh down or irritate her ears. They glisten and sparkle in the light. She has already gotten several compliments on them. And to top it off the price on these is really good!I received this product in exchange for an honest review.

These are white gold plated cubic zirconia earrings with a pearl at the bottom. Its hard to tell from the pictures but these earrings are in a fixed position (stiff rather than a flexible dangle). They are very sparkly and glisten in the light and the shell pearl adds a bit of elegance to the design. These are very pretty and would look great for formal and dressy events. The price makes them great for teens and young adults as well. These do look real, especially in the light.I received this product for the purposes of an honest review

1:45 MinsThis review is on the AV+ S-Video to HDMI converter. You definitely want to make sure you check which product your buying to make sure you don't get the opposite of what your looking for! Product works pretty well. It comes with all the cables you will need. I use this with my HD-DVD player (yes I know I'm one of the few people that bought those....). You don't seem to get the upconvert if you just use the AV cables. I believe you get upconvert if you use the S-Video cable.Pros: If you have an older device that you want to connect to a newer TV (i.e. my old DVD player only has AV and S-Video but my TV doesn't have s-video port just HDMI)Cons:Power cord is shorter than I'd likedevice can get pretty hot

1:48 MinsThis is the 2015 version of the Song of Ice and Fire (Game of Thrones) Calendar. I own the 2013 and 2014 calendars as well is much better than the 2014 one in my opinion. Art is very subjective so I will include a vid to show you exactly what you are getting. SPOILER NOTE: If you have not read through A Dance With Dragons (book 5) some of these titles/descriptions may contain mild spoilersThe pictures depicted are:January - The Night's WatchFebruary - Sam & Gilly on the Cinnamon WindMarch - The Iron Islands (theon?)April - Road to Kings Landing (just a bunch of swords intertwined)May - Mother of Dragons (same as the cover art)June - RiverrunCenterfold - The artists sketchbook. Several rough sketches of charactersJuly - Forging of the Iron throne (Balerion breathing fire, blacksmiths creating throne)August - Little Birds (Varys' spies)September - Battle for the Wall (Stannis)October - House of Black and White (Arya)November - The Kings Hand (Tyrion naked lying with Shae)December - North of the Wall (Direwolf killing a stag)The sketchbook is the highlight for me and was a nice touch for the centerfold. The previous versions of the calendar just repeated a prior months artwork. Mother of Dragons is my favorite artwork in the calendar. I like the subjects depicted in Little birds and forging the iron throne. The lowlights for me are the road to kings landing and the kings hand. Road to kings landing is supposedly depicting many swords intertwined in battle but to me it just seems odd that so many swords could possibly in such a short space in an actual battle (no room to swing!). And I feel a bit weird about having a naked dwarf hanging from my wall. Other than that Donato Giancola did a superb job on the artwork.

1:52 MinsThis is a nice set of 4 ceramic knives and a peeler. They come in a nice holder that adds a bit of a cool design to your kitchen. the knives themselves are of good quality, very lightweight and sharp. Because the holder is made of plastic you want to make sure not to bend the arm that holds the peeler too far because that can break.Pros:-Sharpness: Ceramics are harder and won't need sharpening as often as a steel knife.-No Rust/stains-Lightweight-Not Porous: Won't transfer tastes or odors from one food to another (i.e. onions or spicy foods). Also metal knives can alter the taste of acidic foods like lemons, a ceramic knife is non-reactive and will not alter the taste.-Looks: Unlike your normal wooden block, this plastic holder actually looks nice in your kitchenCons:-Unflexible/Brittle: The hardness of the knife has a catch! Can't use the knife to pry or wedge something. It is not flexible and will break. Can't use on hard cutting surfaces like granite or the knife may chip. You don't want to drop it or it can chip/break. You don't want to use these as a screwdriver!-Can't sharpen on your own: while rarely needing to sharpen is a plus, if you ever do need to sharpen it you will have to find a professional with a diamond wheelOverall its a good set of knives at a decent price. Many sets of ceramic knives sell for a much higher price than this. I received the product for the purpose of this review.

I was pleasantly surprised by how entertaining this book was. I bought the book on pre-order back in April and promptly forgot about it. When it was sent to my Kindle in September I thought these would be serious scientific questions along the lines of what you'd see Neil deGrasse Tyson talk about on the History Channel or something. Instead this book is full of entertaining and absurd questions that are answered in a fairly thorough scientific way. Not only that but the author is a physicist AND cartoonist, so the book is illustrated with stick figure cartoons that are actually both relevant to the science and funny.The book addresses questions such as what happens if everyone on Earth shined a laser pointer at the moon? What would happen if a pitcher threw a fastball at the speed of light? Can you build a jetpack with downward firing machine guns? The book takes the questions in a sort of Mythbusters sort of way (meaning that a plausible explanation is attempted first then an extreme example just because!). Usually each chapter ends with we all die.The book has many humorous quotes and analogies, and can make many scientific scenarios understandable to the average person (non-scientist). "Think of the elements as dangerous, radioactive, short lived Pokemon"I highly recommend for anyone who likes science, humor, the history channel, the show Mythbusters, random what if questions, or for that know-it-all friend (we all have one). This book is a fun read!

The LifeCHARGE InAir case for the Samsung Galaxy S4 is a case that includes a 2nd battery to give your phone that extra charge. Out of the box you get the case, the extra battery, a charging pad for wireless charging, and a micro USB cable. Installing the case requires taking the back of the phone off and removing the factory battery, you then attach the lifecharge battery, and place the original factory batter on top of the lifecharge battery (sounds confusing I know, but there are instructions). Then you attach the rest of the case. My previous cases were all fairly slim, this case is noticably larger and heavier than my previous cases. The product description describes it as "slim" but that's only if your comparing this to an Otterbox. The extra battery is nice and I can now use the phone alot longer before having to charge it up. The volume buttons work well but the power button has to be pressed on the bottom of the button (not the middle). The case leaves ample room to plug in headphones and USB cable (unlike the iphone version apparently)The Charging pad is a nice touch. There are 2 charge points on the back of the case that have to touch the charging pad in order to charge. So yes it is "wireless" as in there are no wires between the phone and the charging pad, but you still have to have it directly on the pad. This is great for me, as I get random texts in the middle of the night and I can grab my phone and place it back on the charger pad without having to fumble for wires in the dark.Pros:--Provides extra battery--Wireless Charging--Sturdy build means good protection for phoneCons:--its noticably heavier than most cases (there is a 2nd battery in there afterall)--Its not as slim as many other cases out there--Glossy case is a fingerprint magnet

The writers aim was to tell the story about how terrible it was to grow up an unwanted orphan in communist Romania, and on the part he succeeded. This is not a happy story. The book describes many horrible things that these children suffered through. The book revolves around Daniel as he grows up (and escapes) an orphange, to life living in the sewers, to ultimately arriving in America. Daniel and his friends (with names like Crazy, One Eye, and Burned because no one gave them real names) try to survive in a world where no one wants them.The book is in sort of a memoirs format and goes off the memories of the author. This sometimes leaves you with unexplained gaps in time as well as incomplete information to help the reader understand whats happening. From a historical context the book briefly explains why there are so many unwanted orphans (President Nicolae Ceauescu made abortion illegal in an attempt to boost the country's population) but very little else about the Ceausescu regime is explained. The Romanian Revolution is briefly witnessed and the 1990 Mineriad is mentioned so fleetingly you don't really understand why random miners are beating people to death in the street.The painful part of this read was that it badly needs an editor. The book is full of broken english and misspelled words. Many times I had to re-read a sentence just to understand what the author was trying to say.Overall it was an interesting and often heartbreaking story about a time and a place that few people in America hear or read about. I received a copy of this book for the purposes of this review. The author told me that all money earned from sales of this book will go to "MyAmericanKids,com" and will help immigrant children.

These weightlifting wrist wraps work pretty well for me. They are comfortable. The fabric seems very quality and durable. The can stretch a little at the ends. There is a thumb loop to help you put them on, but I find it easy enough to put on without the help of the thumb loop. Some other wrist wraps I've used tend to fray at the edges but these seem pretty well made and I haven't experienced any fraying. Overall its a pretty good product at a decent price

These are good stainless steel measuring spoons. The set comes with 6 spoons a 20ml, a 10ml, 5ml, 2.5ml, 1.25ml, and 0.6ml. The steel is sturdy and doesnt bend. The measurements are engraved into the steel and not painted on. One thing to keep in mind is the tablespoon and half tablespoon (20ml and 10ml) seem to be Australian tablespoons and not US or Uk measurements (US TBSP = 15ml). So if you get these keep that in mind and adjust accordingly. The teaspoon measurements match typical teaspoons.One thing I like about these is it comes with a 1/8 tsp. Most sets I've bought in the past only come in set of 5 and don't go as small as 1/8th tsp.

1:45 MinsThis review is on the AV+ S-Video to HDMI converter. You definitely want to make sure you check which product your buying to make sure you don't get the opposite of what your looking for! Product works pretty well. It comes with all the cables you will need. I use this with my HD-DVD player (yes I know I'm one of the few people that bought those....). You don't seem to get the upconvert if you just use the AV cables. I believe you get upconvert if you use the S-Video cable.Pros: If you have an older device that you want to connect to a newer TV (i.e. my old DVD player only has AV and S-Video but my TV doesn't have s-video port just HDMI)Cons:Power cord is shorter than I'd likedevice can get pretty hot

This was a great read on the Nintendo-Sega battle in the late 80s-90s. Growing up in the 80s I was firmly in the Nintendo camp. I had a NES, SNES, N64. While my friends had Sega, Saturn and Dreamcast. We spent hours arguing which was better. This book relives those moments for me, except this book paints Nintendo has the villain!This story primarily follows Tom Kalinske as he leaves the toy world (CEO of Mattel and Matchbox) for the world of gaming as CEO of Sega of America. At the time of his arrival at Sega, SoA is a big underdog to Nintendo and hasn't yet come up with their answer to Mario (sonic the Hedgehog). Throughout the book, Nintendo is the bully. They bully retailers and game makers. Sega put themselves out there as the "anti-Nintendo".The best part of the book is the "inside info", the anecdotes around the 2 companies. The origin of the "SEGA Scream" at the end of their commercials, the Sony-Nintendo partnership that never happened for a CD based console, etc.The only downside to the book and to me it was very minor, was the flow of the story. You start off from Segas point of view put every so often the story goes back in time and from Nintendos point of view. I understand the need to develop back story but sometimes it just felt disjointed jumping back and forth. I'd knock off a half a star for that (still rounds up to 5 stars).This was a really good read. I'd recommend for anyone who grew up in the 80s and 90s, or for anyone who likes to read about business.

These are fun for my three-year-old and my nine-month-old! The nice thing is there are two of them, so there's no fighting. When it was just my nine-month-old, they worked as intended. He would crawl to one as it played music and lit up, and then the other one would start when he touched the first one, so he would crawl to the other. He played with these for hours! They are stimulating and promote physical activity which is a win in my book!
This stuff helped my little guy with his cold. It works well.
I have a teething baby, and this is a miracle product. I wipe it on his gums, and he settles down. He likes the flavor too!

I don't really have anything to compare this to since this is the first machine (of this type) that I have owned. I tried cutting vinyl in it, and it worked well. However, it is limited to a small area, so I can see why others would prefer another machine.

This is a really pretty ring The cubic zirconias sparkle brightly, and it almost looks like it could be expensive! To give you an idea of size, it is thin enough to stack nicely with other rings. The only thing I really do not like about it is that I think they should have put one more stone on each side, so that it covers your finger better.

Wow! I just loved this book. Charbonneau's first trilogy was amazing, and we had the opportunity to hear her speak at our school last year, so I was eager to read this one.In this book, high school kids join a social media site and ask for things they feel they "need". In return, they are asked to complete tasks. The valuable lesson they learn is that not all wants are needs, and you can't get something for nothing in return. Additionally, the attempt to get whatever one wants can often hurt others.As a reading specialist and interventionist, I was excited to read this book because it really has amazing potential for being taught in the classroom. It's a fun and exciting read and something to which kids can connect. Since I teach reluctant readers, this is just what we need.The only disappointing thing about the book is the ending. I'm still trying to decide if it was actually believable. However it is open-ended enough that I think Charbonneau could turn this into a series.

I love this busy book! It's soft, so it is great for the car, and it has all kinds of stimulants to help baby's development. There is a mirror, music and crinkly toy. It also squeaks! My little guy loves it!

This stuff is awesome. We don't have margaritas too often, so just a small can is nice because we don't waste anything. Additionally, this mix is good! And my husband was a bartender for a Mexican restaurant for three years, so we know good and bad margaritas! If you are looking for something to occasionally make a drink, this is great for you!

These are simply the best dish cloths I have ever used. They are thick and super absorbent. This means they clean up spills quickly, and don't drip water everywhere while you are trying to scrub up messes. Additionally, they wipe up even dried on gunk easily and quickly. I can't recommend them highly enough.

This light is easy to install, but only if you have something called a landscape cord. I had no idea what that was and was unaware that this was needed for this product until my husband told me we had one in our yard. Apparently this is an electrical cord that is plugged into your house and then runs out into the yard wherever you need lighting. This product has clamps with metal prongs that plug into the wire, and send a current into the light. The light itself installs by pushing a stake into the ground. It's not extremely bright, but if you were to install several of these, I think it would server its purpose.

Step back other stick vacs! This one takes the prize home! I love the fact that it plugs in. No more remembering to plug in a vacuum (and who has a plug in the closet anyway?). It also can be used three ways- as a hand vac, a hard floor vac or a carpet vac. The pole comes off for use as a hand vac which makes it convenient for small messes or curtains (although I still prefer my dust buster for the first). My favorite is the hard floor attachment which had a microfiber! This is the best thing since a swiffer vac, which I hated because it couldn't hold, a charge, but loved because it had the cloth and the vacuum. This vacuum simply gets every spec of dirt and dog hair on my hard floors. Finally, it had a power brush attachment for your carpet. I probably would only use this for touch up, but I definitely would use it for stairs.The absolute only con I have to this is that it is top heavy! You can't just stand it up, but Bissell added a wall mount, so it can easily be hung on the wall when not in use. A great little vacuum!

If LeapPad blew you away, this one is spectacular. It has all of the great features of a LeapPad, but get this, it runs android apps from the Amazon store. On top of that, it has safe browsing for kids. As a parent, what more could I ask for? I absolutely love it!
These microfiber dish towels are great. They absorb everything, and I was able to dry an entire load of dishes without changing towels. I love them!

So, this is healthy and convenient. However, it tastes powdery and horrible after you mix water into it. My little guy who will eat anything wouldn't eat it and cried when I tried to feed it to him. I would rather just buy regular baby food.

This thing definitely works, but not in a crib. It just gets pushed around in there. However, my one child still has accidents, so I will put it underneath him on the couch, and it absorbs everything and keeps my sofa clean.
These dishcloths are nice and thick. They absorb water well and also ring out pretty dry, so they will not be smelly on your sink.
This is a pretty shower curtain with a purple chevron, ombre effect. It seems to be well-made and the loops are reinforced well.
I didn't have any issues with an orange tone using this lotion. However, it was streaky. I had high hopes that this self-tanner would not streak, but I have yet to find one that does not.

I am not super impressed with this rug, and I definitely would not buy it. First, there is no grip to the bottom of the rug, so it slides all over. This is actually hazardous because I slipped on the rug and fell down. Additionally, some of the popcorn has already pulled out and there is a line of holes in my rug, so it's not real well made. It's also pretty rough textured, so I'm not extremely enthused about that either. The good thing is it is relatively absorbent, so it will soak up any spills or drips. Beware that if you do buy this, this size is very small.

I got this scooter for my son, and I'm pretty impressed. It's lightweight enough to lift with one hand, but still feels like it is good quality. The folding feature is awesome because I can fold it and throw it behind the seat in our van and still have space for other items. Another really great feature is the adjustable handlebars. My three year-old can use the scooter now, but it will also fit him when he's eight, so I like that! Besides those features, the scooter just glides super smoothly. We really recommend it!
They are okay. I didn't notice a jolt of energy like I do with my energy drinks.

This box contains fifty packets of hot chocolate with mini marshmallows included. You add it to hot water and stir and drink. I personally do not think it tastes great that way probably because I grew up on my mom's from scratch hot chocolate. However, I added it to hot milk, and then it was amazing! Very rich and tasty.
These are Barbie sized dolls. The legs don't bend, but they do rotate They look exactly like the characters in the show. My daughter loves them!
This is the weirdest dog food I have ever seen. It is like a green powder. My dog wouldn't eat it. The reason I gave it three stars was because it is all healthy ingredients.
This is the weirdest dog food I have ever seen. It is like a green powder. My dog wouldn't eat it. The reason I gave it three stars was because it is all healthy ingredients.
This product made my hair look so healthy. It was soft and shiny after I used it.
This product is super moisturizing. I love that I can spray it on as it is much quicker than typical lotion.

I really liked this soap. First of all, the smell isn't overly manly, so even though it is in the shower for my husband, I can use it in a pinch. Second of all, it is not at al drying, but it still lathers up nicely.
This fun doll is meant for styling. My daughter spent hours creating fun hair styles with the included accessories. There is even a play blow dryer!

My seven-month old is in the the throes of teething, and as a result, he is very much restless and cranky. I gave him these tablets several times (you can give them up to four times a day), and I noticed the crankiness diminished after about fifteen to twenty minutes. These have been a godsend for each of my kids.

I have all the PathPix puzzles, and, even though I'm only  few puzzles into the game, I can already tell this is  favorite among many games from multiple genres.I imagine that the size of each puzzle is the reason for the "experts" description. But, at least for me,  it's not any harder than any of the other PathPix puzzles.  As far as the size of the puzzles in this game,  many are 100+ X 100+.  I generally play these on one of my 7" Kindles and with these puzzles, I'm filling in about 5-7 screens down and about 10-15 screens across.  But, it's because of the large scale of each puzzle that makes the end result look absolutely amazing.If you enjoy any of the games/puzzles by this developer, you will definitely enjoy this latest installment.  Unless you have several hours a day to spare it'll take at least a couple of days per puzzle.  Add that and number of puzzles in this game (around 100 if I remember right), this one is going to take quite a lot of time to finish.

We needed to place magnetic safety locks around our house, and, because the place is rented, these "self-adhesive" ones seemed perfect.First it was very hard to place each side evenly enough that the lock would finally lock in place.But, even when that was finally accomplished, we found that you don't need the magnet to unlock these things.A hard enough tug opens every one (which pretty much defeats the purpose altogether.

I purchased this dress in two sizes (3T and 4T) for girls that are in between sizes 2-3 and 3-4 respectively.They both fit fine, but were each a little too short for my taste.  They seem to fit more like extra long shirts instead of dresses.They do seem well made and should last them for as long as they fit, and for any hand-me-downs later on.

This has been my third purchase of this brand and model headphones in the past 5 years.  Repurchases have only been needed because my dog keeps chewing up the cords, and not because of any break down of the product at all.  These are wonderful headphones for my needs.  They have a nice sound quality to them, and most importantly for me, they fit very nicely over my ears (with or without wearing my eyeglasses).

I purchased three different "Creative Haven" books to start out my new hobby of coloring these "adult designs coloring books".  I was really impressed with the first two, but not so much with this one.  Don't get me wrong, I do like the designs. and like the other two, there was a nice variety in the complexity of the designs (from beginning adult designs to more complex and detailed harder designs).  However, I thought the quality of this book was no where near what the other two were.  The lines in the designs were thicker and seemed to be a little blurred to the point where they looked more like bad photo copies from a copier as opposed to the high quality printer look that the other two had.

This is the 2nd of 3 "Creative Haven" coloring books I've purchased (not to mention those 3 are also the first "adult coloring books" I've purchased and tried.  My favorite of the 3 was also a "tessellation" pattern book (the 3-D one, you can see my review of that on the product page).Both of the Tessellation Pattern books have a very nice variety of designs.  Some being easy/simple designs for the beginner, while still being "complicated" enough that you didn't feel like those easy one's were designed for children.  Others being either a medium or more harder complicated designs.  None were too hard, either, where you felt you just couldn't do them.  The "harder" ones were just more detailed and complex in the pattern(s).  Some even had a kind of optical illusion effect to the design (most of those were in the more detailed designs, but not all).The only reason why I would choose the other one as a "favorite" over this one, is just for the 3-D instructions provided. Other that that, I really think the two different Tessellation Patterns, (both from Creative Haven), are of equal value in design, and fun in coloring.

I just started getting into using the "adult coloring books" (as a way to kill time while sick in bed with a chronic illness).  For my first attempt, I purchased three different "Creative Haven" books, and this was most definitely my favorite of the three.  I h ave enjoyed this purchase, not only for the wonderfully fun and intricate pattern designs, but also for the "3-D" aspect of the book.Upon first opening the book, you are shown on the inside cover a quick and easy to understand way of how to color the designs so they show up as 3-D when viewing them with the free and included 3-D glasses.  It explains which colors will "pop out" and which ones tend to stay in the background.  Pay attention to that, because I've found that when viewing your picture while still in progress, it will not always seem to follow those "rules".  But, when finished, your picture will seem to correct and show up the say it should when using their color guide.Not only is there an instruction for your 3-D coloring inside the front cover, but on the back inside cover is a small color guide which shows (when viewed with the glasses) which colors pop-out or stay in the back ground. I've also found, though, that not all shades of a particular color will follow the rules or color guide, even on the finished product.  For example, as the rules state, "warm colors will "pop" more that cool colors".  But, when using either a warm or cool type color, if using a darker shade as compared to a pastel shade, they will behave differently.  What I've done with each of my different color modes (using gel pens, markers, or colored pencils) is to set up an example page for each one so I can see how each color reacts when viewed with the glasses.  As I've previously stated though, that does not always work, as for example, while one color will appear to pop-out on the example page, when viewing that color in a finished picture, it may appear to stay in the background (this is not always the case though).As the book suggests, you just need to experiment with each color and each color mode to see what works and what doesn't.

Given the high ratings on this product, I expected something much better than what I received.I've just started getting into using the "adult coloring books" to help pass the time when I'm sick in bed with my chronic illness (check some of my other product reviews to see the type of coloring book(s) I'm talking about).When I started using them, I discovered that the ink does not last long (a few pens running out of ink with just one picture, two at the most).Not only that, most of the pens did not color smoothly.  There were a lot of skipping, so I had to go back in every section to fill in the skips/blanks left by the pen in the picture/drawing.The color variety was nice and I got what was described in the product description. But that does not make up for the poor quality of the pens.  However, the different colors and styles were all mixed up and I had to first use the pens on a "sample" page to discover which pens were metal, neon, pastel, or normal (the glitter ones where obviouse from the "glitter" appearance on the pen cover).

I am very happy with this product.There is a nice variety of colors.  Most importantly, for me, is that they not only color smoothly, but the lead does not break either inside the pencil, or when sharpening.  Also, when sharpening, using the sharpener that comes with this set, it removes the wood from the pencil, and hardly any of the lead (most of the time removing close to none of the lead, while still leaving a sharp point).I've just started using some of the "adult complex design" coloring books and purchased these pencils for that purpose.  When using those, and comparing using these colored pencils, markers, or gel pens, I prefer using these pencils for that purpose.My daughter, who is an up and coming professional artist, was jealous when seeing the set, and immediately put in a request for me to order one for herself.

I purchased this software for my daughter to go with a new drawing tablet I purchased for her.I really wanted to get her one of the SketchBook software, since they make my favorite drawing app for my Kindle Fire tablets.  However, I'm glad I did my research before deciding on my purchase, because, right now her favorite drawing style is more anime than anything else.  So, in the end, since this was for her, it didn't matter what my favorite drawing app is. This is what fits for her style.So far she is really enjoying this software program.  She's still working her way through learning about all the different features available.  But, she is liking all the different brush styles and color choice options.  Another favorite part is the layer option/function.  Being able to test something out on her drawing using a layer is perfect since, if she doesn't like how her drawing looks with it, she can easily delete it without ruining the whole picture.  She also likes that it includes some templates, allowing her to get her drawing up and running a little faster.I will add more to my review as she works more with it and learns a bit more about all the functions and options available to her.

Ok, yes one star is earned and deserved for providing an app without any of the usual problematic and questionable permissions. So in that aspect it shows the developers of this app has good ethics and business practices. However, when every 5 star review to date are obvious fakes (in each instance either this is the one and only review by this person, or the only other reviews are for just this one developer/company), you have to wonder if the good business practices continue. I will give them the benefit of the doubt though. It does seem those reviews are less like sock puppet accounts, which is usually the case in these instances, and more like friends of the dev trying to do a favor. I say this because there are a few apps by this dev that have no reviews at all. In total, pay attention to the other reviews: poor English, very small range in topics/tv shows for this type of game, etc.

I did enjoy this game enough, but don't be fooled in thinking it's a top of the game list like most of Alawar games are. It does have a lower price than what Alawar usually charges. One thing I found most annoying was there was a lot of going back and forth from the first scene to the last. Usually Alawar breaks the game into section so you only go back and forth between a few scenes at a time. Several time you find an object, go back 10 scenes to place it then have to go back through those same 10 scenes to get the next object which again has to be placed 10 scenes away. The ho scenes and puzzles weren't as challenging as usual either. The graphic seemed a little more cartoonish than the usual high quality computer graphics. In all it was OK for the lower price, but with the lower price you aren't getting the higher quality that Alawar is known for.

After the low quality games being put out by the top developers of the point-click adventure games it's nice when atop game like this comes along. If you enjoyed the first Weird Park game and/or Stray Souls, both from Alawar, you will definitely enjoy this one. The game is long, and with each section only having 3-5 scenes you don't have a lot of the going back and forth between scenes that are too far away. Everything you come to expect from Alawar is here. Nice graphics, fun ho scenes (each one played twice and includes one object where you have to do something to find it first), fun challenging puzzles with a skip if needed, and an enjoyable storyline. This is truly a five star game, but I deducted one star because three times it froze on me and then the game would exit and do the whole extra download stuff again. I have a decent enough device (kindle fire hd 2012 model) and fast enough wireless that it only took about 5 minutes each time. Thankfully upon returning to the game my place would be saved. This only really happened in the first one or two sections. But after that I then had many times when the next scene would show up black (with the exception of the pause, hint and inventory/journal buttons) and seem to freeze again. After anywhere from 30 seconds to 1 or 2 minutes the  game would pop back up for play. I am going to uninstall and reload the game. If the above does not repeat I will consider it a rare glitch and change my rating to 5 stars.

While I normally enjoy the games from this genre, it seems that lately the new releases from all the top three developers have issued games that almost play themselves with the players just pushing the buttons along the way. This one falls into that category. You have a similar storyline to the first game from this series. You are trying to undo a curse from Davey Jones while also collecting coins for the talking chest who is telling the backstory as you do so. All the usual ho scenes, puzzles, game modes, help/skip buttons that you come to expect from G5 Games is included. For now the game price is set at $2.99, but it looks like that will only be for the first week. I got it mainly because it is nice to have a few easy games from this genre on my kindle for the younger kids who enjoy having an "aunt Cathy" type game they can play on their own. If you want a game with any kind of challenge I would suggest you wait for possibly the next one, especially after the price goes up.

There are many disagreements as to whether this genre should include ho scenes or not. I'm not going to get into that, but be warned that this game has more than the average ho scenes than the norm. I enjoy it when they are included so I did enjoy this game enough. However, the graphics weren't up to par for Big Fish, more cartoonish than anything. There are only two game modes to play instead of the usual three, but that didn't lessen the game at all. Some reviews have mentioned the lack of a help button outside of the ho scenes. But 1)I found the game almost plays itself and 2) there is a strategy guide included if you look in the bonus section. As with most Big Fish games there is a small bonus chapter at the end.

I've been searching the Amazon ebook store all morning for books to read to/with the kids on Christmas Eve before present time. This one was free so despite it having no reviews I took the chance hoping it would work.  I'm glad I did because this will surely entertain them all, young and old. Each page (can't remember how many but there are a lot) has a darling little picture, like the cover of the book, and a cute poem of 4-6 lines. Subjects of the poems range from the tree, decorations, snow, presents, to even the table settings waiting for Christmas dinner. The author of this children's book did an excellent job.

This was a cute book about a little kid helping his family get the house ready for Santa. As you read this to the little ones you can add tasks like how many Santas can you see,  where is the cookie, etc. Yes, as some reviews say, the story is simple, but it is obvious the target audience is the very young toddler. I look forward to reading this to the kids on Christmas Eve.

I started using breathing relaxation techniques about 15 years ago to help with chronic pain. Suffering some depression as a result of the chronic illness my doctor sent me to a therapist who helped and taught me varying degrees of breath relaxation exercises. During one of our first sessions she made me a tape to assist me in doing the exercises at home. It helped to the point that I no longer have depression and when I have a painful attack from my illness I don't require as much medication (please don't take this as advice to use this and stopping any meds because of success from relaxation-you should NEVER stop medication without the advice of your personal doctor). Not only does relaxation exercises help me, but as a toddler we started helping my niece with her "breathing exercises" to calm down when she was throwing temper tantrums, and later for bad headaches and panic attacks. While we are both sufficient enough with these exercises that we no longer need assistance, this app is nice to have for the background noise and being able to adjust the voice and background separately we can add or delete either one depending on our desire at the time. I only gave 4 instead of 5 because there are only the four choices of background noises and there are times that the voice sounds slurred or just hard to understand. I would like to see either/or more background noise options and/or the option to use music from my own playlist. I already have a nice selection of music I use for this exact purpose. But, in all for a FAOTD this is not a bad selection, so get it while it's free.

*UPDATE #2* here is part of the e-mail I received back from Big Fish with a response about the glitch: "After doing some research into this game, I see that you're right, as we're definitely seeing many other reports of this error. Hopefully we can get an updated version of the game soon to fix this, since we certainly don't want more players to run into this"*UPDATE* I sent an e-mail to Big Fish on the first night that I tried playong this game and told them of the problem. Only today, Dec 10, did I finally receive a response. Basically it says they have received a high volume of complaints and have not had a chance to look onto my problem yet then included a bunch of common troubleshooting suggestions to try. I did send a reply back that this is obviously a coding error since it seems to be a problem for all. I will update more as when I receive any other responses back.This IS a point-click game with a whole lot more HO scenes than is usual for the genre. You need to collect mirrors in those ho scenes for hints, but so far I have not needed any as there is no click penalties. The few mini-games so far (basically these are just to open doors) provide no challenge. The HUGE problem I have is that playing on a kindle HD7 I have been kicked out of the game at three separate spots and on return get the message of "a corrupt file with this profile has caused a reset of all game settings" (this includes losing all game progress) not sure what is going on with that but I'm tired of having to restart the game over and over. I do at least I know there is some replay value since the ho scenes have different lists/objects to find each time (with the exception of the second play of each scene-you play once with a list and a second time to look for theme items i.e. find all the kings or rings etc). I am going to try the whole un-re-install thing to see if that makes a difference. If that helps I will update my review...that seems to be a theme in almost every review for this game so far.

If you enjoy any of the monogram puzzles (like previous FAOTD Crossme or the other popular one called FlipPix) or if you also enjoy playing minefield you might like this one. Basically you are given a picture broken up into hexagons. The colors shown on each one represents the colors of each hexagon that surrounds it. So, for example, if all the dots are the same color then every hexagon that touches it will be that one color. Or if you have a hexagon and you can see that all the surrounding ones only have the color red in common then you know that is the color for it. There is a tutorial included in the options section. After going through that, as long as you remember the colored  dots represent the surrounding hexagons and NOT the hexagon it is on then it's not too hard.I am taking a star of because at times it either too hard to tell what ones you already have colored and/or once you have one colored it is hard to tell what color the dots are on that hexagon to know what the surrounding ones should be.

this was played on a kindle hd 7. I played each scene once to determine the playability for the different ages of kids who would be playing this game. the first time through there didn't seem to be any problems. that all changed when I re-entered the game. first off the option setting were sent back to the default. I turned the music and the timer back OFF. even with the timer off the games were being timed and the scene would end after 60 seconds. then on several scenes on replay had items in the column that shows what you are supposed to find double imposed. when there are two pictures on top of each other how is the child supposed to know which one to find (only one was valid in each instance). when the 6 year old was playing he was trying to get the "achievement award" of finding every object in each scene (takes about 5 replays in most scenes). but there was one scene he played at least 20 times at still had one object that had yet to appear for him as an option to find. add these glitches to the unethical practice of the owner leaving not only a 5 star rating for himself, but another 4 star fake review from a sock puppet account (when you sign out your reviews the same way it is only too obvious) and it equals 1 star.

I'm actually quite disappointed in alawar with this one. It's a good enough game to like, but the shorter length and glitches make it not as fun. let me start by telling how to place inventory items. as other reviewers have said, they are hard to place, unless you know the secret. I figured out that what you need to do is use your stylus/finger as a guide. to place items you need to put your stylus/finger where you want them to go and ignore the item itself, since it is quite a ways off point. follow this rule and you shouldn't have any problems playing. another big problem for me was the sound. I like to double task while playing (like also watch tv or something) so I usually turn any music off. yes, there is an option to turn down either the music or the sound effects, anytime a new scene is loaded the sound reverts back to the default levels. which means I either put up with the music and louder sound effects or play with my devices sound off, which makes it hard to hear any notifications from any other apps. there is only one mode of play on this game, unusual for a game from alawar. there are quite a bit of HO scenes (each one is used twice), with a few not so challenging puzzles thrown in between. I usually like replaying games a couple of time at least before I place a game into my rotation of games to play/replay. but, once you know what to do, and since there is nothing different to find in the HO scenes, it wasn't as fun as replays usually are and I sailed through it in less than an hour. there is a hint button you can use in the HO scenes or to tell you where to go if you get stuck, but a few times it would tell me to go to areas that were complete, so not always so helpful. another weird thing that is helpful to know is when there are cut scenes there are two choices of either "skip" or "continue". when a set of cut scenes are finished, however, the "continue" button is turned off and to continue playing the game you have to click on "skip" even thought there is nothing else to skip. in all, for $2.99 this isn't a bad game, but it is not up to par for an alawar game. it's easy enough I'll probably keep it for my younger niece who like to play "aunt cat's" games.

when I checked for new games yesterday the only version of this game that showed on my device was the one where you pay up front. when I noticed the 1 star rating for "not compatible with Kindle hd" I wanted to 1)note that at least with the pay up front version I bought I had no trouble playing on my kindle hd. 2)give the demo first version a copy of my review:as copied from the same game: I'll start out with WOW!!! This game is definitely one of those games that gives Big Fish it's fine reputation. you can't beat the price for the quality and length of this one. I have to say this is the longest game of this genre that I've played (and I have just about all from the top 3 makers of the genre for android devices-the other two of course being g5 and alawar). the length alone would be enough to justify the price, which is rather low for how long it is. there are 3 modes of difficulty: 1)casual-described as "designed to provide relaxing and easy play. hint and skip buttons charge more quickly", 2) advanced-"for experienced players", with hints and wait times for the skip buttons take longer to recharge, and "most other hints are unavailable", then there is 3)expert-no hint, skip or other aids "not recommended for new players". you are provided with a journal which, as usual, will keep your progress, make notes for puzzles as needed, provides a map, and keeps all the photo's that you take from the in-game camera. the camera is provided because as part of the premise you need to take pictures at certain places (the camera will flash to let you know where/when) to "see" what that area looked like in the past. the main premise is that you are told of an inheritance you just earned of an island and all buildings that occupy it. upon arrival to the island you learn of ghosts and a poltergeist that haunt the island. you have to solve the mystery of why they are haunting the island and put them all to rest. there are a lot of mysteries to solve. just when you think you are done then another one pops up. each chapter/mystery takes hours of game play and if I remember right there are about 4 in total. the graphics were great and up to par for Big Fish. I played on a Kindle hd and the one and only problem I had was that moving back to the previous screen was not always easy. it seemed there was only one very small exact spot that you had to hit, and it was in a different spot for each screen. one thing to take note for game play is that most of the time to place/use an item you only need to click it in the inventory then click where you want to use it. but, there are times where you do have physically move it from the inventory to where you want to place/use it. if you get stuck, if you are playing in casual mode at least, the hint button will tell you where you need to go and what needs to be done. if you are playing in the other two modes there is also a strategy guide included in the main menu. I also want to thank Big Fish for only placing one "will you rate this game" message. I think it pops up at the end (or close to) of the 1rst chapter. on that same note I thank them for just asking for a rating and not telling me to rate with 5 stars (even though it clearly is worth all those 5 stars)in total, this is one that I very highly recommend and it is without a doubt one of the higher up of the top games to play. YOU WILL ENJOY!!!

I think it pops up at the end (or close to) of the 1rst chapter. on that same note I thank them for just asking for a rating and not telling me to rate with 5 stars (even though it clearly is worth all those 5 stars)in total, this is one that I very highly recommend and it is without a doubt one of the higher up of the top games to play. YOU WILL ENJOY!!!

this may not have Alawars usual 5 star rating that we've all come to expect from this company(at least for how I rated this), but it is a fun game nonetheless and gets 4 stars from me. it is a little shorter from their norm (although not by too much), but since most of their other games have a higher price than what I paid for this one I can't really complain.To start out you get to choose from 2 different playing modes: 1)Casual-hints take a shorter time to recharge, interactive areas sparkle*, and there is no penalty for tapping, and 2)Expert-hints take longer to recharge, no sparkles to mark important areas, and penalties for random tapping. I have only played this once (in casual mode) so I can't really tell you by experience how big/little the differences really are. *as for the sparkles when it comes to indicate interactive areas, all they really mark is the ho scenes and nothing more.there is a nice combination of finding objects randomly through the game, ho scenes to collect other objects, and puzzles (made to open things like chests, gain access to other areas, etc). there is a journal that you can easily access that keeps notes of your progress, which is great when you come to things like safes and locks and you need the combo that you were given earlier in the game, but forgot it. the journal also includes a map, although I did not really need it I'm sure it would be useful if you got lost. a hint button is included in the game which you can use either during normal game play and you need to know where to go next or what to do, or you can use it in a ho scene and need help to find an object. it is easy when you need to use an object from your inventory. this is one of those games where you just click on the object and a circle will appear on the screen where an object is needed. just click on the circle and if it is the correct object for that circle it will be used. if not you get a quick little note saying so and you just play on.the premise of the game is that you are "red riding hood", really just a random girl who wears a red jacket with a hood. there is a serial killer around town who is killing couples and plays each "killing game" based on a fairy tale. he has kidnapped your boyfriend and is leaving you notes and puzzles to play promising that if you solve to whole game in time you will find your boyfriend alive.

Don't bother yourself with this game since the devs didn't seem to bother themselves with it. There are several sentences in the games intro that make no grammatical sense. Misspellings are made throughout (strange is spelled "starnge").  Then right when you are almost, but not quite finished with one of the many most unchallenging puzzles in the genre you get told "to be continued"and the game ends. I really want my money and wasted time back.

I played on a kindle fire hd and trying to tap anything on the main menu is a joke. It takes several taps before the game will finally register it. But, once I was in the game everything played ok.  There are two game modes: 1)casual, which gives you more help along the way and highlights important areas, and 2)advance, which is supposed to have more details in the dialogue since there is no other help while playing (I have only played in the casual mode so far so I'm not sure as to the differences). There is a journal in the game that keeps your progress, but, that is just about all it does. The only help it provided for me was the note it made as to which buttons were needed on the idol statue. There is a map provided, but since for the majority of the game each section is limited to only one or two rooms the map isn't necessarily needed. There are several puzzles throughout the game, but the instructions aren't always clear and I had at least one where the game didn't recognize any taps. But, there is a skip button for such occasions. On the main menu there is a button for a "bonus" which you apparently can only get if you sign up for their newsletters. There is also a button for "extras" which looks like it is all the puzzles from the game, but, even after I played the entire game they are all locked up. I know there are plenty of players in this genre who have their preferences as to whether HO scenes should/shouldn't be included. As for this one there are NOT any ho scenes.I'd go ahead and recommend this game as one that is just an average ok game to play, but it is a far cry from one of the top games to play. Big Fish can and has done much, much better and when the send out a game of this caliber you sometimes have to wonder who is making the big decisions. I will give them kudos since I was only asked once to "would you like to review this game?"  I like that so much more than the current trend of "please give us a five star review" every ten minutes

For the price I would have expected this game to be a bit longer, or at the very least have some kind of a bonus. But, none of the above was included. This game is basically puzzles and tasks. There are three levels to choose from and you play with a game journal that shows your tasks and gives any necessary hints. There is a hint button that changes to a skip button for the puzzles if needed. This game does not include any ho scenes so those who prefer this genre without the ho scenes will enjoy this one. This game was on the short end as far as game time goes, and as I mentioned earlier there is no bonus chapters or anything else to do once the game is done so definitely play a bit with the demo to decide if you think it's worth the price.One thing that is worth mentioning to the devs is after every chapter the game nags you for a FIVE STAR review. For one thing I, like most players, prefer to wait till I am finished with a game before reviewing it. Also, I don't mind being asked once to review a game. But, it gets really annoying and tedious to be asked over and over and it's even worse (not to mention unethical) to be told the rating to put in my review. I always deduct a star when faced with this unethical practice, hence the reason for only three stars for this four star game.

I've already tried to play a few different boards and on each one there seems to be at least one tile that is available to play, but for some reason the game won't let me play that particular tile. Even when that tile and its pair is the only playable move and the hint shows I can play that tile the game won't let it be played. That makes the entire game useless. Uninstalling.

I was disappointed with this one. It was ok, but not as intuitive as the first two. It was fun to discover how the whole "mysterious fog" from the series got started. It was enjoyable to play, just not as fun as the first two. You do get the helpful journal which lists the tasks to do, notes for puzzles, and a map that will show where you are and if you're playing in normal mode will also show areas that has something that needs to be done. There is the helpful hint button that will also show you where to go if you get lost, are not sure what to do next, or shows you items in the ho scenes. For the puzzles, as is usual in alawar games, there is a skip button for those who need it.In total I would only recommend this one to those who have already played the first two and are interested in the storyline. I strongly recommend the first two, though, so if you get those you'll probably end up getting this one anyway. I had no problems downloading or playing on the kindle fire hd

Just one of the "free" games where you have to spend real money for crystals, energy, and stuff like that. You also get the constant nags for Facebook posts which only ends up spamming your friends, and all just for more crystals and energy. Passing and uninstalling.

This was a good enough game for the price. it is a mix of ho/point-click adventure, but there were a lot more ho scenes per puzzle then what I usually get. I didn't have any problems playing on a kindle hd. there isn't the usual help guide provided, but it isn't really needed since once you finish a room there is usually no need to backtrack. (closer to the end you do, but only to enter a newly open area of that scene). Other's have mentioned that without the help it might be hard for beginners. I thought that the lack of backtracking would make is easier for beginners. you only play each ho scene once, and you usually have everything you need for puzzles (if not then they are almost always in the same room or very close by).  there is a skip button on for the puzzles (which I did not need to use once), and a hint button is available in the ho scenes. everything else you need to interact with is identified with a sparkle. it wasn't hard for me to see those, but it might be if you are using a phone instead of a tablet. it was shorter than some, but not too bad (I think another thing that beginners would like also).I would recommend this to those who do enjoy the genre (beginners or not). but if you don't like the ho part of these games (some reviewers state they only like the ones without ho scenes) then you might want to pass.

First off this is not a point-click game adventure as others have described. It is a very basic, very simple room escape game.  If you are familiar with either genre you know there is a distinct difference between the two. It's supposed to have a "walking dead" graphic novel feel but falls short. I completed the game in 10 minutes. Anyone claiming to be willing to pay for a second chapter for a 10 minute game is either an associate of the devs or has money to burn. Uninstalling and recommending a pass on this FAOTD.

I had a hard time downloading this game just as others have stated. it requires a little over 911mb more. when it first started downloading the countdown timer said 1:34 (hrs/mins). however, when this was done it started not once, but twice. so in total it took somewhere between 5-6 hrs to download. I have no reason why it kept restarting as no messages ever came up to indicate there was a problem. it is only because BigFish is one of the top game makers for this genre that I didn't call to get a refund while this was all going on.as for the game, it is a fun one to play. it has nice graphics, a fun storyline and a decent mix of ho scenes and puzzles. the ho scenes progressively get more challenging (like they can really be that hard at all, right?). the first one is your basic find the items. by the time you get to the last one you are only given 4 items at a time and then you need to use 1 or more of those items to find the next 4 (i.e. use a key to open a lock, or a hammer to smash something). some are matching 2 items at a time, while there are others that are finding 10 items that belong to 2 or 3 categories. there are 5 chapters and a strategy guide is included (which is good since there isn't a skip button for the puzzles, but there is a hint button for the ho scenes). after the first scene you are also given a game journal, which keeps track of your progress and clues needed for puzzles. this also gives you additional info on characters in the game and what your current goals are. it is a good idea to refer to this often as many times when you accomplish one thing it will give you information of things you haven't really done yet.here is where the glitches come it which makes the game loose points. this is probably more of a 3 1/2 star because of the glitches, but I went with the 4 since amazon doesn't let you use half stars. there were times when the game didn't register a touch. although this problem seemed to get better after the game "unlock" feature was used, and also on replay I'm not having as much of an issue with that. I eventually got used to the fact that sometimes you need to hold down on something before you make an action (i.e. for a number lock click and hold on the number before you move it up/down), or in the journal you sometimes need to double click before making the swipe turn action. there was a big glitch when it came to the sounds in the game. you have two options for this 1) music, and 2) sound effects. I turned the music off completely so I can't say anything in regards to that one but for the sound effects nothing seemed to really work. no matter where it was set I had problems. I didn't play the game in one session and every time I re-entered the game the sound was different. I either could barely hear the characters, or they were too loud or made no sounds whatsoever. all that didn't seem to really matter much since what they were saying didn't match at all to what was written (each time a character spoke a caption pop-up showed so you could choose what to ask them next). what was even worse was whenever a cut scene came on the sound went completely up as loud as could be with the devices sound control being disabled. I was glad I wasn't out in public when this happened because it was LOUD! every time you re-enter the game you are asked for a review. this is a pop-up and if you choose "no thanks" you aren't asked again till you re-enter again. however at the end of the game you are asked for a 5 star review. I've said this before, and I am saying this again: whenever a dev asks for a specific kind of rating (positive or 5 star) they will loose a star every time for this unethical practice. one more glitch that I am now getting on the replay is at gideons door the puzzle wasn't working right, and half way through froze up. I had to leave and come back. when I got back the 4 puzzles for the door showed as complete and I got the required doorbell crank, however the door will not open, saying I need to do the door puzzles. so I am replaying again to see what happens.besides the glitches it is a fun game and worth getting in the end. if this changes at all I will update and/or change my rating.

*PLEASE SEE UPDATE BELOW BEFORE DECIDING WHETHER TO PURCHASE BASED ON THE FOLLOWING*I will leave one of my usual more detailed reviews once I have played this game, but I wanted to let people know right from the start that although this is the kindle tablet version it is for the 1rst and 2nd gen only. not compatible with the hd models. with three new games released this week it might take a few days for me to play and update this review, so until then you are on your own to decided. good luck.UPDATE #2: it seems that BigFish has provided an update to this app since it is now available for the hd kindles. when I first purchased it the app was only showing up in the appstore on my 1rst gen, and when I looked at the info on my laptop it said in the top right corner that is was only compatible with the older of my two kindles. well now it is showing up at the appstore on my hd model and it is showing as compatible for both kindles now. I downloaded it on my kindle hd and discovered an interesting tidbit while playing. I played this all the way through on my 1rst gen kindle twice already. but playing it now for the first time on my kindle hd I'm finding several new riddles and items to find that weren't on the list even once while playing on the 1rst gen. it certain is weird, but maybe they added new riddles when they updated the app for the higher end devices. and FYI: I am adding a star to my rating since this is now compatible with all kindlesUPDATE: This is a fun enough game as far as hidden object games go. but, it is just that, a hidden objects game only. don't be fooled into thinking it's a point-click adventure, because it is not. it is better than normal hidden object games go in that you are given riddles to solve to find each object. some riddles hint as to the object themselves, while other hints include clues around the room/scene to help solve what the item is (i.e. "I am sitting next to...). there are about 20 levels with 4-7 scenes and 7-9 objects to find in each scene. in each level you must find all but one item total for that level. there are only about 25 scenes, so they are all repeated several times, with each riddle also repeating throughout the game. this makes the game VERY repetitive and lowers the enjoyment some. after each level there is a picture you need to unscramble. each picture is divided into tiles which need to be turned in order to find the correct position to see what the picture is.this game is one that's fun when you have a few minutes to waste here or there. is it worth $1.99, well play the demo and decide for yourself. with the repetitive factor I might have only paid $.99, but some might decided it's worth the extra cost since everything is in riddle form and not just "find these items on the list"

bigfish is going to keep me busy with three new games this week. as for this one, it is right up there as one of the best. playing on a kindle hd, the graphics are wonderful. perfect mix of puzzles and ho scenes. for the ho scenes you need to find a rune stone in each one to change some objects over to more modern versions (for example you might need to change a whisk to a blender). those items are listed in a blue color. there are also items listed in yellow, which means you have to do something to uncover them first (like open a door or something). the puzzles are challenging and fun, with a skip button for those who might need it. not only do you need to pick up items for puzzles and other stuff, you also need to find pages for your "grimore" (sp?, a help book you are given at the beginning of the game), talking crystals, clock gears, and roses (collect the roses for achievements). it was a longer game and with all the daily distractions thrown in it took me two days to finish (if you only have an hour or so a day it will take you much longer). there are different game modes to play in if you want either an easier or more challenging game play. the story line is a new one, where you have to fix an eternal clock to fix the worlds time line, which is unraveling and combining as it winds down (hence the need to convert items in the ho scenes).This is one I highly recommend getting as it is tied with others as the top/best games to play in this genre. you will enjoy.

The game constantly nags you not only to leave a review, but to leave a 5 star review. Sorry devs, but you will loose a star every time for tactics like that. Plus for 3 semi-short levels $4.99 is a little much. Other than that it is a good game. New and interesting story line. Nice help and skip buttons when needed. The graphics look great on the kindle fire hd. Sometimes the game didn't always register a touch when picking up or placing inventory items. There are some nice puzzles, and while there weren't any ho scenes per say there are some rooms where you are given a list of inventory items you need for the game. In all a pretty good game where you can decide for yourself if you want to spend the money or not. The "free" demo part of the game ends just a little before the first section of the game ends, if that helps in deciding. Enjoy.

So, the FAOTD is yet another from the vast selection of word games. as the game description says, the goal for this game is to create one word for each length from 2-6 letters all within the 5 minute time limit and trying to get the highest score possible. when you start a game, the letters are scrambled on a pyramid shaped board with 2 letters on the top row and obviously on down to the bottom row containing 6 letters. to play you switch letters until you successfully have the five rows filled with correctly spelled words, or until you run out of time (there is also the option to "give up" but you forfeit your score in doing so). for scoring, each letter is given a separate number value listed on its tile (just like scrabble tiles) and each row of complete words are added up then timed by the word length, with the number of seconds left added on if you complete the game before the time is up. for example for my first game the top row spelled "HE" with the H having a value of 12 and E with a value of 3. so with it being a two letter word the score for the row was 12+3=15 and 15x2=30. I had 2 minutes and 43 seconds left on my time since I finished early so 163 was added to my sore. there aren't any bells and whistles in the game to make it stand out from all the other countless word games out there. in the settings the only options are for the music and sound. on the main menu there are 5 options: 1)new game, 2)how to play, 3)credits, 4)5 stars...pretty please (not sure what it is for exactly since when chosen a pop-up for the app store appears), and 5)buy the board game (which takes you to their web page). in the corner there is an icon for "award" which takes you to a page titled "badges". this shows you your top winning streaks, fastest times, and highest scores. the badges only show limited info, such as a ribbon for the streaks, 4:00 down to 1:00 for the time (no actual seconds are displayed on the badge), and the scores showing as 600+, 700+ etc. to get your specific info you have to click to another page with icons for the 3 types of badges where specific info for the top 5 are listed on each page. that's everything in a nutshell.would I recommend this game? if you can catch it while it's the FAOTD it's an OK enough of a game if you want something easy to do while waiting in a long line or in a doctors office, etc. but paying the regular price of $1.99, I would say your money could be spent elsewhere. I would also like to point out that IAP is not listed anywhere in the games description, but, as I said earlier, there is the option on the main menu (5 stars...pretty please?) which takes you to the app store for something. but, credit should also be given to the devs for not weighing down the game with all the annoying links for facebook and "game circle" type listings to spam all your friends with "look what I scored on this word game". although there is the permission for network access this is for the option which takes you to their web page and the game can be played with your wifi turned off.Edited to add this: some people are already complaining that this was already offered as the FAOTD 18 months ago and feel cheated that they aren't getting something new for free today. well, 1) not everyone devotes their life to checking the FAOTD every day and might have missed this one (or any other apps that are recycled in the FAOTD program), and 2)there are plenty of new people to amazon that most of the recycled apps are being offered for the very first time for them (even ones offered only a year ago). got over it and just wait for what tomorrow might bring.

There are a lot of songs to choose from, but they are the very basic of melodies. I've even noticed a wrong note here and there. There are some good options as far as the app goes. You can change the speed, the number of notes played, whether to play one or multiple keys at a time, and many more. But as a player I would NOT recommend this as even with the basic melody shown to you it's never the whole song. You might get a verse but not the chorus (or vice versa). For those having trouble hearing what they play go to the options and turn off the "pressure".

of the game apps my favorite genre is the ho/point-click adventure type. the younger kids enjoy helping me with the ho scenes. so, when I can, I get the game apps that are nothing but ho scenes for them. This company is one of the better ones for this type so I always try to snag them when one of them show up as the FAOTD. while they don't have any kind of bells or whistles that set them apart it's a good game for what it is. the items you are looking for are all clearly seen (nothing hiding behind so many other objects you can't tell what it is, or hiding off the edge of the screen). there is background music, which I always find annoying, but you can turn it off. if you care for that sort of thing there is a score and timer. these seem to carry over from one level to the next, so I'll assume the goal of the whole thing is to finish all 16 levels as quick as you can. In all I wouldn't stop getting these for the FAOTD.

First off, the game description is that this is a new kind of crossword style of game. But, let me be clear, this is the game of CODEWORDS, which has been around for a very long time. I get 10-15 variety word puzzle games that can be found in just about every checkout around the world (popular publishers are PennyPress and Dell). So, I think it is safe to say that I have played this enough to know this isn't any kind of "new" game these devs have come up with on their own. Basically you are given what would look like a completed crossword puzzle, but any shared letters of words are deleted and you need to figure out what those are. you are not given any clues. let me also tell you that there are two different types of Codeword. one being that you use each letter once, and only once (so there are only 26 blank squares to fill in). another version is, obviously, each letter can be used in more than one location (in this version each letter corresponds with a number which is placed in the square so you can more easily figure out what letter to use where). This game if the first of those two versions.Now, on to the review of the game. it starts out by letting you pick between 4 difficulty modes, ranging from 30-60 games in each mode. after playing the first game you are asked if you want to unlock a "free bonus puzzle" by posting your score to facebook. you have the option of clicking yes or no and also include with your answer to not be asked this again (which I certainly chose, because seriously who wants to spam all your friends with a stupid word puzzle score). you can change the settings by clicking on your devices menu/options icon (I'm using the kindle fire hd, so for me I had to click on the middle icon that is commonly described as the "notebook paper" icon). The first option is to NEVER post to facebook, next you can hide completed puzzles, show timer, or change colors in the game. the settings seem to be backwards. for example, with the first one titled "use facebook?" it says "never offer to post scores and achievements", but after I clicked that setting I was still asked about posting my score when I finished my next game. I once again clicked to never be asked that again, and when going back to settings the option was unclicked. so what the settings seem to be is the title is a question and the answer to that question is to click it for "yes" and leave it blank for "no". I hope that makes sense and helps at least some. if you need help during a game you have two options. the first is the "hint" button which gives you the answer to a specific square (with a 30 second penalty if you care about the score and/or timer). the second option is to click "audit" which will show you any correct choices you've made so far (also with a timing penalty of 1 minute).That's it for the game. a pretty basic word game normally called codewords. no "bells or whistles" to make this stand out from any other of the many codeword games on the market. instead you get the annoyance of the option to spam your facebook friends and the constant option to buy more games in the "new and unique series of word games"
